With its firm fine pored head luminous gold and clear gleaming look it cannot fail to awaken expectations of pure pleasure Strong malty nuances and floral hoppiness are imbued with accents of slight fruitiness Despite its strength Bergbock is pleasantly mouthcoating with powerful but unobtrusive body highly discrete finely bitter hoppiness transforms into slight honey sweetness to conclude on soft harmonious aftertaste harmonious light bock of character that cannot be put down after the first drink

Voku Hila is strong lager developed and brewed by Local Option Bierwerker This helles bock is golden in color with large creamy persistent white head aromatically driven by robust toast and bread notes derived from continental European pale malts with moderate spice from noble German hops Voku Hila will be appreciated by lager and mullet enthusiasts alike
First introduced at FredFest The brewery first lager is named for brewer Alan Sprints mother Lila Sprints calls the beer pale bock Lagered for weeks Dry hopped with spicy Noble Saaz

From the Brewery website Fruehbock pron Froo Bock Literally Early Bock Frueh is also short for Fruehling which is the German word for Spring Try our Spring Bock as the cold winter fades and the warm spring winds begin to blow This deep golden slightly malty bock beer comes in at ABV which you ll find hard to believe because it so smooth and refreshing Don wait to try it because like springtime in Charlotte this seasonal will come and go quickly Note Früh Frueh

While not an officially recognized animal in Virginia Cougars have reported being spotted within the Commonwealth And much like its namesake Turbo Cougar is pale strong and graceful Turbo Cougar is Blonde Bock with clean bready notes deep golden hue full body and lager drinkability If you spot one in the wild or marketplace you will be rewarded Once again the cougar is on the prowl

This beer has very full and complex flavor that is best enjoyed slowly allowing the different flavors time to develop on your tongue You will find that it changes as you progress from the first taste to the lingering finish The malty sweetness is well balanced and blended with hop bitterness giving full rich blend of flavors generous quantity of pilsner malt is joined with little bit of caravienne for color and some carapils for body along with plenty of Munich malt for flavor and aroma This beer is lightly hopped with Yakima Perle and German Hallertau The traditional symbol for bock beers of all varieties is the billy goat This is the reason that Free State named this Maibock after Dr John Brinkley k The Goat Gland Doctor In s Kansas Brinkley gained notoriety for his alleged cure for infertility that involved the surgical implantation of goat glands in the affected individuals Some farmers are even said to have brought along there own goats because they felt them to have superior sexual prowess

We dry hopped this beer with full cone saphire hops from the Mühlviertel to produce the fine clean hop aromas of mild tropical fruits you ll find in the glass Behind the dry hopping and new name lurks the ever beloved Hofstetten Christmas Bock Along with the heathy additions of Magnum Aurora and Select in the boil this bock was also dry hopped in our lager keller This means we stuffed as many full cone hops fresh from the fields as we could into lager tank and filled the rest of the space with our bock beer The beer was then left to mature for two months before it was once again enriched with hop oils To preserve all the wonderful flavors developed during the process this beer goes directly into bottles without filtration Light golden in color with mild cloudiness our Saphir Bock shimmers tantalizingly in the glass The floral hop aromas harmonize perfectly with the warm ester notes When taken to the nose you may make out hints of mandarin lychee and ripe pears On the tongue you ll immediately be struck by the full bodiedness As it moves back across the palate the hop notes open up revealing themselves in all their glory in the finish The pleasant fruity bitterness travels up the throat across the palate and into the nose where it is greeted once again by the sweet ester notes of the yeast This constant play between full bodied maltiness and floral hoppiness ensures an unforgettable drinking experience

Rich Amber bock beer brewed with imported Munich and Pilsner Malts and fermented with rare lager yeast This beer has deep malt character and body with hint of toffee in the aroma The Noble hops balance the richness of the malts and provide complex profile that hides the abv

Maibocks are Bavarian beer style Bocks are strong German style lagers and can range from light to dark Maibocks are typically golden to light amber They were served in the Spring to celebrate the end of winter The Bavarian mayor burgermeister traditionally taps the first keg Hizzoner Maibock is golden full bodied lager that has been extensively lagered to develop sweetness and crispness of character

The recipe for this light unfiltered lager bock beer uses German sauermalt organic Montana Spitz malt Pilsener malt plus three hoppings using Hallertauer Perle and the rare Tettnang aroma hops both imported from Germany

When Duke Erich handed Martin Luther mug of Einbecker Beer at the Worms Reichstag in the year Martin Luther called out the best drink known to man is called Ainpöckisch Beer His love to Katharina von Bora and to Ainpöckisch Beer was also shown at his wedding in Wittenberg when the council of the town of Wittenberg presented him barrel of Einbecker as gift Already after his disputation in Leipzig in the year the council of the town of Wittenberg did welcome him by jar of Einbecker Beer

Festive Bock with Spices Winter Lager rich malt notes and accents of cinnamon ginger and orange peel are just the right companion for decking the halls your holiday table your fridge your hand You get the picture no matter what or how you celebrate do it with Winter Lager

Tip back bock Brewed with rich roasted barley malt and German specialty hops this lightly hopped American styled dark lager always goes down easy Originally seasonal beer fans have demanded it year round since
Rich DecadentThis rich decadent bock has big malty character with the added sweetness of chocolate Extended aging on bed of cocoa nibs imparts smooth complex flavor and velvety finish
Michelob AmberBock is brewed using malt including dark roasted black and caramel malts and all imported hops
Munich and various roasted malts give it very malty rich flavor with hint of burnt flavor imported Hallertau hops moderate bitterness and aroma

An authentic copper colored German style Bock celebrating the coming of spring This big deeply flavored lager has been aged to create smooth malty taste with hint of sweetness light addition of German hops balances the malt flavor

Formerly Genesee Bock BeerOur take on the th century German legend has turned out to be legend in its own right For every spring since our brewery has carefully crafted and lagered Genesee Bock Beer The result is an exceptionally hearty full flavored beer with slight malty finish and perfect way to celebrate the snow melt

At the first sip it is smooth and full bodied at the second sip the true rich strong roasted malt aroma of Einbecker Ur Bock unfolds The dark barley malt brewed refreshment from the Einbecker original recipe

This unique seasonal product is the world only Trappist bock ale Brewed exclusively with natural ingredients this ale post ferments slightly in its bottle It has deep red colour an intensely rich taste and malty aroma Aromatic hop varieties and types of burnt malt render this ale its delicate bitterness that blends surprisingly well with its slightly sweet undertone

Each year the promise of spring was confirmed as the first keg of Schell Bock rolled onto waiting delivery wagons And since Schell Bock has continued in the true German tradition Completely reformulated for Schell Bock has replaced Caramel Bock as our late winter seasonal Brewed with harmonious blend of different types of malt and noble hops Schell Bock is fermented slowly and then lagered for an extended period of time to ensure smooth finish Perfect for passing even the coldest winter day This dark amber colored beer sports robust malt character

Molasses is the secret to this Lager and creates pleasant sweetness with hints of caramel brown sugar vanilla and maple syrup The pale and caramel malts merge with Hersbrucker and Saaz hops to create delightfully toasted flavor in this bock

Just in time for the holidays is our special treat dark and chewy bock beer Around November you ll find chocolate bock on tap down at the brewery No other beer has more pure and intense malt character as true Bock Many large breweries in the S have diluted the original strength of this beer but we make the real thing The body of this beer is rich making it good beer to warm up to during those special Iowa winters The blackened malt that we use in it gives the brew slight hint of chocolate Its smooth brew having been lagered for over month in our cellars in true bock style IBU

Saranac Chocolate Lager is sinfully delicious deep amber lager made with certified organic cacao from Belize Our brewers looked far and wide for the highest quality cacao to create smooth chocolaty taste that only comes from the most exclusive cacao plants We used the roasted seeds of these decadent plants and perfectly paired them with caramel malt and German Hallertau hops to create malty chocolate sweet flavor You ll love savoring this beer with your favorite holiday foods or on its own for delicious treat IBU
A German style lager our Bock carries brownish color medium body and mouthwatering smoothness from the wonderful malt flavor

Bock beers gained notoriety in Munich back in All the Bavarian nobles were drinking fashionable northern ales known as Einbeck Bier So Duke Maximillian of Munich hired his own northern brewmaster who created lager similar in character but superior in taste It won back the local aristocrats Inspired by his entrepreneurial spirit we started brewing our own urBock rich ruby hued beer with subtle dark roasted flavours It an aristocratic beer but rest assured you needn be Duke to enjoy it IBU
It a dry hopped California Common with massive malt character rounded out by bitter balance from some experimental hops from the Yakima Valley this beer will leave you saying ll be bock

From the brewery Battlefield Bock is smooth and creamy Bavarian Style Bock Lager It is brewed with our proprietary blend of Bavarian Dark Roasted Malts giving it distinct taste with hints of coffee and chocolate We add Noble Czech Saaz Hops to balance the flavor of this rich full bodied lager Battlefield Bock is slow cold aged for minimum of weeks

CHOUFFE BOK is seasonal beer brewed especially for the Netherlands The Bok beers traditionally appear on the Dutch market at the end of September CHOUFFE BOK stands out thanks to its coppery robe its fresh fruity nose and pleasant roundness in the mouth ending with hint of bitterness
Also known as Christoffel Bock

The first time Gary tried this beer he got so excited he pooped his pants on the spot This lager is malt forward full bodied and finishes smooth and creamy Rich and complex our traditional Munich style Bock features seven types of chocolate and cocoa nibs added to both the boil and the fermentor
Aged in Heaven Hill bourbon barrels

Formerly Schneider Aventinus day rewardFor golden moments by the fireplace Mein Aventinus the wholehearted dark ruby coloured wheat beer intensive and fiery warming well balanced and tender Bavaria oldest wheat Doppelbock brewed since Its sturdy body in combination with its sweet malty aroma is an invitation to profound indulgence an ingenious blend with strong body Perfectly matches rustic dishes dark roasts and sweet desserts Hallertauer Herkuleswheat malt barley maltopen fermentation genuine bottle fermentationnon filtrated non pasteurized IBU l carbon dioxide original gravity

Our light coloured spicy single bock Vitus is saturated with fine yeast and creamy foam It is specialty with round character based on the extra long storage time The fruity smell of dried apricots joins aromas of citrus cloves and hints of banana Full bodied and sparkling with an effervescent mouthfeel Thus the Vitus does not taste like typical Bock beer but more like noble fruity wheat beer Perfect with red meat strong cheese and also able to guide desserts Brewed according to our centuries old brewing tradition on the Weihenstephan hill

Schneider version This brew is the result of the long friendship of Brooklyn brewmaster Garrett Oliver and Schneider brewmaster Hans Peter Drexler Garrett had always admired the delicate balance of flavors in Schneider Weisse while Hans Peter had long enjoyed the effusive hop character of Brooklyn East India Pale Ale and BLAST Garrett concept for the collaboration was that each brewmaster would brew essentially the same pale hoppy weissbock in the other brewery but with different hopping to reflect the local hop flavor Dry hopped Hallertauer Saphir
This special brew was designed with the help of our Freistaat Bayern brothers who also built the brewhouse upon which we brewed it It a new twist on an old tradition

Do not waste time attempting to box this brew into some esoteric guide to styles This is Dan bold creation His passion for unfiltered Weiss collides with Cascade Hops inventing our Imperial Hefe Weizen Dry hopping boldly rules over Wisconsin red wheat and our special strain of Bavarian yeast At almost P this is the super mac daddy of Weiss beers Decoction mashing was followed by excessive dry hopping to create fierce onslaught of clove cinnamon and citrus all in this living beer Don bother waiting to enjoy the time is now

ERDINGER Pikantus is already legend during the strong beer season But with its complex symphony of aromas it also stimulates the taste buds making it perfect aperitif With an ABV of and an original wort of this bock beer is ERDINGER Weissbräu strongest contender For true Bavarian aperitif divide bottle of ERDINGER Pikantus between two connoisseur glasses with its dark color and smooth creamy head Pikantus is already feast for the eyes The flavor that develops on the palate is well rounded and malty with hint of nutmeg and fine nougat The sparkling nature of ERDINGER Pikantus harmonizes perfectly with its slightly sweet character as well as its soft and delicate finish

Rich creamy head with bouquet of Wheat malt black current clove and apple Deep full flavors of caramel and chocolate malt balance with hops for smooth warming character Smooth malt leads to subtle alcohol and dark caramel finish The wonderful balance of this beer provides complex profile hiding the alcohol content The perfect companion for cold winter night

TAP Aventinus and Aventinus Eisbock mature for several months in French Oak Chardonnay barrels before they are united to an uncomparable sic cuvée The maturation in these barriques brings berry like and pleasantly sour aromas to this elegant and quiet beer thrilling transformation of its famous beer of origin We use different barriques every year and thus the influence of the aromas varies every year and makes each batch unique Enjoy TAPX Aventinus Barrique with rich beef or venison dishes with desserts like vanilla ice cream and chocolate tart or rich blue cheese
Original Gravity PlatoBitterness IBU Color EBCAwarded with WORLD BEER CUP MEDALS

A dark wheat beer hearty and top fermented inspired by the style traditionally brewed in Munich Germany This Weizenbock will seduce you with its lush flavors reminiscent of candied fruits banana and maple syrup

If you look closely you can imagine the magic of the dusk light on the mountains reflected in the amazing color of this brew Unfiltered with foggy appearance and light aromas of wheat bubblegum clove and spice Finishes silky smooth Take sip and set your mind aglow

This is our take on German wheat bock but with small twist We brew this ABV holiday offering with orange blossom honey malted wheat and dark Munich malt hint of Chocolate malt and German Hallertau and Tettnanger hops While most German bock beers named with the or ending are traditional double bock lagers we decided to break from tradition bit with not only the name of this beer but the use of orange blossom honey as well Prost

Weiss Principal is the international love child of German Hefe Weisse and an American Double IPA This unfiltered wheat beer employs traditional German Weiss yeast providing engaging banana and clove flavors stern dry hopping of pungent American hops provides pronounced citrus pine fruit notes
Our Weizen Dopplebock is dominated with wheat that imparts nutty bisquit flavour It is complimented with Perle and Hersbrucker hops IBU
Weizenbock aged in an Buffalo Trace Bourbon Barrel barrel

Since we brew beer in the Bavarian tradition at Bayern which means Bavaria in German our list of beer styles would not be complete without our most recent addition Face Plant Doppelweizen This top fermented unfiltered Wheat Bock beer is the counterpart to Bayern famous Doppelbock Lager and is decoction brewed technique used often in Bavaria but seldom in the US The recipe uses five types of malt Wheat Pilsener Carmel Munich and Chocolate and has an g of Plato producing stout Alc by Vol As with all Bayern wheat beers Face Plant surprises with its complex flavor German Hallertauer Perle hops give this hearty Bock beer perfectly balanced sweetness

Beau Dunkel Buck is brewed in the Dunkel Weizenbock style strong dark version of traditional Bavarian wheat beer This cloudy dark and unfiltered wheat beer displays intriguing clove and banana aromas The flavours follow while adding in chocolate and mocha undercurrent The beer finishes dry with slightly tart spiciness and the alcohol is moderately warming IBU

An interpretation of typical Bavarian wheat refined with little bit more hops and the intense aroma of our very own wheat beer yeast Bold and surprising Typical but yet so different Deep notes of black currant play well with hints of oriental spices tasty treat for all occasions

This Maifest special is sweet soothing and deceptive delight So much so that it may deceive thy sight Should you start to see visions of Elf King fame heed the warnings from where this beer gets its name Spelled out clearly in the Goethe poem Hold on tight to loved one and head for home

Honored as one of the World best Weizenbock beers The Weizenbock from the Ladenburger brewery which exists since and is now managed by Karl Friedrich Ladenburger in the th generation is beer that has received multiple awards from the World Beer Cup It is classic top fermented golden yellow strong beer which is fermented traditionally in the bottle The foam is particularly fine pored very stable and creamy In appearance one finds strong golden yellow color with beautiful natural haziness The smell is fruity with trace of banana flavor In the first sip this beer specialty is balanced full bodied sparkling and rounded the malt character is balanced and aromatic In the aftertaste it is very mild and makes you want another sip especially so on cold winter days

Aged in Jamaican rum barrels this year Gingerbread Weizen Doppelbock offers spicy clove like notes from German weizen yeast The hops blend harmoniously with heavy doses of Caramel and Aromatic malts Actual gingerbread was used during the brewing process to give this special offering subtle holiday infused taste
A dark wheat bock beer The addition of NH maple syrup in the fermenting beer creates complexity unknown in most beers
TX Red Wine Black Sour Wheat Beer
This blend of barrel aged and fresh ale presents more quaffable version of our weizenbock
Braggot ale brewed with honey chamomile natural flavors

Akin to barley wine we suggest this ale as an after dinner drink It has truly unique sophisticated flavor due to the use of wildflower honey as the catalyst for the production of alcohol We simply use pale malt and very small amount of Target hops in this Belgian style ale The bulk of the body color and sweetness come from the lbs of honey we add to the boil The Brother is cellared for up to year before it is bottled which helps to marry the flavors and create the complex palate in this Bragget

Exit is the gateway to lot of farmland so we re using one the state favorite crops blueberries Braggot is an ancient style written about since the th century This Braggot features local blueberries and honey very limited amount of hops and is fermented with Belgian style yeast The result is straw colored beer with blueberry highlights On the first sip you will note light sweetness along with citrus notes followed by well rounded malt character The beer has medium full body

Braggot is mead and beer combined this batch won the Bronze medal at GABF one of only three medals given to Michigan breweries in the state This batch was made with Michigan Wildflower mead and Scottish Ale Frank and Eric collaborated to make this award winning mead

Rye saison with sage and lavender fresh from our horticultural area added to the coolship and then again dry herbed with more fresh sage and lavender blended with South African Sweet Mead matured in wine barrels
A special blend of cider malt and honey then delicately spiced with ginger
Our braggot medieval ale style is brewed with pounds of honey which imparts unique sweetness golden full bodied robust ale with just enough hops to balance its sweet side
Grandis Hydromelita is our blended braggot from various ales matured in oak barrels from several months to three years South African Coffee Mead that was matured in wine barrels Blend Blend
A spritz and tart raspberry honey ale
Styled after traditional Kolsch this is an interpretation of medieval Braggot an ale fermented with honey

An exquisite imperial honey ale with deep copper hue and sweet malt flavor balanced by hints of clove chocolate and honey Be careful when sneaking sip that you don get stung by this venomous brew at ABV it sure to create buzz Pours deep copper with nose of malt caramel and honey Boozy flavors of clove honey and chocolate mute the hop note until the end when it finishes with nice tightness
Chang style malt beverage brewed with rice honey fruits and botanicals Brewed in collaboration with The Field Museum

Coming ashore to destroy the land of its senses Eirik Bloodaxe brings an ancient viking beer recipe and merges it with Double IPA to create unique ale fit for King With the addition of natural honey and blood oranges Eirik Bloodaxe will wreak havoc with your consciousness Grab goblet or horn and fill it with this one of kind Ale
This is our Texas Honey Ale recipe fermented with Belgian style yeast The yeast brings spicy notes that are subtle and stone fruit that blend perfectly with the honey
Hoppin Honey Braggot is modern take on an ancient beer style As much mead as it is beer expect bold malt body with sweet honey finish Made with Artie Harvest Washington honey
A unique ale brewed with Colorado grown hops We blended an Imperial Stout English Mild and infused an overwhelming amount of honey for your enjoyment

Ishikawa Goemon was th century Japanese Robin Hood figure who stole gold from the rich and gave to the peasants He failed to assassinate brutal warlord and was sentenced to boil alive in large cauldron We boil this beer in our large cauldron in his honor IBU
Mexcal barrel aged braggot
Slight tart berry fruit up front fading quickly into sweet honey malt flavors

Who afraid of the big bad BRETT We ll tell you who winemakers Because of our close proximity to several hundred wineries we often get winemakers visiting our brewery After all it takes lot of great beer to make great wine Because we use Brettanomyces yeast to ferment Sanctification most winemakers will only smell the glass and only very few will venture to taste the beer They think the Brettanomyces will attach to their clothing and end up in their winery simple solution was offered keep smudge pot burning at the door of our brewery so they can burn their clothes when exiting but even that was not enough After giving it more thought we concluded that winemakers think Brettanomyces might scar their taste buds and possible even permeate their skin Either way Sanctification is one of the most unique beers you will ever taste It was fermented with Brettanomyces rather than the traditional Saccharomyces

It arguable that our menacingly delicious HopDevil has always been wild With bold German malts and whole flower American hops this India Pale Ale is anything but prim But add touch of brettanomyces the unruly beast responsible for the sharp tang and deep funk found in many Belgian ales and our WildDevil emerges completely untamed Floral aromatic hops still leap from this amber ale as host of new fermentation flavor kicks up notes of citrus and pine Pour yourself glass today if you dare

Midnight Brett is chocolate brown in color brewed with Row Midnight wheat raw wheat and rye malt It was hopped with blend of Perle Glacier and Simcoe hops The beer was fermented with our house strain of Brettanomyces in stainless tanks The finished beer has the aroma and flavor of fresh berries sour cherries and slight roasted character The finish is pleasantly tart and fruity making this beer very drinkable

Serenity is our aptly named brettanomyces fermented beer Light in color with subtle golden haze the nose bursts of white grape mango pineapple and old leather The flavors are similar to those found in New Zealand white wines and notes of guava and grape skin stand out leading to well rounded finish Serenity won the Great American Beer Festival Gold Medal for American Style Brett Beer in

Dark sour ale aged in Leopold Bros whiskey barrelsA demonic dark sour Nightmare on Brett takes on many facets during its transformation to the sour side Initially aged in large oak foeders with our mixed culture of wild yeast and bacteria this beer is then transferred to bourbon and whiskey barrels The various spirit barrels bring on new life to this beer as it conditions for months while obtaining additional bourbon and whiskey characteristics Dominated by dark fruit aromas and flavors the underlying cacao notes meld with an acidic tart berry finish With each batch release being unique blend of barrels the multiple variations of Nightmare on Brett released throughout the year prove that with creativity and experimentation anything is possible
Aged in French Chardonnay Barrels Brett

This IPA is spiked at bottling with Brettanomyces wild yeast that over time brings about charmingly unpredictable complexities of spice funk acidity and more The operative words in our beer cellaring thesis are over time For those of you who are impatient or like to experiment the earliest we recommend sampling this beer is one year before the date on the label The beer won be fully carbonated until that date Ideally you ll want to cellar the beer up to or beyond the Enjoy After date to help it reach its full evolutionary potential At that point some facets of the Brett characteristics will have mellowed while others will have become more profound it all matures into fascinating and delicious culmination Individual results will vary and that both the beauty and the intent behind this beer
Collaboration with Grassroots BrewingIndia pale ale brewed with wheat and fermented with brettanomyces

To take up the challenge and make true Brett beer can very easily become fatal attraction for the Brewmaster Once you get acquainted with Brett irresistible seductive alluring and very charming nature it will ensnare you and drive you to the point of obsession to create the desirable tangy funky tart flavor in ya mouth

Golden Brett is dark golden colored beer brewed with Victory Row and Red Wheat malt It was lightly hopped with blend of Northern Brewer and Simcoe hops The beer started it primary fermentation in stainless tank and finished fermentation in gallon oak foudre The finished beer has fruity nose and flavors of citrus apricot and bread crust The mild tartness of the beer gives way to long clean finish

Little Brett is both hopped and dry hopped with Mosaic hops and is completely fermented in stainless with our house strain of Brettanomyces yeast Little Brett is hazy straw colored beer featuring an aroma bursting with pineapple and notes of bread crust Pineapple continues through the flavor with additional notes of fresh cut grass mild tartness in the finish is nicely balanced with pleasant hop bitterness

To take up the challenge and make true Brett IPA with Yuzu fruit can very easily become fatal attraction for the Brewmaster Once you get acquainted with the Yuzu fruits irresistible and seductive personality along with Bretts overpowering alluring and very charming nature it will ensnare you and drive you mad obsessing over how exactly you can create the perfect desirable tangy funky crisp tart flavor in ya mouth

St Bretta is our Brettanomyces Whitebier that was just released this week Not only is St Bretta an evolution of Wild Wild Brett Orange but also it will be ever changing depending on the fresh citrus available that season For our spring release we decided to brew St Bretta with fresh Minneola Tangelo Each seasonal release of St Bretta will have diverse range of citrus fruit added to keep the beer fresh and exciting
A collaboration with New Belgium Brewing Bretta Ale This beer was packaged with live yeast and will continue to develop and mature with time Age for up to years
Brett Black IPA
A new version of Evil Twin classic brett fermented P feauring Sudachi an Asian citrus for nice citrusy note
Dark sour ale aged in Leopold Bros whiskey barrels with raspberries

For this special release we set out with the goal of making beer where every ingredient and process contributed to one ambition creating layers of apricot flavor Brettanomyces yeast creates tropical and stone fruit flavors in the barrel which we matched with small mountain of San Joaquin Valley apricots and finished with delicate dry hop of aromatic hops From the yeast to the fruit to the hops every aspect of this beer adds apricot flavor and aroma resulting in delicious wild ale
Dark sour ale aged in Leopold Bros whiskey barrels with cherries

Waymaker leads you down the familiar IPA path but soon diverges toward new horizons of green vibrant flavor fermentation with undomesticated Brettanomyces yeast creates fruity tropical flavors delicately balanced with subtle background of funk and juicy American Centennial Glacier and Chinook hops to refresh in any season

Paying homage to our favorite yeast St Bretta is fermented with our house mixed culture of Brettanomyces From its historic significance in old world beers to this the new age of Brett we embrace this yeast as focal point in our artisan brewery re imagination of early farmhouse saisons brewed in Europe St Bretta combines fresh citrus characteristics with yeast driven tropical fruit flavors and aromas Unfiltered and naturally wild we package each can with small amount of yeast to maintain maximum freshness for wherever life adventures take you

During transport overseas early India Pale Ales were stored in wooden barrels In these barrels beer experts suppose some ales were naturally inoculated with Brettanomyces form of wild yeast Brett IPA plays off this piece of brewing lore by pairing Brettanomyces yeast that exhibits itself as ripe fruit rather than strong funk or sourness with multiple varieties of fruit forward hops Aromas of citrus pineapple and passion fruit meld into tropical flavors that pair nicely with the beer lightly hopped body Maris Otter Munich malts and raw wheat balance the floral barrage of Bravo Cascade Amarillo Centennial Citra and Galaxy hops By finishing with mix of pleasant bitterness and tropical fruit Brett IPA ushers brewing history into the present

Strong Wild Ale Once Liberal Party politician in the K the Viscount Esher aka Reginald Brett left strong impression on his native England as this latest offering from Barrelworks will leave with you Yet another Barrelworks creation with DBA roots this beer begins as Double DBA and is selectively matured in bourbon barrels for several months further months of secondary fermentation and additional maturation in French and American oak barrels creates unparalleled depth and complexity This hefty brew is brimming with full spectrum of flavors and aromas Nutty sherry aromas mingle with Oak then give way to Cointreau like boozy orange zest Tart cherries linger as the acidity builds on the palate Vanilla nutmeg and cinnamon provide supporting cast The whole experience is reminiscent of Manhattan cocktail To be sipped and savored santé
Light tart ale fermented with brett in red wine barrels Dry hopped with Citra and Amarillo
barrel fermented brett beer aged for seven months in neutral oak It funky with mild tartness
Collaboration with OmnipolloWild ale fermented in oak foeders with raspberries and lactose
Barrel fermented ale with our house mixed culture of brett and saccharomyces dry hopped with galaxy and centennial
Brett IPA

Formerly Embrace The Funk Linage TroisA Brettanomyces fermented red ale with raspberries Aged in local Red Wine Barrels that once held Tennessee Whiskey for the perfect combination of three Tennessee lineages
Summon some sunshine with bright notes of citrus and black tea Brett fermented ale with lemon zest and tea
Dry Hopped with Citra Mosaic Lupulin Powder All all new American IPA fermented with Wild Brettanomyces aged in Oak loaded with dank piney American hops Don mind the sediment it just Flavor Dust
Farmhouse ale with Brett Brux DH with Centennial
Dry hopped Belgian style ale bottle conditioned with Brettanomyces

Also known as Indian Brown Dark IPAForget about the car companies this is the original hybrid cross between Scotch Ale an India Pale Ale and an American Brown Indian Brown Ale is well hopped and malty at the same time It magical The beer has characteristics of each style that inspired it the color of an American Brown the caramel notes of Scotch Ale and the hopping regiment of an India Pale Ale We dry hop the Indian Brown Ale in similar fashion to our Minute IPA and Minute IPA This beer is brewed with Aromatic barley and organic brown sugar IBU

An unfiltered unfettered unprecedented brown ale aged in handmade wooden brewing vessels The caramel and vanilla complexity unique to this beer comes from the exotic Paraguayan Palo Santo wood from which these tanks were crafted Palo Santo means holy tree and its wood has been used in South American wine making communities IBU

Ingredients Malts Harrington Klages Munich Hugh Baird Brown Carastan Crystal Crystal Beeston Chocolate Hops Perle and Sterling Specialty Hazelnut Nectar Yeast Water Rogue Pacman Yeast Free Range Coastal Water Plato IBU AA

Tumbler is our take on the classic brown ale full of roasted malt flavor but delicate on the palate and perfect for crisp fall days Layered with notes of chocolate and toasted bread and hint of smoke Tumbler is the ultimate autumn beer so grab seat and watch as the leaves come tumbling down Available in Fall Variety Pack no longer available standalone

A smooth toasty brown ale Best Brown is mainstay in our fall lineup With hints of caramel and cocoa the malt body has the depth to stand up to cool weather but does not come across as heavy This balancing act is aided by the generous use of American hops

It chocolate brown in color with creamy texture malty beer with just enough hop presence to keep it from being too sweet The aroma mostly comes from the malt with hint of spice added by the hops Moose Drool is brewed with pale caramel chocolate and whole black malts and Kent Goldings Liberty and Willamette hops
Old Brown Dog has been cited as classic example of the American Brown Ale style of beer Compared to typical English Brown Ale Old Brown Dog is fuller bodied and more strongly hopped IBU
Bender steeped cold for hours in coarsely ground coffee beans from the Vinca Vista Hermosa plantation in Guatemala
Rich smooth dangerous and chocolatey It a big ol hoppy Imperial Brown Ale to help you with your slippery slide on into the heat of the night

This is the award winning original American brown ale first brewed as holiday specialty and now one of our most popular beers year round Northern English brown ales tend to be strong and dry while southern English brown ales are milder and sweeter Brooklyn Brown Ale combines the best of those classic styles and then adds an American accent in the form of firm hop character and roasty palate blend of six malts some of them roasted give this beer its deep russet brown color and complex malt flavor fruity smooth and rich with caramel chocolate and coffee background Generous late hopping brings forward nice hop aroma to complete the picture Brooklyn Brown Ale is full flavored but retains smoothness and easy drinkability that has made it one of the most popular dark beers in the Northeast
Chocolate malt gives this beer brown sugar maltiness with hints of vanilla and nuts while subtle hopping gives it an overall drinkability that second to none IBUs

Here what happens when substance meets smooth This oatmeal brown ale defies traditional categories Bender begins crisp and lightly hoppy complemented by the velvety sleekness oats deliver Belgian and British malts usher in cascades of cocoa coffee carmel and hints of vanilla and cream An easy drinking ale with many layers of satisfaction

This bold imperial brown ale gets its body from team of malts including Caramel malt for sweetness flaked barley for dense foam bit of Chocolate malt for its deep color and Aromatic and Munich malts to add even more depth German and Perle hops add touch of bitterness to balance the malty sweetness The addition of rich Sumatra coffee takes this perfectly balanced imperial brown ale to decadent level

Koko Brown distinctive nutty aroma and flavor comes from real toasted coconut blended into each brew One sip of this smooth mahogany colored ale and you ll feel like you re on warm sun drenched beach in Hawaii Crack one open

We love well balanced brown ale Especially brown ale of the hazelnut coffee persuasion Case in point Frangelic Mountain Brown Initially brewed and released in bottles in this deliciously sweet and nutty coffee brown ale quickly became favorite amongst beer fans and inspired us to continue pushing the coffee and beer envelope Turns out your new favorite coffee drink is beer

Formerly Pecan Harvest AlePecan Harvest Ale is made with real Louisiana pecans that have been toasted to perfection That makes it something really special because most beers with nutty flavor or aroma aren made with real nuts The natural oils from the Louisiana pecans give the ale light pecan finish and aroma IBU

A touch of Maple Syrup is added to each barrel of our award winning Maple Nut Brown Ale to impart roasted sweetness This addition balances the nut flavor produced by Munich caramel and chocolate malts used in the brewhouse producing drinkable brown ale

Deep in the darkest depths of Rock Lake dwells great saurian known today as Rocky The legend of Rocky is old The ancient inhabitants of Aztalan warned of the beast by building giant serpent mound at the lake edge The early residents of Lake Mills were forewarned of guardian placed in its lake to protect its sacred stone tepees And history tells of numerous encounters with Rocky who became source of great worry and fear Although not seen for over century divers still experience feeling of dread and being watched Enjoy Rocky Revenge our offering to this legendary protector of Tyranena
Single hopped with Citra

At Grand Teton Brewing we are very fortunate to live in one of the greatest places on earth The beauty wildlife mountains clear water and endless activities found right here in our backyard make for an outdoor playground paradise One of these local landmarks is Bitch Creek Similar to the water used in our brewing process Bitch Creek is spring fed and flows out of the west side of the Grand Tetons It a popular playground for kayakers and fishermen alike Bitch Creek American Brown Ale is named for this local landmark Since it become one of the most award winning beers in the industry having claimed gold medals at national events Bitch Creek perfectly balances big malt sweetness and robust hop flavor for full bodied satisfying mahogany ale Like the stream for which it is named our Bitch Creek American Brown Ale is full of character not for the timid SpecificationsMalts Idaho Row malted barley German Melanoidin CaraAmber CaraAroma CaraMunich Hops Galena Chinook and Centennial Original Gravity Plato International Bitterness Units Alcohol by Volume Lovibond Formerly called Bitch Creek ESB Extra Special Brown

Bellaire Brown is our flagship Brown Ale Full flavored with notes of sweet caramel chocolate and toasted malt Bellaire Brown is balanced with mild and earthy hop quality This ale is dark and rich with medium body It hardly classifiable as brown but is certainly considered delicious masterpiece Bellaire Brown was originally created to appeal to people who enjoyed drinking coffee and to beer drinkers who are not interested in hoppy options When Joe Short was creating the Bellaire Brown recipe he desired beer that was meatier and burlier than most browns Bellaire Brown is great gate way beer for drinkers to be introduced to darker beer varieties IBU

George was our grandfather brother and Hill Farmstead Brewery rests upon the land that was once home to him and his siblings George is our American Brown Ale Hopped rightfully so with Centennial Cascade and touch of Columbus

Dirty Little Freak Coconut Caramel Chocolate Brown Ale first brewed in takes the traditional American Brown Ale and gives it sensual new twist Coconut This medium bodied abv brown ale is feast for the senses from its dominant blend of warm roasted malt coconut caramel and chocolate flavors barely restrained by gentle hop bite to its tantalizingly satisfying finish But if you submit to our Dirty Little Freak be warned there is no safe word

The Duck Rabbit Brown Ale is an American brown brewed with loads of hops from start to finish it hoppy and beautifully bitter Amarillo boil hops provide spicy citrusy bitterness Saaz dry hops offer refined flowery aroma These hops are supported by seven varieties of malt The Duck Rabbit Brown Ale is great choice for anyone who appreciates assertive hops and nutty toasted malt flavors oh yeah
An amplified brown ale the beer is brewed with liberal additions of coffee from local San Diego roasters Ryan Brothers and cocoa nibs sourced from famed San Francisco chocolate maker TCHO
Formerly called Hemp Ale

Many Mexican beer styles today are descendants of old Austrian styles from when Austria ruled Mexico in the late th century Our Dos Perros is made with German Munich malt English Pale malt and Chocolate malt and hopped with Perle and Saaz hops To lighten the body as many Mexican brewers do we add small portion of flaked maize The result is wonderfully bready malt aroma balanced with some maize sweetness and noble hop finish IBU

Commemorating the th anniversary of Tommyknocker Brewery this special brew is meticulously crafted with pure maple syrup the highest quality chocolate and crystal malts and is accented with the finest blend of European and American hops Imperial Nut Brown Ale at alcohol by volume is bigger bolder version of their Maple Nut Brown
Imperial brown ale aged in oak whiskey barrels

Peter Brown Tribute Ale is malty American Brown Ale brewed with molasses brown sugar and hopped with Cascade and Centennial It just the way Pete would have wanted it California State Fair GOLD North American Brewers Association GOLD Great American Beer Festival Brown Porter BRONZE Great American Beer Festival Brown Porter GOLD

Barrel Aged Sumatra Mountain BrownUnderground Mountain Brown is the harmonious drinking experience only achieved when our imperial brown ale earthy Sumatra coffee and year aging in caves below Grand Rapids comes together team of malts complement the bold sumatra coffee perfectly while time spent immersed in oak creates layers of depth and complexity celebration of the barrel the bean and everything in between IBU

Good Humans was originally created to showcase one of Briess Malting Company new malt varieties Originally planned as one off beer it quickly became favorite brew Good Humans is Double Brown Ale made with Carabrown Malt and dry hopped with Simcoe and Golding hops The brew has sweet malty esters that are met by huge toasted caramel and toffee flavors The finish is dry with bouquet of hops IBU
Brown ale brewed with peanuts raspberries and strawberries
Imperial Brown Ale This beer is then aged for up to year in used Heaven Hill bourbon barrels

Every year we brew brown ale to celebrate the holidays To make each year special we alter the recipe This year we wrapped caramel and dark fruit malt flavors inside creamy toasty brown ale May your holidays be filled with Festivity
Originally brewed for Boulder Beer th Anniversary An India Brown Ale IBU
Picture custardy French toast infused with cinnamon and vanilla fresh from the griddle and drizzled with warm maple syrup Now picture that in glass Boom Mind blown
A complex yet smooth blend of bold dark malts revealing hints of chocolate coffee and toffee paired with lovely hop character
Based on an English style brown with decidedly American Twist medium body carries flavors of biscuit and caramel while distinct hop bitterness prevails in the finish
Mahogany hued ale infused with coffee vanilla beans and cacao nibs IBU
imperial brown ale aged in whiskey barrels with coffee added

A hoppy brown ale built for winter deepest days Sick Day is knee deep in piney spicy hop flavors and nicely balanced by warming toasty malt presence that ll warm your soul after day in the snow Grab your gear and call out because some days are too good to miss Recipe change from IPA to Hoppy Brown Ale in
A blend of seven unique malts give this brown ale an earthy aroma and flavor reminiscent of caramel with slightly creamy finish

An India Brown Ale Oh me oh my what did we do We fired up the skillet to tossed in sizzling concoction of row Wheat Pale Chocolate Cara Brown and Midnight Wheat then added in hefty dose of hop hash and other dank ish ish ish fixin to scatter smother and cover this baby all the way Resiny citrusy hops spice up the rich chocolate and caramel notes the malt brought to the mix making this platter slide down the counter at IBU Grains Row Wheat Pale Chocolate Cara Brown Midnight WheatHops Mandarina Bavaria Bravo Hop HashABV IBU
Originally brewed as an ESB but is now brewed as an American Brown Ale
Savor the Mystery of the agesThe authentic Belgian Abbey ale Enjoy this delicious malt forward ale accentuated with subtle caramel and roasted notes from dark malts

Name changed from Chambly Noire to Noire de Chambly in Aug This dark ale was created in honour of the brave soldiers of the Carignan Salières Regiment with their famous black musketeer hats In King Louis XIV sent the regiment to New France to defend against the Iroquois He had number of strategic forts including Fort Chambly built along the Richelieu River ensuring peace and prosperity for the colony Many French Canadians are the direct descendants of these intrepid forebears
Our warming winter Ale is amber in color malty and full bodied Belgian yeast provides variety of delicate characteristics in the nose and on the palate
From Pierre Celis brewed at Brouwerij St Bernardus No longer available in the US
Petrus Speciale is an amber coloured high fermentation beer with typical dry aftertaste Brewed according an ancient recipe with special malts this beer gives an mild scent derived from aroma hops

Hive is dark sour ale aged with honey in an oak foudre for eighteen months The beer is deep mahogany in color with aromas of strawberries lemon and tropical fruit notes of dark chocolate raspberries and figs present themselves upon the first sip followed by lingering tartness We brew this beer with blend of dark Munich malt chocolate wheat midnight wheat and roasted barley and hop with Cascade and Northern Brewer Hive undergoes initial fermentation with our house yeast we then transfer the beer to foudre with Brettanomyces bruxellensis and fresh honey from our Allagash beehives Over the course of the next months the Brettanomyces transforms the honey resulting in beer with bold roasty flavors and hint of tropical fruit

Lithuania world famous beer making traditions take their roots in antiquity Lithuanians know their beer and truly appreciate this remarkable potation Today many old families possess unique beer recipes passed down to them from generation to generation
Belgian style Amber Ale
A dark roasty brown ale brewed with organic coconut sugar dark Belgian candied sugar and aged with vanilla bean

D Tango Unchained is Belgian Style Dark Ale brewed with cherries AKA Tango which we then aged in oak barrels with Brettanomyces The result is ABV deep amber brew with ruby highlights Aroma has subtle hints of banana along with tart cherry soft vanilla and oak Not overly sweet tasting yields nice tart cherry and lingering malty flavors that finish dry
Dark Ale fermented with brettanomyces and aged on local fresh raspberries

Solenna pairs the fruitiness of traditional Belgian yeast strain with the subtle spicy character of Brettanomyces and the floral notes of German hops Notes of candy apple cinnamon and fresh cut grass give way to dry finish and firm lingering bitterness
This traditional Belgian style ale is brewed using five malts two hop varieties and authentic Trappist Belgian yeast

Crystal Rye gives HALLOWED blood red hue and smooth dry finish The Belgian style yeast we have used in this brew along with Noble hops combine to deliver complex palate of subtle banana and sweet plum finish IBU
Strong Dark Belgian This swarthy Dubbel is integrated with distinctly porter esque roasted quality our Brettanomyces lambicus yeast strain for an unexpectedly cherry tart finish
Grotten Santé is zesty beer with an alcohol volume of and is made using small quantities of exotic herbs that create slight dryness The beer has chestnut brown colour
A blend of black beers aged in bourbon barrels for over months then infused with coffee vanilla beans and cocoa nibs
IBUCoffees used Intelligentsia PersephoneIntelligentsia El GalloIntelligentsia La Perla de OaxacaIntelligentsia Tres Santos
After much demand for seriously dark beer we came up with this delicacy Black smooth and easy to drink this is our beer for the people abv

A Belgian inspired Black Ale with herbal toasted aroma Medium body smooth texture with bitter chocolate flavor in full support of the Ardennes yeast character Long dry finish turns from sweet to bitter IBU
Also known as Leffe Bière De Printemps
A Belgian style Amber ale with good malt structure faint undertones of chocolate and beautiful copper amber hue This new batch will clock in with moderately strong alcohol and low bitterness levels

Bean Counter is Belgian style Brown Ale brewed with Taxman signature blend coffee from Mile Square Coffee Roastery rich base of caramel and roasted malts is enhanced by generous dose of coffee cocoa nibs and Mexican vanilla beans making Bean Counter complex dark ale perfect for nights around the fire

Formerly Maduro Oatmeal Brown AleMaduro is Northern English style Brown Ale with some American affectations Higher in alcohol than the common English Brown Ale the beer features flaked oats in the malt bill which imparts silky body and works to mesh its roasted toasted and chocolate components together The end result is remarkably full flavored yet approachable Brown Ale that pairs well with mild to medium cigars IBU

Turbodog is dark brown ale brewed with Willamette hops and combination of pale crystal and chocolate malts This combination gives Turbodog its rich body and color and sweet chocolate toffee like flavor Turbodog began as specialty ale but has gained huge loyal following and has become one of our flagship brews IBU

Southern Pecan Nut Brown Ale is the first beer in the world to our knowledge made with whole roasted pecans The pecans are used just like grain and provide nutty characteristic and delightful depth to the flavor profile This beer is very lightly hopped to allow the malty caramel and nutty flavors shine through The color is dark mahogany Southern Pecan won Bronze Medal in the World Beer Cup in the Specialty Beer category IBU

This rich brown ale is redolent with Cuban style roasted espresso beans sweet caramel and toffee and hints of dry nuttiness Cuban Espresso is popular drink in the Cigar City of Tampa owing to its many Sicilian and Cuban immigrants The beans for Cubano Style Espresso Brown Ale are roasted locally by Mazzaro Italian Market and Deli in St Petersburg to our exact specifications IBU
Chocolate color honey and tobacco aromas nutty flavor medium body

Formerly known as Nautical Nut Brown Ale AleSmith Nut Brown is tribute to one of our favorite British styles Deep mahogany in color its rich malt forward flavor profile balances notes of biscuit mild cocoa and earthy hops creamy mouthfeel and full body enhances its drinkability making Nut Brown an extremely sessionable ale that embodies our commitment to quality
This beer is not spiced

The malt bill gives subtle nutty toasty flavors and the chocolate malt provides rich cocoa flavor with aromas that range from roasted coffee to chocolate covered dark fruits The hops used provides excellent bitterness in relation to the chocolate notes of the malt The flavor and aroma provide clean floral fruity and herbal notes light dose of hops brings balance to all

Two of the things Britain is renowned for across the globe are traditional ale and puddings Following the success of Wells Banana Bread Beer comes the latest addition to the exquisitely crafted Wells ales range Wells Sticky Toffee Pudding Ale Wells has been using age old traditional brewing methods to perfect its ales since and Wells Sticky Toffee Pudding Ale is made to those same exacting standards It is brewed with our own accredited Natural Mineral Water and the choicest English ingredients As result it delivers all the satisfying complex taste you expect from true beer but with unique indulgent twist Using traditional British desserts as our source of inspiration we discovered that the natural rich flavours of Sticky Toffee Pudding could be exquisitely combined with darker malts to create truly distinctive ale With toffee and caramel hints and rich fruit aromas Sticky Toffee Pudding Ale is an intensely satisfying beer

The culmination of long growing season the autumn harvest comes once year We mark the end of summer with the release our seasonal brown ale Harvest Vermont maple syrup added during the brewing process yields lasting sweetness on the palate that guaranteed to warm your soul Raise glass and enjoy the spirit of the season Pairs well with wood splitting leaf raking and pumpkin carving In celebration of the autumn harvest we ve brewed this brown ale with locally harvested Vermont ingredients truly unique Taste of Vermont IBU

The Boffo Brown ale is beer that we brewed years ago and then put it in semi retirement for couple years while we focused on other brands at the brewery We have recently put it back onto active duty and are brewing it all year The beer itself is delicious and is favorite to many of us here at the brewery Just as most of our beers it on the full body scale pushing the envelope of what an American Brown Ale is to most people The beer is very deep dark color of brown with nice creamy tan head The mouthfeel of the beer is very soft and is very drinkable Flavors of malt caramel toffee and mild earthy nutty finish allow this beer to be paired with hearty food and sips of bourbon

The genesis of the beer you re holding in your hand was pretty simple We asked ourselves What if beer tasted like an oatmeal raisin cookie The answer to our rhetorical question was to add raisins lactose and cinnamon to Maduro our English style Brown Ale beer that showcases flavors of caramel toffee and chocolate The combination of the base beer and the additional ingredients resulted in beer that tastes like it was baked in Grandma oven IBU

Rugged Trail Nut Brown Ale is back on tap in our Tasting Room for limited time Originally released as Nut Brown Ale Rugged Trail was eventually given makeover and became one of our first year round beers Rugged Trail boasts deep bronze hue rocky head and subtle hop aroma Toasted Amber and Chocolate malts impart rich nutty character and creamy texture making Rugged Trail an obvious quaffing delight ABV and IBU Availability draft and growler fills only

Our most popular beer Legend is full bodied version of British Brown Ale Expect rich malt forward brew with beautiful mahogany tone Generous amounts of specialty malts bring flavors of sweet caramel toasted nuts coffee and molasses all perfectly balanced by steady but cautious hop dryness Fruity undertones provided by our house yeast strain bring the final flavor element to round out this world class ale

The brown ale to end all brown ales Enjoy it because there is no longer any reason to drink another You ve reached the pinnacle healthy blend of traditional British malts give this popular style semi sweet biscuity slightly roasted flavor Oats thicken the mouthfeel and handful of specialty malts add complex chocolate toffee and caramel notes The hops are mostly traditional earthy British hops but we cocked it up bit with some Cascade late in the boil just to show those snooty Brits that we don approve of that Constitutional Monarchy crap

The rich mahogany hue of the Nut Brown is the first thing you will notice You ll find subtle hints of both chocolate coffee We delicately blend chocolate caramel malts with four others to make this flavorful easy drinking beer The malt character will appeal to those looking for moderate dark ale but the smoothness is what will surprise all
Medium bodied with balance of roasted and crystal malts creating hearty nutty flavor Medium bitterness with slightly sweet finish IBU

A good clean nut brown ale with malty body This is our most popular ale due to its smooth and malty flavor We use mixture of pale crystal and black malts in this one and our primary hop is Target though we also add some Whitbread Goldings Variation as well The Real Ale is best fresh so fresh in fact that it great right out of the bright tank

Our Nut Brown Ale starts out very smooth like an English style Brown Ale The use of Chocolate Malt Munich Malt and Hallartau Hops give this beer crisp nutty finish Peak Nut Brown is delectable beer loaded with complex differentiated flavors that don overwhelm the palate making it perfect dark beer for food pairing IBU

Woodmaster is high gravity American Brown Ale fermented with Northern Michigan maple syrup and toasted pecans This dark brown full bodied ale is rich with sweet malt and syrup flavors These flavors are complemented by the presence of hop aromas and faint nuttiness IBU
IBU

Our medium bodied Brown Ale is brewed in the English tradition with an infusion of American creativity The rich malty backbone balances an assertive hop character and ends with smooth dry finish Our Brown Ale boasts dark brown body that supports creamy tan head

Our version of the classic English style Brown Ale has blend of six different malts and hop schedule that results in low hop character The unique malt character brings to mind the taste of blend of various nuts IBU

The Brown Ale style originated in the pubs of England where beer drinkers desired beer that was both flavorful and complex but at the same time mild enough to be session beer The Santa Fe Brewing Company interpretation of this style uses combination of high mash temperature hard water and low alpha acid hops to produce product that is both true to the style and distinctly Santa Fe Brewing jargon aside Santa Fe Nut Brown Ale is an easy drinking beer mild smooth and always favorite
Hops Magnum and WillametteMalts Honey malt Crystall malt and Chocolate maltHoney Alabama Wildflower Mobile AL
A traditional English style brown ale but with more body Its deep brown color comes from combination of Chocolate and Black malts Tall dark and smooth the perfect cure for the domestic beer blahs
Malts Victory MunichHops Northern Brewer Cascade Willamette

Bed of Nails is crafted as an American ode to traditional English brown light hop addition balances the natural sweetness present in the specialty malt This beer delicate body and dry finish allow flavors of toffee and dark fruit to shine through
A traditional english brown ale very nutty aroma towards hazel and Brazil nuts deep brown in color and very well rounded body

This English style brown ale has an alluring mahogany color capped by rich foam head It is brewed with six different varieties of premium malted barley creating robust body and delicious flavor profile featuring hints of chocolate raisins dates and almonds It ripe fruit notes and malty sweet finish are counterbalanced by subtle hop bitterness and aroma IBU

Delicious Full bodied Complex Sure you can say all those things Wouldn it be lot more fun to take sip of this handcrafted brown ale and come up with your own superlatives This is the brown ale that beat Newcastle Sam Adams and more at the World Beer Championships in Chicago
English malted oats English chocolate malt and pale malt roasted with coffee beans at Heritage coffee company Cascade and Calypso hops and additions of hand picked Brazilian coffee IBU
OG IBU Color LHops WillametteYeast Ballantine Ale
This medium bodied Brown Ale fills your mouth with fusion of toasty malt and sweet caramel up front finishing with nutty flavour medium creamy carbonation and mild hop bitterness
An English style brown ale This beer has biscuit like smoothness with rich malt body and medium hop bitterness
Available in and present

Geary Autumn Ale is faithful interpretation of the classic brown ales of Great Britain With deep auburn color and subtle nut like flavor Geary Autumn Ale is the perfect choice as the seasons change Original gravity alcohol by volume two row English malts pale crystal and chocolate Cascade Golding and Fuggle hops

A myth shattering ale that proves all dark beers don have to be filling Sweetly smooth with nutty hints of roasted caramel flavor Brewed with American Canadian and English grown barley and American hops IBU

Anchor Steam Beer owes its deep amber color thick creamy head and rich distinctive flavor to historic brewing process like none other It is process that combines deep respect for craft brewing tradition with many decades of evolution to arrive at unique approach blend of pale and caramel malts fermentation with lager yeast at warmer ale temperatures in shallow open air fermenters and gentle carbonation in our cellars through an all natural process called kräusening

Our flagship beer was named after our founder grandmother and crafted to please her purely classic tastes Mildly hopped light in color and body and clean to the taste this california common style lager drinks easy Each sip charms the senses with distinct flavor and refreshing simplicity delivering smooth finish Dorothy is truly the Classic Beauty IBU

Dampf Loc is an all barley warm fermented ale brewed by the folks from Chicago Local Option inspired by Dampfbier literally steam beer originally crafted by medieval peasant inhabitants of southeast Bavaria During the fermentation process generous amounts of foam and surface bubbles burst in the tank giving the illusion that the ferment is boiling or steaming Tony Russomanno and Noah Hopkins took it upon themselves to brew Dampf Loc as modern interpretation of its Teutonic predecessor creating Hefe Gerste ale that is true to its roots unmistakable in character yet accessible to beer drinkers of all palates Dampf Loc has mild hop profile medium body with pleasant effervescence and clear rich orange hue Dampf Loc is ideal for warm months yet enjoyable year round

East Coast Common is nod to those uniquely American lager beers fermented warm in the San Franciscan style One sniff of the heady aroma tells you this isn a utilitarian washing machine variety beer Our brewers infuse significant quantities of late in the boil and post fermentation dry hops to make sure you know East Coast Common is New England original We originally brewed East Coast Common at Smuttlabs with our friends and neighbors Stoneface Brewing Company and Great Rhythm Brewing Company to commemorate Portsmouth Beer Week We re pleased to bring it back as our new Spring seasonal for wider hop hungry audience

Fermented as beer from wort extracted from fully modified two row pale malt which provides beautiful straw color This beer is aggressively hopped with Perle and Centennial hops Its light body and low alcohol allow the hops to become more prominent throughout the beer The floral aroma is attributed to heavy handfuls of centennial hops at the finish of the boil Hearty handfuls of hops lend grape fruity tone in the flavor and finish of the beer B s deg Plato B
Unfiltered with amber hues and medium body Segal Ranch Nugget and Cascade Hops give citrus and fresh pine on the nose Finishes dry with slight bitterness

Mid Summer violent derecho windstorm barreled through DC leaving one million people without power Our brewery was out of power for five days which left us unable to control the fermentation temperature of tank of lager We were determined to save our beer the tank fermented at higher temperature than intended As result the beer changed from lager into California Common beer The storm gift was this DERECHO COMMON DERECHO COMMON is deep golden in color and has toasty biscuity malt flavors It is medium bodied with an assertive hop profile It is hopped with Centennial hops which give it spicy citrusy hop kick on the finish

This unique lager balances rich caramel malt flavor with smooth hop finish that keeps the palate crisp Reddish amber in color this is very complex California Common style beer with great malt hop balance IBU
A Steam style beer made with lager yeast and fermented at ale temperatures and then aged at lager temperatures for smooth clean finish

Citizens your cries for common ground have been heard In an effort to bridge the gap between beer connoisseurs and weekend warriors we at HB present the Common Man This beer delivers intriguing hops with smooth ﬁnish Finally craft beer for all of us IBUs

Our steamer beer is unique style lager Brewed with special strain of lager yeast that works better at warmer temperatures This method dates back to the late s when refrigeration was greater luxury Amber in color medium bodied with malty character Mildly fruity with an assertive hop bitterness and crisp clean finish IBU

Light and crisp session ale brewed with Pilsner base and blend of Caramel and Vienna malts Smooth and easy to drink this California Common has mild and pleasant hop character that subtly hits you up front and finishes with spicy herbal and citrus tones

An American Home Run Named for the Portsmouth Ohio minor league baseball team Red Bird Ale is classic steam ale brewed in tribute to the steam ales enjoyed along the Ohio river in the early Caramel malts lend the gorgeous red color and full flavor perfectly balanced with domestic Willamette Perle Liberty hops
This warm fermented lager is our tribute to the classic Anchor Steam beer that started the craft brewing revolution Our version is malty amber lager with good dose of Chinook hops in the whirlpool
California State Fair Gold Medal and GABF Bronze Medal Amber Lager

Anaheim is based on style of beer brewed at the original Anaheim Brewery and has flavor that is popular with today beer drinker Copper colored full flavored and well hopped Anaheim is our flagship beer The beer is aptly named to reflect the glory days of the original Anaheim Brewery It was in when Friedrich Conrad our spiritual forefather began construction on vast brick building on West Broadway to house the expanded brewery The Anaheim Gazette noted in that Conrad beer appears to be fully equal if not superior to the celebrated Anheuser beer of St Louis Besides it is strictly Orange County product and all who are in the habit of using beer should give it trial if only to encourage home industries We think you should do the same
A sessionable ale lager hybrid that will satisfy almost any beer drinker

Manufactured locally to feed the building boom following the Great Fire the humble Chicago Common brick was used for the structural walls and exteriors of countless buildings in the region Later maverick architects such as Frank Lloyd Wright saw the beauty in this workaday material and brought it to position of prominence Our Chicago Common beer echoes this tradition using readily available classic ingredients to create something new and delicious Fermented with the unique lager yeast from San Francisco
A Steamed IPA In memory of the Charleston earthquake of

Northtown Native is light refreshing full bodied ale that is brewed and fermented as if it were lager Up front the taste is light and crisp with malt backbone and American Sterling hops finish to create great session beer

When Anthony Yoerg came to the United States from Bavaria the brewing scene was in its infancy and British styled ales dominated production But Anthony had different way of making beer When he first began in Saint Paul he aged his beer in caves lagering them for four weeks before he released them to the public The end result was smoother silkier and much more drinkable style of beer steam brewed just as it was over years ago using Minnesota Barley three different toast levels Washington State Hops and touch of Celeia Hops for aromatics Yoerg Beer is big malty roasty toasty brew with haunting dance of hops in the background It fragrant powerful and just might be the most serious lager to come out of the Midwest since well since The Yoerg Brewing Company closed their doors in

The dog days of summer inspired us to brew lager style beer in honor of Pike mascot Boston Terrier named Derby Like its namesake it is soft and gentle light and smooth yet full of character It fermented with California Common lager yeast at ale rather than lager temperatures We hop with Magnum Ahtanum and Sorachi Ace hops of Japanese origin The malt bill is made up of ESB Vienna Malted Wheat Carastan and Flaked Brown Rice to give it light mouth feel pure bred beer

Theobroma is celebration of chocolate the food of the gods This Ancient Ale is based on chemical analysis of pottery fragments found in Honduras that revealed the earliest known alcoholic chocolate drink used by early civilizations to toast special occasions The discovery of this beverage pushed back the earliest use of cocoa for human consumption more than years to C As per the analysis Dogfish Head Theobroma translated into food of the gods is brewed with Aztec cocoa powder and cocoa nibs from our friends at Askinosie Chocolate honey chilies and annatto fragrant tree seeds It light in color not what you expect from your typical chocolate beer not that you be surpised that we do something unexpected with this beer IBU

Label of oz bottle Ingredients Harrington Klages Maier Munich Malts Cascade Willamette Hops Chipotle Peppers Free Range Coastal Waters Top Fermenting Pacman Yeast No Chemicals No Preservatives No Additives Dedicated to Spanish author Juan de la Cueva who in wrote of Mexican dish that combined seedless chipotles with ale This ale is deep amber in color with rich malty aroma and delicately spiced with smoked Jalapeno peppers to give it that extra bite Oregon Brewed Established Oxygen Fixing Caps IBU
Made with chiles including Anaheim Fresno jalapeño serrano habenero and ghost chile

A habitual offender returns This beer is the result of what many beer enthusiasts would consider most egregious crime sequestering Arrogant Bastard Ale Double Bastard Ale and OAKED Arrogant Bastard Ale in Kentucky bourbon barrels then blending them together with chile peppers This new version of Crime is still very hoppy in spite of the barrel aging with lots of oak and malt The long finish reveals layers of oak vanilla bourbon and malt that combine to produce complex caramel flavors with peppers adding pleasant tamarind subtle tropical fruit flavors and milder heat than in previous concoctions
Stout brewed with kinds of peppers cocoa cinnamon cumin and clove

A palate punishing ale unlike any other Never intended for the timid Punishment is the capsaicin throttled spawn of beer behemoth Double Bastard Ale In this year brew the flavors of Double Bastard Ale have been further enhanced by the bourbon barrel aging The addition of chile peppers to the beer adds lingering flavors in the finish of subtle tropical fruit and some layers of heat along with the toffee caramel malt and hop flavors

Vulture is deep ambered colored ale with complex caramel aromas with toasted sugar notes and long elegant spicy finish Roasted ancho chile is used to add depth and complexity without adding heat or strong chile flavors
Our chili beer is made with five different kinds of fresh chili peppers Rich pepper aroma greets you when the bottle is opened followed by its satisfying beer taste and then subtle spiciness

A blend of barrel aged Four that has fresh homegrown fatali chiles added for couple months before bottling It also incorporates light use of brettanomyces yeasts providing contrasting earthy backdrop for the bright chile flavors Cellar for up to three years

MexiCali Stout is our favorite seasonal that we release every year at Halloween strong coffee and cinnamon aroma complements smooth chocolate taste with just hint of chili spice We use fresh spices coffee from Charlotte based Central Coffee Co and locally sourced Serrano chilies to create this unique blend

This style of beer is classified in the Fruit Vegetable category as Chili beer The focus is obviously on the chili peppers used during the brewing process Our version uses mix of hot peppers including jalapenos and anaheims hence the name Hot Jala Heim It has delightful peppery aroma as well as taste with mild sensation of heat experienced after swallowing

This beer has an unmistakable roasted chile aroma and flavor without being too hot The whole chile is used to infuse the beer with mild green chile flavor and leaves you with just hint of heat on the back end IBU

A light German style beer made with Anaheim chiles and smoked Ancho peppers Great American Beer Festival Bronze Medal Winner in the Fruit and Vegetable Beer category anda Wynkoop specialty
We took our pilsener and dry hopped it with roasted jalapenos The result is well balanced beer with very intoxicating peppery type aroma great jalapeno flavor and just bit of lingering heat IBU
Chile Pepper Ale Alcohol content HOT Spicy ale made with assorted chilies blended with our wheat ale
Pad Thai inspired brown ale with house made peanut butter including coconut Thai chilis dry hopped cilantro and touch of lime Spicy yet balanced
A blend of hot and mild Anaheim chiles infused in refreshing light lager pleasant spicy bite makes for delicious palette pleaser

This medium bodied clear copper ale is crisp and lively with unique mix of deep dark fruit sweetness and spicy accents of Chile de árbol and ancho chile that is surprisingly refreshing Of all the beers in legend and song there none as original as El KaBong
Modelo Chelada Tamarindo Picante is an authentic cerveza preparada made with beer tomato salt and lime along with tamarind and chipotle peppers for sweet and spicy taste
