Named after the great Hitchcock movie filmed in Santa Rosa in This This imperial porter packs rich chocolate and light smoked malt character with very soft dry finish Original Gravity Alcohol by Volume Color BlackBitterness Mild

Black Cherry Porter is made using local Northern Michigan sweet black cherries and eight different malts Combined the ingredients provide the deep radiant flavor profile and create the dark opaque color slight purple lace from the fruit puree enticingly leads into smooth soft hints of roasted chocolate and pleasurable black cherry flavors IBU
Formerly Hangar Chocolate Porter

This dark chocolate Porter is very rich roasty beer with top notes of chocolate derived from freshly roasted cacao Strong but relatively smooth on the palate its malty sweetness is evenly balanced with bitterness and slight dryness from the alcoholic strength Look for solid notes of coffee licorice mild chocolate and more subtle hints of fruit and spices

An Imperial version of Sweet Baby Jesus that raises the bar again with its silky full body big roasted malt flavor and aroma dominated by rich notes of peanut butter and chocolate subtle fruit and coffee notes and strong warming ABV For Pete Sake It a whole new level of Chocolate Peanut Butter Porter
A complex Imperial coffee porter made with award winning Evans Brothers cold brew coffee Subtle chocolate and coffee notes are balanced by black malt bitterness and malt sweetness

Mocha machine is well engineered endeavor in massive aromatics and rich flavors Brewed with an array of British and German malts this burly brew is infused with masterfully roasted coffee from Portola Coffee lab in Costa Mesa CA It is then aged on cacao nibs from Ecuador adding an awesomely deep dimension of fudge
A full bodied very dark malty beer with good roasted character The beer has an OG of rounding out after fermentation with just slight residual sweetness and cutting dry at the finish
Imperial porter masterfully blended with Aquacate coffee from the Narino region of Columbia and Madagascar bourbon vanilla beans

GABF Gold Winner for Field Beer Utilizing seven different malts including black and chocolate as well as raw and toasted coconut resulting in rich slightly sweet and malty ale Award winning Imperial Coconut Porter pours with dark tan head and drinks with silky smooth yet warming finish
A ABV version of Tanilla Of course we added more hop bitterness to balance the chocolate expresso and vanilla malt sweetness Drink at your own risk This is big beer but drinks way too easy IBU
Ingredients Water malt pilsner smoked chocolate cara munich and brown roasted barley rolled oats brown sugar hops and yeast
With award winning cold pressed coffee from Bird Rock Roasters of La Jolla this Coffee Porter is black in color with khaki tan head Strong coffee flavors with rich chocolate and roasted malts

Aged year in Brinley Rum barrels Shipwreck PorterBarrel Aged PorterABV IBU SRM When our friends and neighbors at Brinley shipped us ten of the barrels used to make their Brinley Gold Shipwreck Rum from their distillery on St Kitts we were given the opportunity to create beer that would take advantage of wood rather than the other way around We looked to coax complexity out of the marriage of barrel soul and brew potential not just to bomb huge beer with huge flavor The rum that lives in these barrels for four years integrates its spice to the wood so well that it ends up reminiscent of Bananas Foster sturdy brown honey porter seemed the best host to receive the ghosts from Shipwreck old home We started with base of deep malts looking for notes of coffee and chocolate then enhanced them with the floral bouquet of local wildflower honey and the preservative strength of ABV while keeping the body sensible This was put in the casks to meld with the vanilla wood and spice notes toned down by the oxidative effect of year in the cellar Drink Shipwreck Porter because barrel should be so much more than depth charge https www youtube com watch JMRNXQnMTAg list UUnNILcyxWbvjLRKg
No absence of hops gives Founders robust porter the full flavor you deserve and expect IBU

Our award winning Porter bridges the gap between malty brown ales and heavily roasted stouts Notes of chocolate coffee and roasted barley are offset with just slight hop bitterness Enjoy any time of the year

This hearty mahogany colored ale is brewed to evoke the dark full bodied ales that were favorite of dockworkers and warehousemen hence the name Porter in th century London It is good bet that when Dickens Mr Pickwick sat down for pint we would have been drinking an ale much like our Robust Porter This is smooth and very drinkable beer characterized by its well balanced malt and hops plus subtle notes of coffee and chocolate IBU

Intense fresh cacao flavors swirl with popping coconut aromas all supported by semi sweet porter made from loads of dark chocolate and extra dark caramel malt This limited release specialty comes around once year to satisfy that sweet tooth so get em while you can before they disappear At ABV and IBUs this choconut goodness will have you yellin Pass Dash Hit all winter long

A striking robust porter full of warmth and chocolate malt Eugene is robust porter named after Eugene Debs an American union leader and activist who led the Pullman Railroad strike in An assortment of Belgian specialty malts form complex structure of toasted grain and caramel flavors Dark chocolate malt makes this porter black as night and infuses it with its distinct intense chocolate essence IBU

With notes of coffee and dark chocolate this porter is roasty and rich with robust yet smooth body Toasted malts give it sinister black color but its crisp taste will have you believing that there no more need to be afraid of the dark Lager malt Munich malt chocolate malt Bavarian hops with the slight addition of authentic Icelandic roasted coffee

Thirsty Trout is rich robust American Porter Dark brown in color with medium to heavy body and hints of light roast Aromas of chocolate leave way to full mouthfeel and somewhat sweet finish to make this porter desirable companion Thirsty Trout is rich robust American Porter that will have you yelling CHOCOLATE after the first whiff Dark brown in color with medium body and hints of light roast The aromas of chocolate cupcake lead the way to sweet caramel and toffee body that finish beautifully with hops Stay trout my friends

Chief BlackHawk Porter is robust black and sharply bittersweet ale This style was traditionally the session beer consumed by the porters in London Hold your glass to the light and you may glimpse dashes of garnet dancing through this dark black ale Count on dense and creamy mocha head to rise few inches and leave sticky lacy trail down the sides of your glass as it slowly settles The aroma of coffee beans and bittersweet chocolate will water your mouth Visions of sticking your finger in bowl of thick fudgey batter or stealing darkened and decadent chocolate chip cookie might creep into your thoughts variety of dark roasted malts Brown Chocolate Black lend rich flavors and deep colors to this ale

Raincloud is the perfect stay at home brew Dark smooth mysterious this rich and flavorful porter is brewed with chocolate and crystal malts and subtle blend of European hops Raincloud is the ideal accompaniment for lazy day of movie watching or reading

American hops provide smooth distraction for Payback Porter robust strength which is concealed within the shadows of dark imported malts Brewed with English chocolate malts and rolled oats this Robust Porter pours deep chocolate brown and is rich in roasted malt aromas and coffee flavors With notes of espresso baker cocoa and sweet toasted maltiness Payback finishes with creamy mouthfeel

A small bottle with big flavor Brewed with six different malts and generously hopped robust doesn really begin to describe this beer Smooth chocolate flavors with hints of Coffee Caramel and Vanilla Hop presence is copious and is matched by rich malt flavors IBU

A robust Porter Drake Black Robusto has roasty character and is stronger in alcohol than regular porter thus robust Dark black in color with chocolate maltiness from seven different types of barley and spicy herbal hop character from Northdown and Williamette hops IBU

Guilty Filthy Soul Imperial Chocolate Rye Porter sliver medalist at both The World Beer Cup and Great American Beer Festival is medium full bodied with rich aromas and flavors of roasted malt and cocoa accented by underlying notes of peppery rye and strong abv The addition of chocolate to the beer imbues it with inimitable flavor velvety mouthfeel and crisp bittersweet finish Lay down your burdens and pick up our award winning Imperial Chocolate Rye Porter you won regret it

Out God Damn Pigeon Porter was brewed with our friends from across the pond in mind We use traditional English Amber malt but being the unruly Americans we are we put our own happy twist on things One of our favorite hops Simcoe was added late in the bail This delightful porter will take your mind off the everyday nuisances of living in big city especially those ing pigeons
This robust porter is black in color is medium bodied and has rich roasted malt flavor ending with pleasing hop flavor and mild hop bitterness
Our robust porter aged with Dark Matter Revolution blend whole bean coffee

For when it rains so much you need peanut butter in your beer Sometimes the rain can drive you nuts so you might as well have some in your beer With that we are proud to introduce Peanut Butter Raincloud unique and flavorful adaptation of our popular Raincloud robust porter Raise glass to the miracle that is peanut butter porter

Our robust porter utilizes myriad of dark malts that impart coffee and chocolate notes This roasty profile makes for smooth and incredibly drinkable beer Medium bodied balanced and finishing slightly dry our Porter is perfectly suited for enjoying multiple pints
This black in color porter has roasty caramel low hop aroma It has lightly burnt malty taste with medium dry finish clean refreshing porter

Gran Sport is robust porter marked by its finesse and distinct malt backbone Aromatic notes of chocolate and roasted coffee compliment the full bodied mouthfeel derived from healthy addition of oat flakes Dark Roasty Malty Splendid IBU
Fionn is Imperial English Porter with hazelnuts and coffee
Robust Vanilla Porter

Big malty and dark Draken Robust porter exudes roasty aroma from its tan head You ll taste complex and rich chocolate and caramel malt character followed by touch of warmth and light malt sweetness Draken has subtle flavors of raisins and dark fruits and touch of hop bitterness to balance the flavor on the palate Despite its dark appearance the beer is medium bodied with wonderful mouthfeel that allows the rich flavors to linger on your tongue just long enough to last until the next sip

Dark and full bodied this is our interpretation of the classic English Porter style Made with nine varieties of malt and assertively hopped our porter is packed with flavor Strong coffee and chocolate tones create special brew for those advancing on the path of fine beer appreciation
Our Crew constructed Foreman Robust Porter with enough malty roastness to satisfy even the hardest working men and women Break time is over Back To Work
Brewed with roasted praline pecans this robust porter provides subtle notes of roasted pecans vanilla caramel and brown sugar
A robust dark ale with plenty of roasted malt character Coffee chocolatey goodness with enough hops to balance Put your th grade superstitious self aside and cross paths with this nimble beast
Robust porter made with real roasted peanuts and peanut butter from Germack Pistachio Company IBU

Pop Art is Robust Porter brewed with plethora of chocolate and roasted malts caramel malt and Kuromitsu Kuromitsu or black honey is very dark sugar syrup made from Japanese unrefined Okinawan kurozato It is similar to molasses but with milder more subtle taste Pop Art pours beautiful clean black color in the glass and tastes like chocolate fudge subtle molasses and gently bitter dark malts It is robust porter through and through with intense yet rewarding flavors Enjoy

Robust porter brewed with hefty amount of flaked oats and conditioned on vanilla beans and an exclusive coffee blend from our friends at Valiant Coffee Packaged in its purest form unfined and unfiltered
Robust coffee infused porter

Big chocolate roasted and mocha notes are the key to this style wise country football coach once said there no point half doing something And in making this porter we ve taken his advice on board our Robust Porter uses plenty of roast barley and chocolate malt to give you big porter that won leave you asking for more Try this one with dark chocolate and liquorice Bridge Road Porter like many of its beers pulls no punches Make no mistake the Robust Porter is big and bold yet its smooth roasty texture makes it one to convert the non dark drinker Match it with rich chocolate deserts cold winter nights or freshly shucked oysters
A smooth porter brewed with enough coffee to make double espresso shots finished with touch of vanilla

Surrealism is robust porter brewed with significant dose of oats atop base of chocolate roasted caramel and pale malts It pours midnight black color in the glass with dense and frothy mocha colored head It a looker indeed We taste and smell dark chocolate fudge chewy brownies and chocolate syrup The oats add smooth and frothy layer to an easy drinking densely flavored beer What an indulgence Enjoy

A robust porter for robust player this is tribute to David Ortiz showing our appreciation and love for Boston legend will assault your palate with flavors of dark chocolate burnt caramel and dark fruit while the sturdy malt body provides ample strength to hit anything thrown at it touch of sweetness persists through the finish balancing out the strong character found throughout the beer

A robust porter with roast character from dark malt and Frost Bean Works coffee beans Beans imported by our friends at Hacienda La Minita and roasted in house complement grain bill incorporating coffee malt to create multi layered experience ABV IBU
pho spiced porter

A porter with hints of chocolate coffee balanced by subtle smokinessFirst Release December When first released our smoky version of traditional English porter was ahead of its time Today it a highly regarded staple among craft beer fans and our go to food complement pairing effortlessly with all kinds of cuisine from peanut butter and banana sandwiches to braised pork belly and apple pie This worldly libation is dark smooth and complex with chocolate and coffee flavors suffused with subtle smokiness from the addition of peat smoked malt

The dark robust body and pronounced smoky flavor of this limited edition beer make it an adventuresome taste experience Alaskan Smoked Porter is produced in limited vintages each year on November and unlike most beers may be aged in the bottle much like fine wine IBU

Dark rich and smoky this classic porter is brewed with German smoked malt and makes perfect after dinner or anytime sipper for those who love bigger beer Winner of the Gold Medal in the Great American Beer Festival for best Smoked Beer in America IBU

This th Century style Smoked Porter has subtle accent of peat like Bamberg smoked malt which is apparent in both the aroma and flavor It is brewed with seven varieties of premium European malted barley resulting in note of bittersweet chocolate and coffee that are counter balanced by long sustaining finish of Goldings hops IBU

Big black and smokey an imperial porter rich full bodied with silky chocolate crown Dark roasted flavors host the smokey character of wood fired malt while chipotle peppers add smoldering tickle of heat
A lightly smoked coffee porter made with touch of German beechwood smoked malt as well as high quality lbs of Sightglass coffee per barrel
Viven porter is rather bitter porter with nice roasted flavours Viven porter is an art of brewing The Porter has very enjoyable aftertaste and makes many friends

Our winter seasonal is brewed in the robust porter style using peat smoked malt The addition of American hops create piney resin flavor with smooth finish Copious amounts of black malt lend to khaki colored head and dark chocolate backbone

Now what is this smoked beer It really isn as crazy as it sounds years ago virtually all beers were smoked it true Google it but with the dawning of the industrial revolution most of the smoke lifted However in the German town of Bamberg the flame has quite literally been kept alive and to this day the town brewers produce world renowned beers brewed with their own special rauchmalz beechwood smoked malt We ve taken our best porter recipe and added good measure of that same Bamberg Rauchmalz The smoke mingles beautifully with the rich dark roasted chocolate flavours of the porter without being overpowering Although it pairs extremely well with smoked seafood barbeques strong cheeses and hearty stews its food friendliness isn limited to savouries chocolate and caramel based deserts are great companions too Trust us it really isn as crazy as it sounds IBU

Smoked Pigasus is robust and delicious porter brewed with rye smoked malt and maple syrup The maple syrup provides perfect balance for the smoked malt Smoked Pigasus pours deep mahogany with aromas of chocolate smoke and caramel big thank you to Pappy Smokehouse

This is the bigger badder version of Coffee Cigarettes We use about lbs per barrel of Sightglass coffee for an intense coffee kick alongside light addition of German Beechwood Smoked Malt for touch of smoke character
Nov Dec release

Smoked Porter Inspired by smoke stacks and steam engines of Mordor The Black Country nod back to the smokey Porters and Stouts of the Industrial Revolution invented in Shoreditch One of the first recipes that made it from our litre home brew kit Malt Simpsons Best Smoke Caramalt Crystal Oats Munich Brown Chocolate Black Hops Magnum Chinook

Robust all day without dictating your life this is the porter that other dark beers hang poster of on their own bedroom wall Malt sweetness is just present enough to enhance the dark chocolate and roasted coffee flavors without destroying the drinkability This brew provides subtle smoke profile that simultaneously creates new fans of dark beer and tames the beast inside the bold beer aficionado

Named after the Aztec relic of Tezcatlipoca This mystic ale is brewed with varieties of malts including touch of peated malt in order to create subtle smoke character It is delicately hopped with an intense malt backbone

Smoke Signal is an American style Robust Porter using generous amount of pale ale malt smoked with Alderwood the smoke source used in the Pacific Northwest for salmon We smoke pounds of pale malt for each barrel batch of Smoke Signal Alderwood imparts slightly sweet smoke flavor that balances well with the residual sweetness of the beer imparted through the use of dark crystal malts chocolate and roasted barleys combine with American hops to deliver flavorful robust porter with just the right amount of smoked flavor
This deep dark brew may help to tame those cool evenings and put little spunk in the long nights You ll flavor the sweet caramel malts roasted grains big mouth feel and touch of smoked grain

During the summer of our brewers were developing and subsequently falling in love with our Ommegang Smoked Porter Sampling the first pilot batches it was clear that this was beer that was meant for barrel ageing Thus when we brewed Smoked Porter to release in the winter of we also set some aside in bourbon barrels Each individual barrel then received additions of several whole Madagascar vanilla beans to impart their rich and creamy flavors into the beer as it aged Now six months later it is ready to drink

The fourth of beers celebrating literary classic and one of our favorites Leaves of Grass by Walt Whitman German smoked malt chocolate malt and roasted malt work in harmony with carefully chosen hops for smooth smokey take on classic style

Pipeworks Smoked Porter is brewed with classic rauch malt and cherrywood smoked malt totaling of the grist This first offering in our smoked series starts with rich malt base with hints of roast finishing with moderate level of smoky campfire goodness We ll be brewing this one with different levels of smokiness throughout the year so we re sure to find something with just the right amount of smoke for you
IBU

Campfire is full bodied robust smoked porter We put lot of love into this beer hand smoking the malt on local applewood giving this beer very appealing and balanced smoky flavor aroma The result Jet black roasty toasty goodness Since we took care to craft this beer with just the right balance of smokiness you can pair Campfire with wide variety of foods especially barbecue Or for dessert you might want to simulate beautiful night outdoors by pairing Campfire with mores IBU

Named after the people god in Norse Mythology the mighty Thor robust smoked porter with late addition smoked hot peppers utilizing some of the hottest peppers in the world Don worry the seeds and membranes of the peppers have been removed after the peppers were roasted and smoked so the beer has bit of bite and flavor but no overbearing heat

Fashioned in the Robust Porter style mahogany hued Smokebrush Porter is richly roasted gratifying brew clever combination of malts smoked on peat and beechwood add an ever so slightly smoky character to the finish Look for new label designed each year by local artist One of our Community Ales of the profits from this beer go to the Smokebrush Foundation for the Arts and their Creative Community Efforts like the Uncle Wilber Fountain
Imperial Smoked Porter with sea salt aged in bourbon barrels and cherry bitters barrels
We smoke our own malts over apple maple and hickory woodchips to recreate this th Century Style robust ale

Prior to brewing our Smoked Porter Matt selects specialty malts to be smoked over an open flame imparting unique flavor profile in the porter The malts are smoked using apple and hickory wood for full hours Spring House Brewing Co chose to smoke the grain in local smoke house that dates back to the late th century This one of kind smoke house imparts layers of smoky depth to the beer that cannot be replicated Enjoy
Our version of robust porter dark malt dominates the flavor profile mouth feel is lighter than our stout bitterness balanced to allow the specialty grains to shine

Ond shows our love for smoked and dark beers Strength wise it belongs to robust porters which means it has slightly higher alcohol level and medium body The smoked character is incorporated into the entire beer and does not obscure the combination of roasted malts that give it chocolaty and caramely character To top it all off we have added carefully selected combination of Slovene and American hops that together in the form of slightly herbal woody note conclude the complexity of Ond IBU
We took classic Ameican Porter and brewed it with Briess cherry wood smoked malt Lower in alcohol to allow the maltiness through Black in color medium body soft hops and intensely smoky

A robust porter brewed with malted barley that was smoked over Adler wood by our brewers on site Rich smoky aromas greet your nose while flavors of dark chocolate smoke some roasted malt and bit of coffee hit the taste buds Finishes nice and dry

A Imperial Porter using Rauch Malt for depth of smoke selection of Chillies for subtle smokey flavours and designed to light the fire under you and mix of both roasted and regular Rye Malt to spice things up further

A complex beer with layers of flavors unfolding as this it slides down your throat Before the introduction of indirect fired malt kilns all beers had smoky flavor Today only handful of brewers produce beer reminiscent of those of the past We use imported German smoked malt to add depth and complexity to our Smoked Porter
Degrees Plato Degrees L row Pale MaltCaramel MaltPureed PumpkinKettle Hops MagnumAroma Hops Sterling

Also known as Punkin Brown AleA full bodied brown ale with smooth hints of pumpkin and brown sugar We brew our Punkin Ale with pumpkin meat brown sugar and spices As the season cools this is the perfect beer to warm up with Punkin Ale is named after the seriously off centered southern Delaware extravaganza Punkin Chunkin check out some of these Discovery Channel videos of Punkin Chunkin you gotta see it to believe it In fact Punkin Ale made its debut as it claimed first prize in the Punkin Chunkin Recipe Contest Yes that was full months before we even opened our doors for business IBU
Formerly Blue Moon Harvest Moon Pumpkin Ale

Pumpkinhead is crisp refreshing wheat ale with delightful aromatics and subtle spice flavor To celebrate the fall season we enhance the pumpkin flavor with proprietary blend of spices including cinnamon and nutmeg proper pint of Pumpkinhead is served in pint glass rimmed with sugar and cinnamon and often accompanied by shot of spiced rum or vanilla vodka

We set out to make bold monument for The King of the Pumpkins This ABV pumpkin ale is the mother of all pumpkin ales It is heartier spicier and more caramelly and pumpkiny than its faint brethren We have added lots of pumpkin along with cinnamon nutmeg and touch of cardamom and clove giving this beer spicy full bodied flavor This truly is an Imperial Pumpkin Ale Perfect finisher on cool autumn night or match it up with slice of pumpkin pie and fresh whipped cream
Brought back in

Our Pumpkin Ale blends the spices of the harvest with full bodied sweetness for beer that tastes like pumpkin pie Pounds of pumpkin form malty foundation that supports the fall flavors of cinnamon nutmeg and clove While pumpkin beers were produced in the early days of the American colonies they were different from the pumpkin beers we know today Colonists used pumpkin and squash as the fermenting medium since malted barley was scarce Once malt became more readily available it replaced these alternatives to grain In the American craft brewers reintroduced the style to the delight of pumpkin beer drinkers IBU

Early American colonialists seeking natural ingredients for brewing ales turned to pumpkins which were plentiful flavorful and nutritious Blended with barley malt pumpkins became commonly used beer ingredient Post Road Pumpkin Ale brings back this tasty tradition Hundreds of pounds of pumpkins are blended into the mash of each batch creating beer with an orange amber color warm pumpkin aroma biscuity malt center and crisp finish

Smuttynose Pumpkin Ale is our homage to the craft and heritage of America brewers Recipes calling for the use of pumpkins in beer date back to early colonial times when brewers sought to extend their supply of costly imported malt with locally grown ingredients such as squash and pompions In that spirit we brew our ale with the addition of pumpkin to the mash along with traditional spices to create delicious American original IBU
A big bodied beer with light coppery orange color and pleasing aromas of pumpkin and nutmeg

We wondered what would happen if monstrous pumpkin ale plump full of spicy gourdiness were aged in fine fresh rum barrels to add suggestions of delicate oak and candied molasses Rumpkin is what happened This first member of the Annual Barrel Aged Series was brewed with roasted pumpkins from local Boulder County farm and spiced with nutmeg cinnamon and ginger

Legend has it that when pumpkin comes into the world it is possessed by either good or an evil spirit Ours got all the good baby Bursting with real pumpkin flavor and yummy pumpkin spices including Ceylon cinnamon Jamaican all spice Zanzibar cloves and nutmeg Good Gourd is celebration of Fall and that spookiest of holidays Halloween Pair Good Gourd with pumpkin soup pumpkin pie and costume parties IBU

Brewed with lbs of pumpkin in each batch Made with Pale Munich and Crystal malts green and roasted pumpkin seeds pumpkin in the mash boil and fermenter Bittered with Horizon hops Spiced in conditioning with nutmeg clove cinnamon ginger and allspice

Imagine pumpkin vine wound its way in field of barley and brewer harvested it all to make beer Add Northwestern hops and blend of spices and you ve got UFO Pumpkin The malt combination provides smooth body and slightly sweet flavor which balances perfectly with the earthy notes derived from the pure pumpkin And like all of our UFO beers UFO Pumpkin is unfiltered so all the wonderful flavors are right there in your glass Cheers IBU
This sessionable pumpkin ale is brewed with fresh pumpkin and seasonal spices IBU

This is the same beer as Divine Reserve If you have already reviewed that beer please do not review it again here or you risk losing the older review when the listings are merged http www saintarnold com beers pumpkinator html

Also known as Rogue Farms GYO Pumpkin Patch Ale Ingredients Rogue Farms Pumpkins Great Western Row Carawheat Weyermann Carafe Malts Rogue Micro Hopyard Rebel Hops Ginger Cloves Vanilla bean cinnamon cardamom nutmeg Free range coastal water and Pacman Yeast Specs º PLATO IBU AAº Lovibond

In the most worthy of pumpkin patches and during the silence of the midnight hour the Greater Pumpkin raises up and pours rich deep and burnished orange color Heady aromas of bourbon cinnamon ginger allspice and clove linger seductively over the thick white head of this tremendous brew Its love at first sip as the full malt body dominated by British crystal malt brown sugar and pumpkin slowly washes over your tongue Bourbon barrel aging rounds out the flavors with notes of oak vanilla and bourbon Pairs well with crisp autumn weather crunchy fallen leaves and the knowledge that your kids will be asleep soon so you can raid their Halloween candy bags

With brilliant deep copper hue and creamy beige colored head our Fall Hornin Pumpkin Ale has inviting aromas of caramelized malt and baking bread with highlights of cinnamon nutmeg pumpkin and seasonal spices The pleasantly creamy mouthfeel and silky body embrace the sweet caramel flavors and tang of spices with just hint of hops that ends in smooth round finish

Jack Traveler is an alluring wheat beer illuminated by the tastes of fall He strikes perfect balance between bright refreshment and seasonal spice Jack is brewed with fresh pumpkin for delicious dark hued Shandy inspired beer

Spookily smooth and chocolatey perennial favorite and Silver medalist in the Great American Beer Festival Field Beer category Dark the Moon is brewed with Great Western pale Crisp Crystal Munich Cara Vienne roasted chocolate and Special malts with roasted pumpkin seeds in the mash Pumpkin in the mash kettle and fermenter Bittered with Magnum and finished with Saaz and crushed cinnamon

Some might think we re out of our gourd for making pumpkin ale but our Pumpkin Down is not like the others The caramel and toffee maltiness of our Piper Down Scottish ale is the perfect backdrop for boatload of roasted pumpkin Just before bottling we add subtle amount of spice to complement but not overwhelm the earthy flavor It was smash at the brewery and we think you ll agree

Why is there only one time of the year as goblins ghouls and ghosts frolic on front lawns when we embrace THE FEAR At all other times THE FEAR dominates us controls us and prevents us from greatness What is there to THE FEAR Disagreement Criticism Humiliation Whatever THE FEAR is that consumes you embrace it Only then will the true artist in you rise up Malts Carabrown Midnight Wheat Chocolate ViennaHops Warrior WillametteYeast American AleIBU Special pounds of pumpkin added per barrels

Wilhelm Scream is ripe with fall flavors of pumpkin cinnamon nutmeg and caramel malts Medium bodied and the color of orange setting suns it finishes similar to the way we finish summer with just hint of bitterness

Formerly Fermentation Without Representation Imperial Pumpkin PorterOur first ever collaborative beer has all the familiar flavors of the season but done with Epic style To base of strong roasty and chocolaty porter we add pounds of real pumpkin per batch five spices and whole Madagascar vanilla beans As you pour this deeply ruby brown beer you re greeted by the aroma of fresh cut squash followed by rich chocolate The flavor starts sweet with marshmallow vanilla and some pumpkin pie then yields to coffee roast and darkchocolate dryness This beer is great introduction for curious drinkers and special holiday treat for fans of the style

Roadsmary Baby is traditional pumpkin ale with Two Roads spin its aged in rum barrels for added complexity and depth of flavor The result is smooth drinking ale with notes of pumpkin spices vanilla oak and touch of rum
Like pumpkin pie in bottle we add pounds of real pumpkin to the three barley mash and then season the finished beer with cinnamon nutmeg and cloves IBU
Had been ABV

Pumpkin is made solely with fresh ingredients spiced and baked in the oven before added to the brew Enjoy powerful notes of cinnamon nutmeg brown sugar and more from the beer commonly described as Pumpkin Pie in glass

Back in we had the good fortune of finding cache of rum barrels which we quickly filled with Pumking making what was affectionately called Rumking We were lucky to have found more barrels and in found some of the best we ve ever used This batch is at least as delicious as versions past Imagine our inimitable Imperial Pumking Ale as the captain on the high seas flying the Jolly Roger The King sails for ports unknown in this limited release Rum Barrel Aged Pumking has been kept like secret treasure in the hollows of the brewery patiently awaiting discovery Yo ho ho Enjoy Rum Barrel Aged Pumking now or keep it hidden standing upright in dark and cool place until you can say anchors aweigh New label design same great Rum Barrel Aged Pumking ABV varies by batch

In the autumn of Captain Jack Rachman and his pirate mates were celebrating their victories in typical hard drinking tradition Suddenly British Navy sloop surprised them The drunken pirates hid below deck leaving Captain Jack mistresses Anne Bonney and Mary Read to defend the ship The women shared reputation as fierce hell cats but the British Navy eventually overtook the pirate ship Captain Jack and the pirates were sentenced to hang Anne visited her lover in his cell before his execution and instead of loving words her scathing comments live on throughout history Had you fought like man you need not have been hang like dog Their legacy inspired us to brew an equally ferocious Imperial Pumpkin Ale brewed with pirate rum spices We added touch of autumn flavor with roasted butternut squash and natural maple syrup
Rich amber color with aroma of sweet pumpkin pie and savory spices Creamy mouthfeel with flavors of pumpkin followed by sweet malt pie crust spice hints of brown sugar and clean finish

Out of Your Gourd Pumpkin Porter is dark chestnut brown in color and is made with pureed pumpkin Cinnamon nutmeg and ginger are added to the whirlpool and maple syrup is added during fermentation This full bodied rich roasty porter makes you want to eat turkey and watch football or build bonfire
A festive Ale brewed with pumpkin and molasses variety of hand crushed whole spices set up an impressive aroma and well balanced taste

Formerly Blue Point Pumpkin AleOur golden orange colored Pumpkin Ale is brewed with pumpkin and spices to produce delicious taste of fall This mild ale has little bitterness and malty backbone The spicy characteristics take the lead in this roasty beer and its tremendous depth of character will keep you warm during the fall season

Brand Name Imperial PumpkinStyle English Strong AleColor Dark Amber BrownBitterness Units ABV Date of Introduction August Malts Row Wheat Caramel L and Caramunich maltHops Nugget Mt Hood WillamettePackages Available oz bottle five gallon logs ½ Keg gallon Availability Late summer through early fallDescription Long Trail Imperial Pumpkin Ale is the first offering in Long Trail new Brush and Barrel Series This limited release seasonal treat is small batch brewed with pumpkins cinnamon ginger nutmeg and cloves with increased malts and touch of bitterness for the perfect balance

Brewed with native Pennsylvania neck pumpkins harvested just few miles from our brewery at Strites Orchard Master of Pumpkins conjures the spirit of autumn by combining roasted pumpkins and traditional pie spices with French saison yeast This natural fermentation releases palate of vanilla cinnamon clove nutmeg ginger and honey In addition to mL bottles Master of Pumpkins is also currently available on draft and for take out growler fills in the Tasting Room Taste it you will see More is all you need

St Bernardus Abt is widely regarded as one of the best beers in the world It is therefore no surprise that it is our brewery flagship beer ranked at the very top of the St Bernardus beer hierarchy It is brewed in the classic quadrupel style and adheres to the original recipe ColourThis is dark beer with robust head that is ivory in colour CharacteristicsColor DarkType of beer Quadruple Top fermentationAlcohol degree Plato Recommended pouring temperature CColor EBC Bitterness EBU Shelf life years bottle years keg Packaging Bottle cl cl Keg

Three Philosophers is unique blend of Belgian style dark ale and Liefmans Kriek an authentic cherry ale from Belgium Cherry chestnut in color it opaque but not cloudy with full carbonation topped by smooth tan head Flavors and aromas of roasted malt molasses and brown sugar dark fruits brandied raisins and chocolate Three Philosophers has notable sweetness with low hop bitterness The mid palate shows soft malt center which gives way to dry warm wine like finish The complexity of this beer make it good candidate for ageing gracefully as spicy sherry and port notes should intensify

The heaviest of the Westvleteren beers the is quadrupel style beer which can be recognized by its yellow cap Like the other Westvleteren beers the bottle does not have label and the cap therefore has all the required information The Westvleteren has always been rated high on beer reviews and is by some considered to be the best beer in the world Just as the other Westvleteren beers it can only legally be purchased at the monestary on appointment or in the bar across the street However it often finds its way on the grey market where it sold at high prices

Do you know what dwells in glass asks Ole in Hans Christian Andersen The Watchman of the Tower Better known for stories such as The Little Mermaid Andersen wrote this short cautionary tale for somewhat older audience Our quadrupel ale also meant for the mature connoisseur is deep and mysterious libation dark auburn and full bodied its sweetness deceptive As Ole describes the glasses in turn their contents become more ominous until in the sixth glass IBU

It has been said that the only constant is change and the same is true for barrel aged beers Cut from similar recipe this barrel aged Quad evolves and shows different face each year result of time spent aging in the barrel Turbinado brown sugar from Mexico adds wonderful molasses flavors that are reminiscent of Belgian candi sugar It has full body and lush texture with barrel expression all over toasted oak coconut leather and rich cigar tobacco

Based loosely on the Smokestack Series The Sixth Glass this abbey style quadrupel is separated into number of oak bourbon barrels where it ages for varying lengths of time some for up to three years Cherries are added to make up for the angel share of beer lost during barrel aging Selected barrels are then blended for optimum flavor The resulting beer retains only very subtle cherry characteristics with toffee and vanilla notes coming to the fore IBU

Quadrupel is La Trappe heaviest ale with stunning amber colour Its warm and intense flavour is rich and finely balanced Malty sweet slightly burnt and pleasantly bitter with sweet aftertaste Quadrupel continues to ferment after bottling and offers aromas of banana almond vanilla and others

Old Fisherman Ale is dark ale brewed with spices Pannepot is term that describes the Fishing Boats from the village of De Panne Brewed and bottled on the Deca Brewery in Woesten Vleteren EBC IBU OG FG ABV Hops Bramling Cross Hallaertau MF

In when the SAQ requested an exclusive new high end product Unibroue responded with Terrible Given its dark colour and alcohol content first for Unibroue we knew that this Belgian quadruple style ale might very well be greeted with reticence So we gave it name that would evoke terror and worry but also something extraordinary formidable and awe inspiring From here on out no other beer can ever be called Terrible

Beer Style Belgian Style Quadrupel AleHop Variety SterlingMalt Variety Two row barley Aromatic malt Cara Cara Special BSugars Belgian Candy SugarOG ABV IBUs Color TawnyThe Reverend was created in tribute to the life of our friend Tom Boogaard grandfather an ordained Episcopal Reverend Tom was inspired by the life of his grandfather and wanted to create tribute beer that contained his sterling traits True to the spirit and character of the departed Reverend this beer is strong willed assertive and pure of heart Our brewers included as many authentic imported Belgian specialty malts as they could making this the perfect beer for folks who love malty beers and are ready to take the next step divinely complex and beautifully layered beer with hints of dark cherries currants and molasses complimented by an underlying spiciness Sinfully smooth considering the high alcohol content The Reverend is the second installment of The Holy Trinity of Ales series Food pairing Try The Reverend with gyro or paired with our favorite steamed spicy saffron mussels

Heady with aromatic fruity start and taste this amber ale features hints of pear and apricot in its well nuanced flavor The initial impression of fruitiness concludes in refreshing dryness that begs you to sip again Be fore warned this ale is immense as it registers abv

A massive beer in every sense of the word stronger and more contemplative version of our Lost and Found Ale Judgment Day is the base beer for our Cuvee de Tomme Many of the Trappist Breweries produce version of beer which ages incredibly well for many years to come And since none of us knows when the end of the world is coming we suggest you stock up with lots of Lost Abbey beers so that when the end of the world magically appears from no where you ll have beer or two on hand for even the stingiest of angels
Kasteel Rouge is blend of Kasteel Donker Quad and cherry liquor The mix of these two excellent products creates an exceptional soft beer with references to the dark mother beer

We ve never released Bourbon Barrel version of our Judgment Day So we thought it might be interesting to take the base beer for Cuvee de Tomme age in first fill Bourbon Barrels and let mother nature take over Of course because this is Rock and Roll inspired Box Set beer we couldn just leave well enough alone Upon sampling the base beer it became apparent that the raisins used to brew the base beer were going to drive the flavor bus of this beer The conversations turned to Oatmeal Raisin cookies and the essence of freshly baked treat So we added some cinnamon sticks to the barrels and threw in some dried chiles as well

Strong brown ale inspired by the beer brewed by Belgian Trappist monks Very little bitterness this beer has intense malty and sweet flavours mixed with the taste of chocolate and caramel It presents complex red fruit and spice flavours due to the type of yeast that is used during the brewing process This beer is at its best only after it has aged for six months The Rigor Mortis are complex beers designed and brewed with patience and care in the tradition of the great Belgian Abbey beers

This big dark ale is brewed using variety of Belgian specialty malts along with pounds of raisin puree per batch The resulting flavor is viscous mix of dark fruit rum toffee and raisins balanced with aromatic fruitiness of the Belgian yeast IBU

In the Koningshoeven brewery reinstated an age old tradition aging La Trappe Quadrupel in oak barrels also known as barriques This way of aging ale results in unique complex flavour which varies from one type of barrel to another Quadrupel can be conserved for many years and is real treat for true ale enthusiasts And this is yet another ale that continues to ferment after bottling while its rich taste and high tannin content are likely to even surprise many wine drinker BATCH blended on June New Oak Heavy Toast New Medium Acasia Port Medium Burnt Port Medium Toast BATCH blended on July New Medium Oak Toast Port Medium Burnt Toast Amer Oak Port Medium Burnt Toast French Oak Port Medium Toast French Oak BATCH blended on September New Oak Medium Toast Port Medium Toast French Oak La Trappe Medium Toast French Oak BATCH blended on November New Oak Medium Toast Port Medium Toast French Oak La Trappe Medium Toast French Oak La Trappe Medium burnt Amer Oak New Oak Heavy Toast BATCH blended on January New Oak Heavy Toast White wine used Oak Heavy Toast BATCH blended in October Whiskey New Fr Oak Medium Toast BATCH blended on June Acacia Wood New Oak Barrels Limousine Barrels with Cognac BATCH blended in March Brandy Oloroso New Oak Medium Toast New Oak High Toast Late Burgundy BATCH Bruichladdich Port Charlotte Single Malt New Oak Medium Toast BATCH Cachaça New Oak Medium Toast BATCH Bourbon US New Oak Medium Toast New Oak High Toast

The name Barista conjures thoughts of the fragrance of steaming coffee below layer of expertly created froth This may sounds rather far fetched for beer However the aromas and the flavours of caramel cacao and roast malt match seamlessly with the black gold and chocolate This beer builds bridges with the world of hot beverages with warming alcohol in the finish One to enjoy all the year round with meal in front of an open fire or on an outdoor terrace

Hardywood Bourbon Barrel Cru is brewed in the fashion of the abbey quadrupel the grand cru of many of Belgium revered monastic breweries Bourbon Cru displays sunset orange hue with substantial head and brilliant clarity after months of barrel aging The maturity and melding of flavors brought on by the freshly drained bourbon barrels lends an extraordinary sense of harmony to Bourbon Barrel Cru Almond toffee and oaky vanilla aromatics give way to dark cherries raisins and mature whiskey bit of plum flavor is greeted by caramel overtones and an assertive yet incredibly rounded body and lingering bourbon laced finish Abbey style Quadrupel Aged in Bourbon Barrels ABV IBU

It Difficult to express Love nuances much like the complexity of this Belgian style Chocolate Quad You Might use Box of Chocolate to express your love we use it to demonstrate our passion for great beer
Bourbon Barrel Aged Quadrupel

Barrel aged Quad is brewed in the spirit of collaboration We combine traditional techniques and ingredients like Belgian candi sugar with American innovation and experimentation by the use of bourbon barrels

This Abbey style Quadruple brewed with German Pils and Roast malts and dark candi sugar hopped with German Tradition hops Luscious and seductive Ichor is brewed for both the body and the soul This beer will improve with careful aging but is ready to drink now
St Bernardus Abt matured for months in Oak Calvados barrels
Oak Aged version of Straffe Hendrik Quadrupel
Belgian style Quadrupel with Cascade Chinook Citra and Mosaic hops
Bourbon barrel aged Belgian style quadrupel

Spencer Monks Reserve Ale is fragrant robust and full bodied mahogany in color and crowned with dense tan frothy head Its malt forward profile yields to warm finish The recipe development phase of this Quad stretched over three years and experimental brews The Spencer monks sought an alternative to the use of spices for flavor enhancement by pushing the boundaries of traditional Trappist Quad malt profiles even incorporating some local barley grown in nearby Barre MA which was craft malted in Hadley MA The outcome is unique product with distinct flavor profile well situated within the Trappist family of Quadrupel ales Trappist Quad abv

Patiently aged in the finest of Bourbon barrels this bold Belgian style Quadrupel layers notes of rich dark fruit vanilla and caramel with burst of tangerine peel culminating in the vibrancy of this full bodied creation

How about big malty beer that evokes good red wine and with drier finish than you expect at ABV Eschaton is one of kind oaked all malt Quadrupel or Belgian Strong Dark if you prefer that abounds with dark fruit and pit fruit flavors as well as earthy spiciness Vanilla oak and warm viniferous notes assert themselves as the beer warms to reveal additional layers of delicious complexity
Currently only cases of this beer are available per year Brewed in honor of the Burgundian Babble Belt

We have new twist on an old favorite coming out in February Our unique Three Philosophers Quardupel Ale is universally known as the preferred elixir of life meditators thinkers and theorizers Now thanks to Brewmaster Phil Leinhart and the bourbon barrels he got his hands on mullers of life mysteries can ponder all the more deeply We ve experimented with barrel aging in the past and had great success said Brewmaster Phil Leinhart Three Philosophers is such lovely complex beer and it ages so beautifully that we thought it the perfect fit for pairing with bourbon barrels The result is exactly what we hoped for even more complex flavors and slightly fuller body than the standard We re sure this ll be crowd pleaser Like the original Bourbon Barrel aged Three Philosophers pours deep burgundy hue with fluffy off white head Patience through the aging process rewarded the brewers with flavors of caramel raisin dried fruit molasses and vanilla and aromas of oak vanilla and subtle hints of cherry The body is ample but still finishes faintly dry with lingering hints of malt bourbon and cherry The effects of barrel aging eliciting remnant alcohol from the cooperage during the aging process escalated the ABV of the beer from to significant yet sneakily subtle ABV ABV varies by batch
Fat Tire Amber is the easy drinking Amber Ale born in Colorado from New Belgium Brewing Company certified Corp

The beer that helped build our brewery Bell Amber Ale features both toasted and sweet caramel notes from carefully selected malts balanced with herbal and citrus hop aromas Capped by clean bitterness it incredibly versatile with food but very tasty on its own

Standing ft tall at the center of the brew deck is our HopBack vessel here whole flower hops swirl in hot wort coaxing hop oil into aromas of grapefruit pith and pinesap This bright hop nose is counterbalanced with malt tones of toffee and Caramel Hops Cascade Willamette Nugget Crystal IBU

Just when it feels like the dog days will never end suddenly the switch is flipped the air gets cooler and it clear that autumn is on the way Featuring ruby red hue and abundant tropical fruit and citrus hop flavors Flipside Red IPA is the perfect beer for the final flash of summer
IBU

Red Rocket Ale is bastardized Scottish style red ale that traces it origins to our homebrew roots This full bodied and hoppy brew finishes on the palate with sweet caramel malt flavors California State Fair SILVER Great American Beer Festival Other Strong Ales or Lagers SILVER Great American Beer Festival Other Strong Ales SILVER
Our take on an American amber ale Complex malt bill delivers notes of dark raisin chocolate and biscuit Copious additions of American hops yield notes of pine and citrus
Ingredients Carastan Crystal Rogue Micro Barley Farm Dare Risk Malts Chinook Rogue Farm Revolution Freedom Hops Free Range Coastal Water and Pacman Yeast º PLATO IBU AA º

Formerly known as Ruedrich Red Seal AleMalt and hops are beautifully married in this full bodied copper red Pale Ale Red Seal is generously hopped for long spicy finish An excellent accompaniment to grilled meats and rich sauces

Balance is what makes our Boont Amber Ale so unique rich crystal malts give this beer deep copper hue and contribute slight caramel sweetness while the herbal spicy bitterness from carefully selected whole cone hops impart crisp clean finish Hints of sun toasted grain toffee and fruity esters compliment the mellow noble hop aroma
Pours amber in color with notes of citrus and caramel Citrus hop bitterness upfront with notes of caramel and an Amish bread sweetness Citrus hop bitterness returns at the end for long dry finish IBU

A deep amber colored American ale featuring rich malty body Cascade and Willamette hops add complex hop flavor and aroma This ale is exceptionally balanced between malty sweetness and delicate hop bitterness Hops Chinook Willamette and Cascade IBU
Formerly Calico Copper Amber Ale

American Amber Ale is the second ever beer created by Rogue brewmaster John Maier This tawny amber brew with toffee aroma delicate roasted malt notes and smooth finish displays what beer judges call the perfect embodiment of an American Amber Ale Ingredients C C Row Rogue Farms Dare Risk Malts Rogue Farms Rebel Hops Free Range Coastal Water Pacman Yeast º PLATO IBU AAº Lovibond

This classic American amber ale blends pale chocolate and caramel malts to create well rounded flavorful beer Caramel malts lend whispers of toffee and an enjoyable sweetness while touch of bittering hops gives this beer its clean finish Crafted for balance Avalanche is versatile and satisfying anytime beer

The name CascaZilla Cas kuh zil uh is play on both the name of gorge in Ithaca called Cascadilla and the monster amounts of Cascade Hops we use to make the beer The predominant flavor and aroma of this beer comes from fresh American hops CascaZilla gets its distinctive red color from healthy portion of caramel malt which also lends to the beer hearty body and sweetness It is hoppy red ale

Our Amber is sweet malty medium bodied ale with spicy floral hop finish It brewed with row Pale Crystal and Chocolate malts And we hop it with Mt Hoods and Cascades We re as proud of it today as we were back in And over the years it earned more than Gold Medals Not that we re keeping track or anything IBU

Pat ASK ala Pata SKALA Pa TASK la While those in the know favor the third pronunciation no matter how you say it this is unique red IPA The beer was first brewed in September to support music and arts education programs in Pataskala Ohio where Stone co founder Greg Koch grew up People there loved it so we added the beer to our seasonal lineup The deep crimson hue is courtesy of fairly new special German malt variety by BESTMALZ called Red Dry hopped with Mosaic Cascade and Amarillo hops this beer is incredibly citrus forward rounded out with biscuit and toffee notes We think you ll find this red IPA to be quite deliciously satisfying no matter how you choose to pronounce it

Prohibition Ale is the first beer we bootlegged back in Anything but traditional and now GABF winning brew American Amber Red Category Prohibition pours deep reddish amber hue with fluffy tan head that leaves beautiful lacing on the glass lush complex aroma teases the senses with juicy grapefruit citrus pine spice and candied caramel malts Mouth feel is creamy with silky medium body and modest carbonation

Ommegang and HBO announce the newest beer in the Game of Thrones collaboration series Through its first three seasons the critically acclaimed drama has become the biggest show on HBO Named after the motto of House Targaryen Fire and Blood is inspired by Daenerys Targaryen and her three dragons Drogon Rhaegal and Viserion To celebrate the rebirth of dragons three different labels were created by the Game of Thrones visual effects specialists each depicting one of Daenerys feared dragons Randomly distributed amongst the cases each case will contain all three bottles On sale March in time for the debut of Season Fire and Blood makes for the perfect season premiere pairing The beer is available in ml bottles and barrel kegs Fire Blood is ABV Red ale brewed with pilsner Cara Midnight Wheat flaked rye and spelt Assertive hopping includes CTZ Styrian Golding and German Tettnang hops Spiced with de seeded Ancho chilies Fire Blood has deep dark red hue with persistent creamy off white head Aromas of ripe fruit raisins malt slight spice followed by slightly floral and spicy hop character fruity sweetish malt taste gives way to faint drying provided by the hops rye

Like many of our beers Red Wheelbarrow which started out as pilot batch brewed by Brewer Dan Roberts doesn fit neatly into style category think of it as stronger more hop forward interpretation of traditional red ale Red Wheelbarrow is not however red IPA there is robust malt character think raisin and fig on both the nose and palate that temper the abundant hop presence think citrus fruit

BigLeaf Maple Autumn Red is quaffable well balanced red ale with character Its malty complexity and coppery color come from combination of two caramel malts pale malt and hint of maple syrup To complement these flavors we used three additions of Nelson Sauvin hops in the brewkettle and unique blend of Nelson Sauvin Citra and Cascade for dry hopping The result is distinctive fall seasonal with extraordinary depth and intriguing aroma

Switchback Ale First sold October nd Using only traditional ingredients Switchback Ale is reddish amber ale which is particularly well balanced allowing for complexity of flavor coupled with an unusually smooth and refreshing character Five different malts select hop varieties and our own specially cultivated yeast create an ale which leads with hop flavors and subtle impression of fruit our yeast contribution followed by palate pleasing malty finish Our own special process uses the yeast to naturally carbonate the beer and we leave it unfiltered The result is satisfying brew full of flavor with remarkably clean and smooth finish

The energy and audacity of the fixed gear courier inspired us to create Fixed Gear big bold American Red IPA It pours glaring crimson tone with rocky white head and brilliant floral citrus aroma thanks to an aggressive Centennial Cascade and Chinook dry hopping Gratuitous amounts of dark caramel malts lend Fixed Gear its immodest malty spine while Chinook and Cascade hops impart its balanced citrus bite This one got an attitude The hop flavor in Fixed Gear mingles well with Indian spices like tamarind coriander and cardamom try it with tandoori chicken or pork vindaloo with rice on the side Also goes great with grilled burgers steaks or baby back ribs

Formerly M Saint Five AMStart the car The lights are about to turn amber Buy the ticket take the ride Past the alley where thieves and pimps sell corporate brews and good men soak it up like vermin blissful in their ignorance Past the jackhammers who want their three and half percent Keep going Towards that golden orb the size of Zeus ass that hovers over this crazy town Sleep late have fun get wild drink amber and drive like bastard towards that saintly light IBU

Label of oz bottle Ingredients Pale row Munich Carastan Chocolate Malts Horizon Amarillo Cascade Rogue Farm Willamette Hops Pacman Yeast Free Range Coastal Water No Chemicals No Preservatives No Additives Dedicated to the Hansen brothers Sig Edgar and Norman the Rogues of the Bering Sea Portions of proceeds of Northwestern Ale will support the Fisherman Fund º PLATO IBU AAº

One of our original hop beasts of burden makes its whimsically triumphant return Blood of the Unicorn is Pipeworks Ninja vs Unicorn hot redheaded sister Loaded with fruity and piney American hops this rouge equine always delivers

Don spend this Single Awareness Day alone grab beer This red blooded cousin of Evil Dead Red Ale our Halloween Brew is beautiful crimson color Notes of caramel toast and bittersweet chocolate balance an intense bouquet of floral hop aromas that we know you ll fall in love with The finish leaves pleasant full bodied sweetness on the palate that won spread angry rumors about you to all your friends like that one time when was ohh uhh Happy Valentine Day
Red ale brewed for the holiday season with specialty malts to achieve beautiful deep red hue and the aromas of fresh baked bread caramel and stone fruits Steeped with ginger root and orange peel IBU
India style Red Ale that uses Calypso other experimental hops
With fury of hop flavor and strong malt backbone this West Coast style amber is part ale part sensory eruption and All American Ambergeddon is brewed with passion and is best enjoyed that way

Substantial amounts of late kettle hop additions and dry hopping yields heady blend of fruity aromas of pineapple peach and citrus Those aromas continue into crisply bitter hop presence across the tongue but the judicious use of toasted and caramel specialty malts prevents the hop intensity from overwhelming the palate Locally sourced Michigan honey creates smooth dry finish that pulls everything together The India Red Ale style is variation on the IPA but with more caramel and toasted malt character and reddish hue Roundhouse was first brewed at our original brewery in downtown Kalamazoo in

Each Halloween we release this special concoction to celebrate one of our favorite holidays Deep blood red in color an intense aroma of pine and citrus from an abundance of American hops balances the sweetness and rich bready flavors of this beer caramel malts The result is fiendishly smooth brew that will make your taste buds scream with delight This beer pairs excellently with toffee caramel apples or your favorite horror flick

Also known as Red Roost Al at the Clam Catcher restaurant in La Jolla CA Mermaid Red The Siren Calling Inspired by the siren song Mermaid Red lures you in with sweet toffee malts and seductive red hue But don be fooled this hoppy red is dry hopped with blend of Pacific Northwest hops for big citrus and pine aroma and lingering dry finish IBU Food Pairings BBQ Chicken Pizza

The Duck Rabbit Amber Ale is medium bodied beer with lovely tawny copper bronze color The lightest of all our dark ales this is great introduction to full flavored beers This brew emphasizes malt complexity with layered caramel malt flavors We put lot of effort into getting The Duck Rabbit Amber Ale just right and we re extremely proud of the result Enjoy
An Imperial American Red Ale Ninkasi website alc vol ibus Always available in oz bottles and on draft

Saint Arnold Amber Ale is the brewery flagship product and first official brew well balanced full flavored amber ale it has rich malty body with pleasant caramel character derived from specialty Caravienne malt complex hop aroma with hint of floral and citrus comes from combination of Cascades and Liberty hops It has rich creamy head with fine lace The light fruitiness characteristic of ales is derived from proprietary yeast strain

Our legendary red ale This mahogany hued ale brings an intense spectrum of spicy aromatic hop character balanced by full bodied caramel richness Silver Medal winner at the Great American Beer Festival in the American Style Amber Red Ale category IBU Malts Row Pale Crystal Wheat Black PatentHops Columbus Chinook Cascade Willamette Summit

Formerly Morning WoodMourning Wood is an oak aged coffee amber ale Fresh American oak used during the aging process and Dark Matter El Salvador San Jose pulp natural coffee aromatically drive the beer yet they remain subtle components of the beers overall flavor profile This amber colored medium bodied and extraordinarily well balanced ale has delicate taste that is appreciated by beer drinkers of all palates

Who needs precious metals when you ve got Copper This copper colored ale is real crowd pleaser Copperhook strikes the perfect balance of smooth rich malty flavor you expect from craft brew with lighter body and hop profile that makes it perfect session beer when you ve got long day ahead of knocking back few with your buddies IBU

An IRA bursting with tropical notes this beer finishes juicy with subtle malty backbone After one taste it ll leave you wanting more It doesn take brains to know this IRA is delicious choice any time of year

Settle in with Wisconsin Snowshoe Ale This beer is brewed with blend of American and German malts We also infuse generous amounts of hops from Slovenia and the Great Pacific Northwest to add special note of warmth for your winter evening enjoyment Expect this beer to be beautiful copper red with fruity ale body and spiced hop finish Then sit back and rejoice in the season because it these Wisconsin winters that keep the whiners out
Red Fish is hoppy red ale Columbus Chinook and Cascade hops give the beer robust piney nose Two row crystal and cara red malts give the beer malty background and abv

Squeeze those hops for all they re worth Nugget Nectar will take hopheads to nirvana with heady collection of American hops Our Imperial Amber Ale is further intensified with whole flower Nugget hops added to our hopback vessel resulting in an explosion of citrus resin and pine IBU
Classified by the brewery as an Imperial Red Double IPA ABV IBUs

In the recipe was altered to bump the IBU from to ABV also increased from to In the ABV increased to luscious beauty Hop Head Red exudes resinous hoppy qualities from Amarillo Warrior and Nugget to overtake the full bodied depths of caramel malt base Captivating and seductive floral aromas and alluring hop flavors are the result of dry hopping with mountains of Amarillo The blissful union of Double India Pale and Red Ale make Hop Head Red an unforgettable obsession Experience love at first sip Every time
Our th Anniversary Beer in was Staff Favorite So We Make it Each Year BIG on the Amarillo Hops and Rich Dark Malts for Round and Huge Smoky Flavor
Don be afraid of things that go hop in the night Rich roasted malt flavors haunt the shadows of our Imperial Red Ale bitter teeth

Formerly Hog Heaven Barley WineOr is it hop heaven This dangerously drinkable garnet beauty was designed to satisfy the most zealous hop devotees Intense bitterness and the dankest of dry hopped aromas are intertwined with rich caramel malt backbone Oink

Also known as YuleSmith Winter Previously known as winter YuleSmith this warming hoppy ale used to be available exclusively during the holiday season But the popularity of this red hued India Pale Ale grew to the point where sharing limited run of beer with our fans seemed insufficient our answer was to convert this crimson IPA into seasonal offering to be enjoyed from fall through the winter months Caramel malt sweetness combines with citrusy highlights to bring forth dry highly drinkable beer that simultaneously hearty and thirst quenching the holidays are too brief to contain this much flavor

Is it really safe to paddle out in our waters It impossible to know for sure What we do know is that this is an incredibly distinctive and bold American red ale that attacks your taste buds with lethal amounts of hops which are balanced by boat load of Crystal malt If none of this fazes you then maybe swimming in the shark filled waters is exactly where you belong We ll see you in the lineup Winner Best of Show San Diego International Beer Festival

This One Goes to Ale opens with bright juicy aromas such as tropical fruits ripe cherries largely derived from massive kettle dry hop additions of Southern Hemisphere hop varieties such as Galaxy Motueka and Summer The citrus resinous pine notes of the Pacific Northwest hop family are also well represented making their presence known through Simcoe Citra and the newly released Mosaic varietal just to name few wide range of specialty malts anchor the hops to this Imperial Red Ale contrasting the assertive bitterness juicy aromatics with robust toasty depth of flavor Fermented with Bell signature house ale yeast This One Goes to Ale finishes with lingering warmth

What do you get when big bold imperial red IPA meets an oak bourbon barrel palate stunner that ll send your senses spinning or as we like to call it Dankwood Rich caramel notes emerge from the depths of the IPA highlighting strong malt character while the bourbon barrel aging develops the complexity dank sticky and slightly sweet sipper Dankwood is the perfect alchemy of wood and hops
Terrapin Big Hoppy Monster aged aged on oak or oak barrel Cask offering IBU

Pursuit of Hoppiness Imperial Red Ale is brewed to showcase the brash beauty of American hops Chinook Centennial and Columbus at International Bitterness Units IBU The hops grown in the United States are considered to be some of the best in the world Compared to their more traditionally subdued elegant European counterparts American hops are bold bright piney and zesty This ale is brewed with Idaho Row malted barley and German specialty malts to provide rich slightly caramel flavor and bold reddish color At degrees Plato starting gravity and about alcohol by volume this thick and warming beer is to be shared and savored IBU
A deep red malt forward ale brewed with plenty of caramel malts and touch of rye Brewed and dry hopped with Palisade and Zythos hops
This resiny imperial red ale is loaded with citrus and pine aromas that dominate the complex toasty malt character Revel in the hops

We can boldly say that this hoppy red is unlike any other you ve tried Hopped up to the max deep ruby in color with smooth as silk mouthfeel and an almost pungent piney aroma Malts bone up their magic with hearty biscuity almost rustic touch of flavor and slightly bitter fruitiness creamy head always tops it off Bonefide with gold medal at the GABF full bodied Imperial Red Ale brewed with massive amount of Pacific Northwest hops that are complemented by caramel malts Dry hopped and hop backed with Simcoe hops give this beer it pungent piney aroma

Our Imperial Red Ale is brewed with whole Cascade hops and dry hopped in both the fermenter and the serving tank with whole Crystal hops flavorful hoppy delight balanced with caramel sweetness and alcohol warmth

Our first high gravity offering this dry hopped Imperial Red Ale has huge malt presence peaking out of its many hop additions Dark mahogany red with nice fluffy head the Fire Ant showcases roasted and toasted caramel notes layered between spicy fruity and herbal hops

A double red ale that seems to indicate an intensity of flavor simply by it dark reddish brown appearance Subtle aromas of candy brown sugar and toasted malt seem reluctantly released from the depths of this full bodied beast Raisins figs and burnt caramel are among some of the sweeter flavors up front before giving way to roasted cocoa like bitterness that becomes magnified by high alpha hops Considering the initial overall sweetness it a heightened bitterness that dominates the finish IBU
This beer a real firecracker Bursts of hop character sparkle out from this red brew This delicious sipper is best enjoyed on picnic blanket or in backyard

A Double Red IPAThis is heavy duty abv red ale with profusion of hop flavor and aroma This beer is as big and proud as Texas Because we add almost two pounds of American hops per barrel very late in the beer making process The Imperial Texan is able to retain wondrously piney and resinous hop character that perfectly balances its smooth but strong and dry malt backbone This beer has sticky presence that puts each sip perfectly on the tongue The Imperial Texan was brewed to enjoy around fire with close friends while reminiscing over the day killer mountain bike ride

King Crimson is an Imperial Red Ale that delivers royal bounty of luscious fruity American hops on top of sturdy deep red malt backbone This beer is lavishly dry hopped with Simcoe adding citrusy and piney flavor and aroma to the toasty sweet malt notes This special treat is very limited Winter release so enjoy it while you can IBU
Malt Pilsner Malt Aromatic Malt Caramel CaraRedHops Magnum Zeus Centennial Falconer Flight IBU estimated
A dial it up to version of Louise Demise Amber Ale aged in bourbon barrels

A boldly flavored double red ale Combining caramel malt for sweetness mixed with nice alcohol and plenty of dry and late kettle hop aromas from three killer America strains create beer that is tough to compare

The big brother of our Tyranny Red Ale this heavily dry hopped ale is delicious creation Tyrant is full of malt rich flavors backed up with deep pine herb and grapefruit peel aromas all around hop heads dream This is big bad beer that drinks little too easy for the abv
Imperial Red Ale aged months in whiskey barrels from Koval Distillery

Extra Special Red is our imperial red ale crimson hued brew full of juicy hop flavors and aromas of pine and stone fruit After months of aging in rye whiskey casks it was roused from its oak cradle to the bottle in your hands The barrels impart notes of sweet vanilla and soft tannins while the hops settle into the background in favor of the strong malt foundation Slainte
Imperial amber ale aged in bourbon barrels
Brewed with royalty in mind no expense was spared in crafting our Imperial Red Generous additions of our favorite hop varieties blend harmoniously with long layers of dark caramel malts

Loaded with West Coast hops it could really be called Red Double IPA Citrus and tropical fruit aromas are the first thing you ll notice about Kroovy but don overlook the slight caramel maltiness or the body provided from adding malted rye to the beer Kroovy will satisfy even the biggest hophead

Our Bone Warmer is brewed the same way using only the first runnings from an extraordinarily thick strong mash of Idaho Row Metcalfe and Harrington barley malt along with dark German Munich and caramel malts We subtly spiced it with Idaho Chinook hops fermented it at cool temperatures and cold conditioned it for smoothness and drinkability The resulting ale is the color of roasting chestnuts It is voluptuously malty and only slightly sweet with hint of toffee and warming dry finish It an ideal accompaniment to rich meaty stews wild game roasted fowl or root vegetables and aged cheddars

This imperial or Double Red Ale has intense hop bitterness flavor and aroma balanced by high notable alcohol content fruity esters and caramel malt character It is dark reddish copper in color and full bodied IBU

BIG HOPPY RED Irish beer gone incognito Our IRA has beautiful burnt orange red color with the unmistakable aroma and flavor of American hops This beer is brewed to be dry with full flavor of Nugget Apollo Cascade dry hopping With over two pounds of hops per barrel that a lot its like no beer ever brewed in Erie

Part of the hop odyssey Gold medal in Category Imperial Red Ale at the World Beer Cup This bold Imperial Red Ale is brewed with blend of our favorite English crystal malts providing sturdy balance to the firm bitterness and citrusy floral hop aroma Brewed with Simcoe Centennial and Amarillo hops
Our Hawk Owl Amber Ale laid down on Grand Travese Distilary bourbon
IBU

Smithwick is clear beer with rich ruby color and creamy head Clean and delicate aroma with different individual notes from the top fermentation by the Smithwick yeast come aromatic esters creating fruity aroma The Aroma Hops added late in the boil contribute clean fresh floral notes Ale Malt contributes aroma hints of biscuit and caramel Refreshing and clean taste with gentle balance of bitterness from the hops added early in the boil sweet malty notes from the ale malt and hints of roast coffee from the roasted barley
Pale and Caramel malts and East Kent Goldings hops
A pint for Pa Conway Our co owners grandfather who likely uphold that an Irish Ale with full bodied caramel malt flavors is just the ticket
An Irish Cream Ale though this style does not exist on BeerAdvocate com and the closest style is Irish Red Ale

Irish Ale Boulevard early spring seasonal beer is our Midwestern tribute to the legendary red ales of old Ireland Our recipe combines six kinds of pale and roasted barley malts to provide rich toasty flavor and tawny reddish hue IBU

A traditional European style ale handcrafted by the Samuel Adams brewers Only available on tap in select locations in and around Boston See http www samueladams com for list of participating locations

The Magician is lustrous dark red London style Red Ale with rich grain bill The grain combination lends complex notes of toasted caramel raisins chocolate and roasted toffee Very light hop additions let the true malt characters show throughout this beer IBU

Ale brewed with four leaf clovers While karma biting you in the ass it kissing his profit of prosperity he the guy you love to hate And just when you think his fate on the brink that bastard life falls right back into place Malts Irish Pale CaramelHops GalaxyYeast English AleIBU

Our most versatile beer Good to drink as well as cook with Light enough to quench thirst and complex enough to accompany fine dining Caramel malty sweet fades to chocolate roasty finish and dry from touch of rye OG IBU
IBU
A rich malty brew that uses red wheat and variety of crystal malts giving this beer its ruby red hue Traditional English hops give this easy drinking brew flavor that perfect year round IBU

Our flagship this Irish Style Red Ale proudly won gold medal at the World Beer Cup combination of different malts and hop varietals carefully blended results in perfect balance Full flavored and medium bodied the Riptide Red provides surprising complexity for such an easy drinking brew

A Silver Medal winner in Strong Ales at the Great American Beer Festival This Irish style strong ale is brewed with secret blend of five imported specialty malts Not too hoppy in order to emphasize the complex malt flavor and fruity aroma IBU

Brewed in the tradition of the great English ales its rich honey color hints at its smooth caramel flavoring With medium body and slightly sweet finish this is an extremely drinkable brew that is characterized by rich malt taste and low bitterness Medaled at the and Great American Beer Festivals and award winner at the World Beer Cup

Why should St Patrick Day just be day when you can make whole season out of it Crack open The Craic and let the friendly banter bursts of laughter and toe tapping music of the season get your eyes smiling This hybrid ale combines two classic styles IPA and Irish Red Ale to create unique and flavorful beer Th malt combination commonly used in Irish Red Ales brings toasted malty flavor that balances the citrusy and fruity character of the hops The Levels of Craic Have you tried our new Irish Red IPA The Craic As we prepare for all things Irish for Harpoon St Pat Fest on March rd and th we thought it would only be right to give you little bit more history about the phrase the craic Pronounced just like drug crack crack is whack btw it a term for news gossip fun entertainment and enjoyable conversation You ll often hear What the Craic in Ireland which is like saying What Happening But perhaps our favorite part of the word craic is that there are actually levels of craic you can reach according to IrelandCentral Check em out Level One Good Craic It an okay night out but nothing to write home about we don know why we mentioned this because honestly St Pat Fest could never be just at level one but the more you know Level Two Mighty Craic It obviously little bit better than good craic but we still haven hit the amazing level One or two of your friends may have done
