something little bit crazy Hopefully you caught it on Snapchat Level Three Savage Craic This is getting closer to how we describe St Pat A great time with your friends beers flowing great bands food and jokes You got number you gave number you get the idea Level Four Deadly Craic This is most likely just before you hear Shipping Up to Boston by the Dropkick Murphy right It just step about savage but not quite the pinnacle moment Level Five The craic was ninety Wait what We ve read that this phrase comes from famous song by The Dubliners get your Irish jig on but essentially it the best night ever Which is what we hope you ll leave St Pat fest saying Level Six Minus Craic When night goes terribly wrong As employee owners we ve seen several of our consumers and friends to be honest hit this level Don be that guy So now that you know what level of craic are you looking for this St Pat Fest

Scarlet Fire is an Irish American style Red Ale The name is reference to the playful improvisational transitions between Grateful Dead songs Scarlet Begonias and Fire on the Mountain Great balance of malt sweetness from caramel malt and subtle toasty notes from roasted barley Brewed withj American Ale yeast and East Kent Golding hops it pays tribute to it heritage as an Irish Red Ale GABF Gold Medal Winner IBU

A Silver Medal winner in Strong Ales at the Great American Beer Festival This Irish style strong ale is brewed with secret blend of five imported specialty malts Not too hoppy in order to emphasize the complex malt flavor and fruity aroma IBU

More than just beer to satisfy and soothe it an emotional experience Deepest ruby red and filled with symphony of malt flavors including caramel toffee raisins and currants that finish with simple hint of roast and chocolate tones lingering like half remembered dream This gentle giant balanced with English hops dominates all senses without destroying the palate Sexy As Hell
An Irish style red amber beer Light in finish but bold in taste Melanoidin malt is added for the red color and the spicy finish comes through from the Chinook hops

Although there are lot of Irish red beers out there only few of them feature the slightly roasted flavor that made this style legendary Not surprisingly this flavor comes from the addition of small amount of roasted malt the same thing that gives the beer its deep ruby hue Ours also uses hops from the United Kingdom to lend even more Irish authenticity to the style It is the perfect brew to enjoy while watching St Patrick Day parades from Boston to New Haven and beyond IBU

Our fresh brewed Fire Chief Ale is medium bodied auburn colored Ale that gets its pleasant sweetness and lightly toasted character from select caramel and crystal malts Hand selected hops from the Pacific Northwest lend crisp and satisfying citrus finish
An easy drinking Amber Ale with low bitterness subtle malt profile and balanced finish Availability Jan Mar

Rollin Dirty Red Ale our Irish style Ale possesses deep amber color It displays forward caramel aroma with hints of chocolate and roasted nuts English hop varietals lend floral to herbal bitterness which helps to round the carmel sweetness and lend some crispness to this year round ale

Named for our Beer Man Nick Murphy this deep malty Irish amber ale is relaxed and easy going change of pace from our usual hop bombs this beer is sure to put smile on the face of any Irishman Who needs pot gold when you got yerself pint red IBU
Celtic Red Ale
A malt driven Irish style red ale balance by the hop varieties Fuggles and East Kent Golding
A dark red Irish red with roasty overtones and subtle apple fruity finish IBU

This classic beer style was inspired by centuries of Celtic brewing history Specialty kilned malts such as dark caramel and munich dominate the Irish Red resulting in ruby red colour and smooth malty taste IBU

There was particular attention to the malt bill using pale munich wheat and rye There was no fruit harmed in the making of this beer however you can avoid the beautiful banana esters and clove phenals that the Weihenstephan weizen yeast expresses Rasselbock is German style Dark Rye Wheat beer IBU
Historic Roggen Beer Naturally cloudy

Roggenbier is an ancient style of beer from Germany that actually became extinct for years it is unfiltered like the Wit beer because the style predates filtration lot of bad language was used during the first brew to earn the name Schleimhammer meaning Slime Hammer in German after the mess it caused We learned lot and the second brew went better Producing delicious beer with hint of dryness from the Nugget hops and some rich fruitiness and aroma from the German Hefeweizen yeast IBU
Also sold as Schlägl Roggen Gold in the United States

Brewed with rye European specialty malts and Czech Saaz hops Tippy Toboggan is an old world Roggen Bier distant cousin to our Weiss bier With fresh fruity aroma and complex nutty spicy malt character it chock full of flavor yet relatively light and easy drinking IBU
Traditional German dark rye beer with huge fruity nose from Bavarian ale yeast Hints of unsweetened chocolate and caramel from the specialty malts mix with touch of spiciness from the rye IBU

This German style rye beer is brewed with over percent rye malt for pleasant spiciness and it has low hop rates dark amber color medium body chocolate light caramel roasted malt flavors sweetness and aroma and Hefe yeast characters IBU

This old school style features the banana and clove character and toasted bread notes found in classic Bavarian wheat beers but as it also calls for the substitution of rye for wheat the Roggenbier adopts extra spiciness body perfect for those sweater wearing winter nights IBUOG PlatoHOPS PerleMALTS Rye Pilsner Munich
Our unfiltered deep russet German style Roggenbier combines classic Weizen like yeast characteristics with spicy and complex rye malts
Brewed with four varieties of Belgian caramel malts and Amarillo hops IBUFormerly called Founders Red Rye PA

Rugged and resilient rye has been staple grain for ages and its spicy black pepper like flavor has been prized by distillers and brewers for centuries Rye thrives in the harshest conditions and comes to life in Ruthless rugged IPA with fruity citrus and herbal hop notes countered by the dry spiciness of the rye Holding steadfast balance between contrasting malt and hop character Ruthless is bold enough to inspire even the most brazen hop head to bear down and embrace the flavor

A high gravity IPA brewed with rye malt Hop Rod Rye has floral hop aroma and subtle caramel notes with slightly earthy and spicy rye character California State Fair GOLD California State Fair GOLD Real Ale Festival Chicago GOLD

Why Rye This assertively flavorful grain is more often associated with whiskey than with ales Even in that arena it has largely been eclipsed by corn and barley the sources of bourbon and scotch But when we procured some seasoned barrels from our friends at Templeton Rye we asked ourselves Why not Why not brew rich tawny rye ale then mellow it in the warmth of charred oak rye whiskey casks Two kinds of malted rye provide spicy sweetness giving way to notes of caramelized wood and the citrusy tang of Perle Magnum and Saphir hops before easing into dry lingering finish IBU
Dry but with creamy touch of Thai Palm Sugar and the spicy tang of Rye all balanced by loads of the wackiest new Hops we could lay our hands on Yep it an Orignal And that no Sin IBU

A big unfiltered American IPA built to accompany the big Eastern Winter Just like an epic bluebird day follows snow storm peppery build from the Rye malt accompanies glorious hop notes of pine citrus and fresh grass

The Routes des Épices is rye beer in which pepper has been added during the brewing process lending it wonderful peppery flavours and aromas The beer also reveals flavours of malt fresh cereal chocolate caramel and hint of fruit In the aftertaste the pepper flavour is once again revealed in full strength and it leaves pleasing spicy tingling sensation on the tongue nice balance is attained between its spiciness and its multitude of other flavours

This West Coast style pale ale is brewed with English barley malts and rye malt It boasts massive floral aroma of resinous hops contributing notes of lemons peaches and pine needles and is anchored by the sweet malty flavors of toffee and freshly baked pumpernickel bread

No children no cry In true Rastafarian spirit drinking our RastafaRye Ale directly benefits underprivileged kids Everything is Irie with our award winning RastafaRye Ale hearty rye malt blended with fresh West Coast hops resulting in delicious deep copper ale with just the right amount of rye flavor to offset the spicy floral characteristics of the hops The Blue Point Brewing Company donates portion of all RastafaRye Ale sales to They Often Cry Outreach TOCO Taj Weekes charity foundation that helps orphaned and underprivileged children in the Caribbean and around the world
This rye ale is our TROPICAL ESCAPE to sunnier state of mind availability rotating year round productionABV OG Hops Mosaic CentennialMalts row malted rye caramel

Originally released as part of our Short Batch Series our Rhye IPA arose from our desire to play with rye malt It built on Finestkind IPA chassis with the following changes We tweaked the grain bill adding rye malt and swapped Aromatic malt for Rye adds spicy note while Aromatic malt adds more subtle flavor than but increases malt aroma We lowered the mash rest temperature few degrees giving the final beer less body and more drinkability We jacked up the dry hopping to four times the level of Finest Kind for big hop aroma IBU

An amber ale brewed with rye malt and aged in rye whiskey barrels Our first barrel aged beer here at Against the Grain is the Kentucky Ryed Chiquen Named so because it was made in Kentucky has lot of Rye in it and was aged in rye barrels and it not Chicken As we all know or should know Chiquen refers to anything that is not chicken Now that we have all that straight we will talk about what is in this beer Brewed with Maris Otter from the UK and rye malt and caramel rye from Germany imparting spicy fruity and dry flavor Then hopped with enough English Nugget and Kent Goldings just to balance and fermented with our house ale yeast After fermentation we moved the entire batch into the AtG private dining room and into used Redemption Rye barrels from our good friends at Strong Spirits There it aged for weeks until we felt it had picked up the right amount of residual bourbon character and oak flavors We then transferred it to our serving tank carbonated it and the end result is on tap now balanced drinkable and complex barrel aged beer

Six is dark rye beer with layered flavors including chocolate caramel pepper wood cherry and tropical fruit It starts semi dry and smooth and finishes fully dry and tart with small bite from the hops The overall balance of the Six makes it easy to pair with richly prepared meats along with many harder cheeses Malts organic pale caramel rye blackUnmalted rolled ryeHops magnum tettnanger
Rye ale with agave nectar and habanero peppers

Chart new course with Daymark as your guide We start with classic clean and crisp American pale ale brewed with spicy Columbus and Centennial hops Then we accent the grain bill with rye grown on small local family farms right here in Maine and malted to our specifications at Valley Malts an artisanal malt house Finally we dry hop the finished beer for bright floral aroma

Inspired by the success of our series of special Imperial Stout releases we ve embarked on journey to the outer reaches of our popular Rye on Rye For this inaugural release rich tawny rye ale is aged in first use rye whiskey barrels then transferred to yet another set of first use rye whiskey barrels for second aging effectively resulting in Rye on Rye on Rye

With creamy body and rich roasty flavors Scarlett is the perfect complement to the cooler months of Fall Winter This rye ale pours deep red with sticky off white layer of foam and medium levels of carbonation Note the aromas of fresh rye bread caramel malt and earthy hops Sweet malts are accented by subtle flavors of caramel toffee and chocolate Notes of toasted grain leather and mild peppery spice lead to medium dry finish
Formerly Rye Hopper

One of the few small grains still grown in Southwestern Minnesota malted rye is the base for this one of kind ale brewed and aged in tiny Lucan Minnesota Following long slow fermentation the beer is stored away in used rye whiskey barrels brought North from our friends at Templeton located in the equally tiny town of Templeton Iowa

There is no doubt variety is the spice of life and we love going off in all kinds of directions looking for new flavors Like all travel though at some point your heart turns back toward home Home robust American ales This route travels along path of piney American hops Simcoe Cluster and Horizon their natural course coaxed toward spicy by touch of rye Drink Red Rye Returning because home is where the hops is IBU

This special brew incorporates malted rye in the grain bill lending spicy character and complex flavors Generously hopped with Amarillo Simcoe Cascade and Centennial This hoppy pale ale has sneaky bite that will creep up and leave you smiling

Created by the brewers at The Open Gate Brewery as holiday gift for their colleagues friends and families Guinness Rye Pale Ale proved so popular they had to share it with everyone The rustic spicy character of rye grain is balanced with citrus and grapefruit from the mosaic and cascade hops making it fine addition to the Guinness family

Our most complex grain bill and moderate bitterness join forces to produce this bold malty and spicy IPA Dry hopped with blend of American aroma hop varietals this is best consumed fresh Fun Fact Originally brewed with Tyler Jones of Black Hog Brewing Co

A heavy dose of rye breathes new life into this other worldly strong ale Supple spice and barley sweetness strike balance in the young beer before its enlightenment in Heaven Hill Rye Whiskey barrels Ethereal waves of dark fruit and vanilla ascend from the depths as the elixir warms while the rye character lends stunningly silky mouthfeel Perhaps it a doorway to an existential awakening or maybe it just damned fine beer
An aggressively hopped American Style India Pale Ale brewed with Columbus Simcoe and Amarillo hops The use of rye gives this ale it trademark dry and spicy character

As days get shorter and sleeves get longer Baxter Brewing releases its fall seasonal Hayride Autumn Ale generous portion of two rye malts give the beer full body bready flavor and subtle spiciness while toasted malts provide touch of sweetness and rich almost reddish hue New Zealand Pacifica and Pacific Jade hops balance Hayride maltiness and suggest notes of oranges and tropical fruit Finally we cold condition the beer on oak with light additions of ginger black pepper and orange peel bringing out the spiciness of the rye and rounding out the soft sweetness of the beer Hayride will give touch of warmth for those cool fall nights while remaining deliciously drinkable

Madison River Brewing Company presents Salmon Fly Honey Rye The malted barley used in this unique brew is complimented by the subtle spiciness of rye Bittering and flavor hop additions help keep this brew extremely balanced In addition there is mild sweetness that dulls any overwhelming rye or hop flavor derived from the pure local Montana honey These ingredients blend together to create lighter bodied drinking experience for all kinds of beer drinkers IBU

A malted magic hop bomb Rich caramel and toasted malts team up with flaked rye and march to the beat of big but balancing bitterness only to be overtaken by an onslaught of American hop aroma and flavor You want tame and subservient spineless beer that takes orders well and doesn challenge anything or anyone This ain it

Cameron Rye Pale Ale ABV is one of our most popular seasonal beers It was originally brewed for the Bar Volo IPA challenge earning nd Place by combining the best parts of American and British IPA styles we achieved robust and unique staple This fusion is hazy orange amber in colour with well constructed white head It begins with an up front citrus aroma followed by complex malt body with hint of peppery rye which releases earthy floral British hop flavour on the finish It is made of combination of seven different floral British and pungent American hops some which are added in dry hopping process This involves adding hops directly to the fermented beer in the fermenter The hops are well supported by large malt bill of five character malts with generous portion of rye which contributes to mouth feel and Cameron Rye Pale Ale own special character
This West Coast style Rye IPA was made with legendary punk band NOFX and is sure to stick Brewed with spicy rye and boatload of Simcoe and Falconer Flight hops this is one dank pale ale

We re not saying you should worship what inside the barrel but there a certain righteousness about an ale made with three types of rye malts and then smoothed out in blend of rye whiskey and bourbon barrels The journey spans months but the results are undeniable RIGHTEOUS endeavor indeed DRINK NOW OR AGE UP TO MONTHS TO WATCH IT EVOLVE DEALER CHOICE
An American style IPA with large additions of rye malt and Falconer Flight hops creating bold citrus notes and earthy spicyness IBU

Here at Brooklyn Brewery we are of course beer people But we are also drinks people and many inspirations come to us out of the deep and wondrous world of cocktails While surely invented earlier the modern cocktail emerged in the th century The original the ur cocktail if you will was the Old Fashioned deceptively simple drink consisting of whiskey sugar and bitters stirred not shaken usually with bit of citrus peel good Old Fashioned remains thing of austere beauty By the s some bartenders Jerry Thomas aka The Professor chief among them became household names in America mixologist believe it or not the moniker is actually old looking to make name for himself would often make change to an existing cocktail perhaps adding absinthe or curaçao or dash of maraschino liqueur This new version would be rakishly referred to as improved as the upstart barman fervently hoped to eclipse his predecessor Well we ve gone this idea one better We have improved the Old Fashioned by making it into beer Witness our strong rye beer suffused with various spices and peels Wonder at its long blissful rest in WhistlePig Rye Whiskey oak barrels Marvel at its clever infusions of bitter gentian root and enticing botanicals And then enjoy as you are greeted by the silky spice of rye the firm herbal bitterness the brightness of citrus and the sweet warmth of oak Sit in your favorite chair surround yourself with your favorite people and imbibe this our latest Brooklyn Quarterly Experiment We can nearly guarantee that you shall feel that your day has in fact improved Style Barrel aged rye ale with botanicals bittersMalts Glen Eagle Maris Otter Canadian row Weyermann Rye Fawcett Rye Fawcett Crystal RyeAdditions Demerara sugar Belgian candi syrup bitter orange peel lemon peel nutmeg cinnamon coriander bitter gentian root cloves and aging in WhistlePig Rye whiskey barrelsHops PerleYeast Our House Ale YeastOriginal Gravity Plato

Expect lovely warm smells of single malt scotch oaky bourbon barrels smoke sweet caramel and roasted malts bit of earthy spice and scintilla of dark fruit It a kick back sipper made to excite the palate

So good it almost wrong Dark ruby in color and brewed with seven varieties of imported malts Complex in finish with hints of smoke and peat paired with malty richness and right hook of hop power to give it the bad attitude that beer named Dirty Bastard has to live up to Ain for the wee lads Brewed with varieties of malt varies over the years IBU
From the Oskar Blues website This jaw dropping Scottish strong ale ABV is brewed with bodacious amounts of malted barley and specialty grains and dash of beechwood smoked malt

For those of you who don know who Scotty Karate is He is local one man band who plays an amazing slurry of honky tonk influenced punk country songs Check him out at www scottykaratetime com big bold musician deserves big bold beer that why Scotty and our Scotch Ale are perfect tribute to one another Scotty Karate is brewed with cherry wood smoked malt instead of the traditional peat smoked malt offering up warming notes of coffee caramel and sweet caramelized brown sugar Scotty finishes earthy giving this beer character all it own just like the man himself

We made this beer specifically for bourbon barrels The result is our most acclaimed bourbon barrel beer Bourbon barrel aging and specialty malts create flavors of vanilla and caramel that blend in perfect balance

Named for medieval Scottish sword Claymore Scotch Ale is our tribute to the legendary Wee Heavy beers of Scotland This malty deep ruby beauty features lots of caramel sweetness reserved hop profile and subtle warming character Unlike its namesake this beer only requires one hand but it ll still make you feel like nobility

A classic Scotch Ale Scotch ales are typically sweet and malty with very subdued dose of hops just enough to provide balance AleSmith Wee Heavy is wonderful interpretation of this traditional Scotch style

OLD CHUB NITRO takes you deeper into the rich malty flavors of the original brobdingnagian Scotch Ale while the nitrogen widget liberates cascading uber silky smooth oral experience only the CAN provides This jaw dropping Scottish strong ale ABV is brewed with bodacious amounts of malted barley and specialty grains and dash of beechwood smoked malt Old Chub Nitro features semi sweet flavors of cocoa and coffee and wee bit of smoke head turning treat for malt heads and folks who think they don dig dark beer
Cherrywood smoked Scotch ale aged in used year old bourbon barrels

Traquair Jacobite Ale is Scotch ale with an ancient ingredient coriander rich deep flavors are accented by exotic coriander aroma Traquair House Brewery located within Scotland oldest inhabited house uses copper kettle and oak fermenters to produce this fine ale first brewed in to commemorate the Jacobite Revolution
Formerly brewed by The Caledonian Brewing Company

Big Sound Scotch Ale is dedicated to our good buddy Gino the most Punk Rock Bagpiper you will ever meet and the rest of the men and women of the Tampa Bay Pipes and Drums Brown in color Big Sound has huge notes of dark sweet toffee with underlying mild notes of coffee in the aroma The flavor starts with slight note of cherry and then opens into goliath of malt character with notes of dark sweet toffee coffee and mild notes of toasted bread in the finish Big Sound Scotch Ale pairs well with Haggis Highland Games Huge Heads Enormous pillows and of course Bagpipe Music IBU

It OK to be Wee Heavy Much has been made of the ills of smoking Jinx thinks there nothing wrong with it For years he stood strong with his peat smoked whiskey malt mash He held his head high when others made fun of his wee heavy physique becoming mainstay in Magic Hat Night of the Living Dead Variety Pak People said he never attain an Original Gravity above degrees Plato or an ABV above He proved them wrong Take Magic Hat into the next alellenium Vote Jinx IBU

Équinoxe du Printemps French for spring equinox is the quintessential marriage of two great traditions beer brewing in Scotland and maple syrup production in Quebec At the first draught the mouth is overcome by woody malty flavours sustained by discrete touch of sweetness The aftertaste brings about the flavours of maple which are sufficiently present to be appreciated but never overwhelming the typical flavours of Scotch Ale Equinoxe du printemps is brewed only once year in January It is aged for two months in order to attain perfect balance in taste Then it is sold starting March st until stocks last The Equinoxe du printemps was born in our Montreal brewpub in February

OG IBU Formerly called Arcadia Scotch AleOur tribute to the Scottish Highlands this beer offers gorgeous garnet color joined by the aroma of ripe plums and freshly baked biscuits The rich full bodied texture reveals notes of roasted chestnuts and caramel in the smooth single malt style brew Balanced with just the right amount of hop character this beer delights with crisp alcohol finish

Our Scotch Ale is bold amber beer that balances smooth rich sweetness with hint of peat smoked malt The infusion of this subtle smokiness invites images of heather fields platters of haggis the poetry of William McGonagall Enjoy one with your mates

The Duck Rabbit Scotch Ale is full bodied deep copper colored treasure Bold and malty this beer sweetness comes from massive quantity of grain complemented by some serious kettle carmelization The flavor is rounded out by warming alcohol sensation

A roasty scotch ale with hint of smoke Full bodied but not overpowering Smokey but not in creepy bar kind of way Sweet but not obnoxiously so Sound like your ideal mother in law Fair enough but it also is pretty dead on description of our Scotch Ale In difficult hop growing climate Scottish brewers relied on other ingredients to impart flavor and bitterness one such ingredient was smoked malt Drafty Kilt is dark malty bombshell of beer

Formulated with Montana grown row barley northwest Goldings hops and lotsa love this hearty ale drinks very smooth Not bitter at all and not too sweet either Novice beer drinkers have been known to take taste and then say WOW That not what expected that GOOD hint of roasted barley lends slight coffee like smoky finish With abv this beer is perfect after day of rippin lines on area or your favorite back country getaway IBU

Building upon Scottish Wee Heavy this unique beer was developed to provide strong caramel malt flavour with enough salt to give it bit of bite Stronger in alcohol this beer starts off sweet but remains fairly light to drink

A hearty red brown Wee Heavy Scotch Ale has all the smokey sweet complex malt goodness you could wish for Peated caramel and lightly toasted malts brewed just right give you smooth beer with delicate hop finish and creamy head
Previously known as Fat Bastard Ale Fat Scotch Ale big bastard of an award winning brew Exceptionally smooth with rich maltiness touch of smoky peat character

Dark brown cider color Medium slightly creamy body Aroma of toasted malt caramel some fruit Flavor of roasted sweet malt caramel dark fruit nuts and raisins Nicely balanced IBU

Our signature Scottish Ale is the beer we ve brewed the longest and is our best selling bottle world wide We brew it from Scottish Optic and Crystal barley malts for nutty biscuit character balanced with subtle spiciness from Challenger and Goldings hops for an all around satisfying beer George Howell Master Brewer Belhaven

We introduced Shilling our flagship beer at our opening party in For while we been wondering what would happen if we lightened up the traditional Scottish ale The result is an irresistibly smooth and delicious medium bodied amber ale

This is our firstborn brew whose accidental discovery started our story in Its originality also lies in its singular taste notes of biscuity malt and vanilla swirling within creamy mellow character pioneering beer its flavour finds favour with brewing juries blind tasting panels and barflies alike

Brooklyn completely changed the recipe in It now Scottish style ale Brewmaster Garrett Oliver explained to us that There are no spices at all Good British floor malts and hops along with our yeast strain account for all the flavors It has Scottish style cooler fermentation which pushes malt to the forefront rather than fruitiness It was brewed with Scottish Floor malted Maris Otter English crystal malts Belgian Aromatic malt American roasted malts American oats and hopped with Willamette

Kilt Lifter is our award winning flagship brew crafted in the tradition and honor of the great strong ales of Scotland Take one sip and you ll swear it had been brewed by men in kilts and maybe it was It a full bodied ale with pronounced flavors of caramel and roasted barley Notice its amber color malty sweetness and hint of smokiness with clean dry finish That a true Scottish style ale
Erie Brewing Company flagship beer features deep malt flavor caramel sweetness lingering in soft hop flavor Dark Amber

A Vermont classic returns in Built to take the bite from cold winter night Hibernator features rich malt base highlighted by warming notes of caramel and toffee Don sleep on this rich robust winter brew Last year we awoke the bears with limited run of cans offered at our brewery in Bridgewater Corners In we re culminating year of throwing it back to our roots by sending Hibernator out for full run of distribution in pks and pks of ounce bottles and on draught Keep your eyes out for it as the weather cools down IBU
Wee Mac Scottish style Ale is an enticing and malty brown ale with caramel cocoa and hazelnut character balanced with toffee undertones IBU

We have taken traditional Scottish style ale with its rich malt characteristic reminiscent of dark fruits and deepened its flavor with the addition of cherry wood smoked malt This beer features full body alongside drinkability rare commodity We enjoy this seasonal throughout the long snowy winters of Central Wisconsin You should too

Laughing Lab is our most popular brew among beer drinkers and beer judges alike with nine medals to its name since at the Great American Beer Festival alone The Lab has complex maltiness that comes from careful blend of specialty malts Its nutty roasted flavor is mildly sweet but not too rich Smooth and luscious

Red MacGregor is mighty beer indeed it has wonderfully complex aroma of fruity hop zest and spiciness with rich malts Initial toasted and caramel malt then mouth watering citrus hop fruits giving way to clean dry refreshing robust hop bitterness One of the first beers in the UK that expressively used the citrusy American hop Cascade and as result became forerunner to Britain new wave of craft beers and was also the first Scottish beer to win the BIIA World Cask Beer Gold Medal
Brewed in the tradition of Scotland malty sweet beers Sweet and smooth with wee hint of smoked character Brewed with American English German grown barley and American hops IBU

The conditions have to be just right for the formation of Thundersnow Ginger nutmeg vanilla hints of cinnamon and bready malt sweetness are the secret When you find this rare occurrence savor it as long as you can

Stone Throw is dark complex and smooth It is very approachable for those new to craft beer satisfy serious veterans The aroma hints of toasted breadcrumbs caramel and dried fruits The flavor is dominated by caramel toffee toasty malt hints of cocoa honey sweetness IBU

Scotland rugged soils are not conducive to the cultivation of hops that grow readily in England so during times of political strife Scotland southern neighbor would deprive Scottish brewers of their hops The resourceful Scot turned to his native heather as flavoring for his ales Heather grows wild in the rockbound highlands and when added to the beer yields silky aromatic result Our Scottish Ale is brewed with large amount of both malted barley and heather producing rich bodied ale with sweet finish true to the style Formerly known as MacFoochie
degrees PlatoAlcohol by volumeBitterness IBUColor Copper

The Maxwells have made the art of brewing family tradition for centuries This Scot comes alive as five different varieties of malt create deep surprisingly smooth finish Intrigued Go ahead and lift its kilt

It takes brave beer to stand up to Maine winter Gritty McDuff Scottish Ale is returns every January to help you weather the season Scottish Style Ale is our interpretation of the robust brews native to Scotland Generous quantities of Pale malt along with Munich and Caramalts give this ale deep and complex profile Scottish Style Ale is just shade darker than our Bitter with rich slightly sweet first impression on the palate that rounds out to satisfying maltiness and medium dry hop finish At ABV it hearty but not overwhelming Sure to please the Braveheart in all of us IBU

Our traditional Shilling Scottish style ale Chocolate and roasted barley malts contribute to this dark colored brew rounded out by notes of sweet caramel and mellow roast Robust yet drinkable this beer can be enjoyed in the cold months of winter or the dog days of summer IBU

So German Scott and an Iowan walk into bar and an entirely unique beer was born Traditional German yeast hops and techniques paired with the smoky flavor from scottish malts that somehow evokes quiet subtle quality that is uniquely Iowa

Java Mac is the coffee infused version of our Wee Mac Scottish Style Ale Locally roasted coffee from Bee Roasters harmonizes with the base beer hazelnut character and toffee undertones to create vibrant symphony of rich coffee flavor Java Mac was the winner of the Gold Medal in the Coffee Beer category at the Great American Beer Festival

This beer created in honor of Henry Chinaski was collaboration between Three Floyds and Jonathan Cutler of Piece Brewery Its delicate spicy smoked character is derived from portion of smoked and rye malts Formerly known as Ham On Rye

Grodziskie or Grätzer is Sour Smoked Wheat Ale that was brewed in the s in East Prussia and dates back to as early as the th century It was named after the Polish town of Grodzisk Wielkopolski or Grätz in German Our historic version is brewed according to the German Purity Law with air dried barley beech smoked wheat malt and hopped with Perle Saaz sour mash is created using the old and forgotten technique called Digerieren Finally three month aging maturation process creates complex sour smoky heavily hoppy wheat ale
This traditional rauchbier delicate balance of beechwood smokiness and toasty malts make it the perfect beer for sitting around fire pit with friends or warming up on chilly night
Smoked Stout combination of English peat smoked malts and another smoked malt from Bamberg Germany
LA Boucanèe is our acknowledgment of the importance of the wild cherry tree to south Louisiana Using cherry wood smoked wheat we craft surprisingly delicious and unique ale

This lager has the most complex grain bill of any beer that we brew In addition we roast grains in our ovens and add our own proprietary apple smoked grain for even more complexity The final product is smooth easy drinking lightly smoked delicious brew This dark smooth smoky lager has the most complex grain bill of any beer that we brew Three different smoked grains along with our own hand roasted grains add to the delicious chocolatey malty profile IBU OG FG PThis beer celebrates our region heritage of the railroad and the many volunteers that keep it rolling Step back in time and enjoy the rails with us All aboard Arnie an Ohio born Irish Wolfhound loves to get out and run with the big iron dogs
Premiant hop Saaz as late hop

Inspired by the German Rauchbier smoked beers from the Bamberg region Charbonnière is dark amber beer with distinctly smokey aroma obtained by the use of wood smoked malt during the brewing process It is sustained by slightly sweet malt backbone permitting the smoked malt to express itself freely with every sip

Butter Tavern was fixture of Concord NH in the eighteenth century Inspired by their loggerhead ale we ve created Smoked Imperial Brown Ale Hearty malts with nuanced smokiness and smooth finish create our interpretation of this historic ale We hope you enjoy this slice of New Hampshire history

Grodziskie resurrects the last indigenous Polish beer style to go extinct in the twentieth century Originally borne out of necessity in the th century CE to substantiate one diet and offset lack of potable water for sustenance Production ceased in Grodzisk in It is brewed using only oak smoked wheat malt and assertively hopped like pilsner Even with low ABV the wheat malt delivers full bodied beer The original Polish ale yeast strain ferments cold alongside our lager yeast throughout lagering Please enjoy this truly rare beer

A German Polish style brewed with oak smoked wheat fermented with our farmhouse yeast culture to provide subtle and delicate smoke complemented by the earthy and piney dry hopping with German Tettnang
Hopped with Fuggles and Amarillo Plato
Hickory Smoked Brown Porter brewed to be paired with North Carolina Barbecue

We brew this beer with applewood smoked wheat to drink during brew days Small so we can drink all day but alluring enough to hold our attention The only problem is no one makes applewood smoked wheat malt so we have to smoke it ourselves which lengthens our brew day so we need more beer It a vicious cycle of spicy hops punctuating sweet ephemeral applewood smoke And if you don want to drink it fine We ll drink it all ourselves
Smoked Stout
The Jackie s take on breakfast beer Hogwash was designed to taste like breakfast sausage German smoked malt local maple syrup and lavender was used to evoke the thought of breakfast sausage

The Applewood Gold is beer true to its name in both hue and excellence Taste and smell are powerful tools for nostalgia and mood setting where certain flavors and aromas can bear the sensor to faraway memories or bring them closer to home We crafted this beer with sunshine in our minds making its body light and vibrant enough to enjoy throughout the night and well balanced to pair with wide variety of foods from smoked salmon to grilled sweet Midwest corn
The flavorful smoky undertones of our smoked ale are enhanced by the chocolate black and smoked malt IBU

Gotlandsdricka which is Swedish variation of Sahti When vikings weren drinking mead and pillaging they would drink this high gravity smoked rye beer to kill time Better that they were killing time than villagers Our malt for gotlandsdricka is smoked over pear wood and then we add bunch of honey to give it an extra kick in the skull

Gacy Manson Dahmer Inspiration for our smoked porter aged on Serano peppers The peppers at touch of fire the smoke malt touch of brimstone Were they victims of their environment Or did the devil make them Roasty maltiness is followed by smoky elements and back of the throat full bodied IBU

In Festina Peche since the natural peach sugars are eaten by the yeast the fruit complexity is woven into both the aroma and the taste of the beer so there is no need to doctor it with woodruff or raspberry syrup Just open and enjoy IBU
Napoleon hailed this tart beer style the Champagne of the North lively and elegant masterpiece this Berliner Weiss is kaleidoscope of fresh flavor

Already in the s the Berliner Weisse Style Beer was mentioned in documents by the French reformers Huguenots as they crossed Berlin on their way to Flanders In the Emperor Napoleon and his troops celebrated their Prussian victory with it This Berliner Weisse Style Beer is brewed with traditional mash hoping sic and without wort boiling This along with traditional strain of lactic acid bacteria provide fruity and dry but palateful character character that Napoleon and his troops characterized as lively and elegant Historic Signature Series Forgotten styles brewed according to their historic recipes by Dr Fritz Briem of the Doemens Institute

OMG It JUSTIN BLABAER If you have Blabaer Fever then this is the only cure We stuffed so many blueberries into this beer it going to make you shout Oh Baby This is dedicated to AVSB F YFFL EW MW RWM BE SS RC

Thirty miles north of Barrelworks lies the fertile Santa Maria Valley Its warm days and cool marine layer fed evenings allow for cornucopia of fruits and vegetables to be grown in its rich soil One of Santa Maria crown jewels is locally grown raspberries We jumped at the opportunity to ferment fresh local raspberries with one of our Barrelworks creations Behold Bretta Rosé low alcohol Berliner Weisse style ale acidified and matured in French oak puncheons for months is the foundation for this gem Add lbs of fresh raspberries allow secondary wild fermentation for more months and voila we have crisp effervescent concoction bursting with raspberry perfume and flavor rosé color bracing acidity and clean and refreshing finish

Ever Weisse is mixed fermentation sour ale aged with kiwis strawberries and hibiscus With fresh bright notes of kiwi strawberry and hibiscus it hard to imagine yourself anywhere else but in the sunshine while sipping on Ever Weisse
A Munster style Berliner Weiss Tart refreshing and perfect for summer

One of the world classic sour beer styles Tartare is Bear Republic interpretation of Berliner Weisse the tart low alcohol beer style dubbed as The Champagne of the North Bronze medal at the Festival of Wood and Barrel Aged Beer in the Wild Beer Acidic Category Winner at Good Food Awards Adventurous Barreled Big Bawdy Belgian Beer Category
A refreshing gently tart German style wheat beer Our take on the classic Berliner has blend of citric and fruit notes with nods to cider and sauvignon blanc

Nomads constantly moving round and round sometimes settle if just for bit Perhaps the muse moves one to brew sharp and clean session beer one inspired by the Berliner weisse of old and the nomad rests Enjoy this beer here there perhaps north of Madison Square Park in lovely New York City Wherever you are this beer was made nice simply for you
Our approach was to brew this beer with Lactobacilius for refreshing and authentic interpretation of classic summer refresher
