Troublesome meaner cousin will flail your tongue as hard as he can but being such little guy you ll probably just pucker bit Spawned through an overnight kettle souring with our house lactobacillus culture the wort emerges furious at what we did to it Then just because we pitch saison yeast and allow it to free rise to it further distain It comes out angrier than uh angrier than well something really angry But at ABV there no reason for you to be too afraid IBU ish
Berliner Weisse brewed with pounds of Missouri and southern Illinois peaches
Imperial Berliner with Mango Guava and passion fruit

Huguenots may have originated the style as they traveled through France to Flanders having first mentioned it in the s Later in Napoleon and his troops identified Berliner Weisse as the Champagne of the North He requested the beer be served with syrup to cut its extreme level of acidity Our interpretation is slightly softer more mellow version of the Berliner Weisse style with beautiful balance of tartness fruitness and sweetness

Imagine yourself in Berlin Tiergarten enjoying this refreshing Berliner Weisse inspired beer on warm summer day Bretta Weisse honors the traditional beverage of the great Prussian capital Berlin Fredrick the Great was trained to brew it and Napoleon troops called it The champagne of the North Firm estery notes of stone and tropical fruit lead to Funky yeasty citrus aromas Soft cereal and Oak flavors are enveloped by firm acidity and tartness The finish is dry and crisp thoroughly enjoyable beverage At ABV one could imagine enjoying several Bretta Weisse in the Tiergarten or anywhere else This Berliner Weisse inspired Wheat beer was aged in gal French Oak horizontal foeders for months

Incorrigible celebrates the beauty of mischief Wild yeasts and bacteria run free in our sour aging cellar the House of Funk creating vibrant sour and acidic character in this delicate yet complex wheat beer The refreshingly tart session beer will tease your palate with subtle layered nuance

German inspired sour wheat beer The obvious and domineering acidity of this beer is obtained by letting the unboiled wort go sour for several days The Solstice Été is made complete by the addition during the fermentation process of phenomenal quantity of whole fruit raspberries or mangos or cherries which compensate for the sourness of the beer The result is very refreshing beer where both acidity and fruity flavours dominate wholeheartedly

Our Sour Wench Blackberry Ale is fruity Berliner Weisse style beer bursting with Oregon blackberry flavor and aroma The fruit addition adds beautiful violet hue and the taste has an approachable soft tartness from kettle souring This artful gypsy will surely lure you into the world of sour beers IBU

Lynnbrook named after our founder family farm is wild Berliner Style Weisse with raspberries added resulting in very refreshing beer presenting with fuchsia color and an aroma reminiscent of picking tart red raspberries growing next to an old abandoned barn with the raspberry lemony aroma giving way to hints of brie and barnyard funkiness The flavor is absent of any hops or bitterness and instead has initial impressions of subtle lemon and yogurt supported by tart fresh raspberries and underlying lactic sourness The beer dry finish helps cut through some sweetness from the fruit
Our version of barrel fermented and barrel aged Berliner Weisse but fermented with ambient yeast and bacteria Tart with citrus and fruit notes subtle grain character and hint of funk

This sessionable sour is truly product of creativity ingenuity and luck In the summer of we took test batch of our sessional sour summer ale Provincial that didn quite hit gravity and decided to have some fun with it We added heavy dose of raspberries The end result was so delicious we decided to recreate it This delightfully tart fruit beer is refreshing with citrusy raspberry aroma which transitions to subtlety sweet and tart finish Notes of lemon zest and tart raspberries
Berliner Weisse style sour ale brewed with lemongrass and ginger
Berliner weisse style beer aged on wild Maine blueberries and cinnamon sticks

A wave of tropical fruit and spice brighten this lively tart wheat ale taking the German Berliner Weisse tradition on an island run Hopfentea steeped on house made tea blend of mango papaya hibiscus lemongrass pairs well with light appetizers salads and high humidity

Cayuga Cruiser is our slightly tart and exceptionally refreshing Berliner Weisse style ale Mildly hazy in appearance and light in body this beer delivers the perfect combination of elements resulting in supreme and satisfying drinkability Whether you re on boat or in your backyard this beer is the quintessential summer refresher

MONKEY CHASED THE WEASELSour AleABV IBU Sour SRM Ojo de GalloThe backyard of our brewery has mulberry tree that drops its fruit in the first days of summer We moved into our building during early summer tracking bright purple path through our new home with every laden step It was then we decided if mulberry was going to get that deep into the brewery it probably should get into beer as well Stealing process from Berliners we let the lactics in wheated mash sour up to green apple lemon level accentuating the bright side of the mulberry profile Meant for quaffing when there is no reason to avoid direct sunlight on balmy summer days drink Monkey Chased The Weasel because there is more sun than moon at the top https www youtube com watch nDNnAlCe list UUnNILcyxWbvjLRKg
sour fermented wheat ale inspired by German Berliner weisse and conditioned on passionfruit bronze medal winner at the Great American Beer Festival

The Passion Fruit Prussia is our non traditional look at the classic Berliner Weisse style Brewed with generous amount of passion fruit this beer pours golden in color with nice tart finish perfect compliment to the summer heat
Sour Base with Cucumber Finish

In Berliner Weisse we think we ve found the perfect style for our summer Cellar Reserve This north German wheat beer is traditionally brewed and released very fresh It has light body from the wheat and refreshingly tart acidity that make it perfect summer thirst quencher Its lemony tartness is provided by secondary fermentation with lactobacillus the same microorganism that responsible for yogurt tang That tartness increases and improves with age so the people of Berlin are known to buy extra bottles to bury in their gardens for two years or more As usual with our Cellar Reserves we ve taken traditional style and added our own twist In this case we ve tripled the strength over the traditional beer which should only increase its aging potential For the primary fermentation we used traditional Bavarian hefeweizen yeast that produces soft notes of banana and clove We followed that with lactobacillus and six months in conditioning to create complex fruity acidity that compliments the soft sweet malt tones and unique ale that is both fulfilling and refreshing IBU
This tart and whimsical blueberry treat will remind you of your family freshly baked blueberry muffins
Berliner Weisse style sour ale aged on Cape Cod cranberries and Florida oranges
Michigan blueberries blackberries fuel second flavorful fermentation of this beer after its residence of several months in our House of Funk sour cellar
Sour wheat ale fermented with Jackie s house lactobacillus and brettanomyces cultures Produced via unique Solera method ensuring consistency and variation over time This is not kettle sour
At Burley Oak we love our sour beers We also love all the aromas you get from our IPA By dry hopping this lacto happy beer we ve created an extreme sensory experience IBU

The hallmark of our lager experimentation Bright vibrant lush sour made for pint glasses and icy coolers We sour mash wheat malt and lager for an extended period with our house strain finally adding whole hibiscus flowers and touch of black current creating vibrant rose hue and incredibly aroma Notes of dark fruit floral tannin bright lemon and touch of sweet wheat IBU

Extremely pale yellow in color with slight haze and large creamy snow white foam head This beer is rather light on the palate and very dry lively carbonation accentuates the refreshingly tart acidity Expect an interesting mix of fruity flavors reminiscent of ripe lemons and apple juice with touch of spice and subtle brett character

Our Blueberry Berliner Weisse is fermented with great blueberry puree This New England approach brings refreshing blueberry flavor and aroma to German classic We feel our approach creates an authentic interpretation of the traditional mit syrup or with syrup method of serving this classic summer refresher We hope you enjoy this unique year round beer

This German wheat beer owes its lemony tartness to the addition of lactobacillus to the brew kettle The resulting acidity balances the sweetness of malted wheat resulting in tart refreshing spritzy tipple that many faithful wine lover has fallen for Legend has it Napoleon troops during their wars in Prussia dubbed it the Champagne of the North Santé and Prost Malt White Wheat Pilsen Oats Flaked BarleyHops Columbus AmarilloYeast Kettle soured Lactobacillus
Five thousand pounds of raspberries were added to barrels Star of the North resulting in barrel batch which was then fermented for an additional four months
Flemish Sour Brown Ale fermented in stainless then transferred to barrels for years of aging then blended to taste
Brewed for Monk Café in Philadelphia but also available for retail purchase elsewhere Oud Bruin in style traditional blend of young and old beers

Flanders style sour brown brewed with dark candi sugar and Oregon Montmorency cherries aged in Pinot Noir barrels IBUFirst release ABV August Second release ABV November bbl Third release ABV October Fourth release ABV December
Belgian style wild ale aged in French oak Cabernet Sauvignon barrels with the addition of Michigan cherries and heavily inoculated with Brettanomyces

month spontaneous foeder beer Brown AleLabel also displays VanderGhinste Oud Bruin Originally called Ouden Tripel this ancient West Flanders Brown beer has found new élan as regional specialty under its current name VanderGhinste Rood Bruin The main ingredients of our Vanderghinste Rood Bruin are malted barley wheat hops water and caramelized malts These are used to brew top fermented beer Blending this beer with lambic beer aged in oak for months results in this specific West Flanders Brown beer Its typical flavour is characterized by well balanced hardly noticeable sourness This first flavour impression is soon followed by second pleasant discovery slight bitterness followed by hint of sweetness
A combination of Oud Bruin and Kriek blended and aged to create well balanced Flemish Brown Ale

Petrus Aged Red is blend of Petrus Aged Pale pure foeder beer that has been aged for years in oak foeders and double brown with sour cherries For the fruit beer lover but with an ideal sweet sour balance

Our Brewmaster Dan launched his Wild Fruit Cave this winter brewing Oud Bruin Flander style ale that is immensely complex both tart and sweet Soft toffee notes lead with blend of Wisconsin British and German malts that first rested in the Coolship before spontaneously fermenting on oak in the cave Hallertau hops matured in the horse barn elegantly support sparkling fruit notes that frolic before punctuated oak finish naturally fermented in oak vessels this is beer that can be enjoyed now or the patient few can lay in their personal cellar to age

Formerly known as Liefmans Kriek and Cuvée Brut This classy beer represents the perfect marriage between the fresh accents and slightly acidic flavour of the black cherries Liefmans Kriek Brut is mixed fermentation beer with every hectolitre containing up to kilos of fruit Liefmans Kriek Brut is perfect blend of Oud Bruin and Goudenband from different vintages and can consist of between and different batches of beers The beer is matured for months bringing out the very best of its intense flavour Liefmans Kriek Brut is deep reddish brown colour with pale head and wood and almond notes On the palette you can clearly taste the slightly sweet yet at the same time gently bitter fruit flavours This is beer that just oozes class

Red wine grapes mixed with sour brown ale to create this truly unique sensory experience Aged in oak barrels with Brettanomyces to help marry the flavors and impart distinct sour character found nowhere else Rich vinous tart and tangy are the flavors of this classic American Sour Ale
This is recreation of Norwegian style naturally soured ale aged in oak wine barrels for months for the authentic sour flavour The first wild yeast fermented beer brewed in Norway for over years IBU

Gypsy Tart is Flanders style brown ale with California touch beer that can trace it origins to Great Britain but more famously perfected in western Belgium has been updated through our own modern techniques delivering the sweet body and mildly tart finish that has won over numerous generations of beer drinkers in Europe Our rendition of this wonderful beer style is perfect for both sour beer amateurs and advocates alike

This is Flanders Sour Brown Ale which has the characteristics of sherry with sweet fruity aroma It is dark reddish brown in color and is high in acidity sweetness and sourness This is complex beer that should be imbibed with notice to it high alcohol content

Silly Sour is unique brew that blends of traditional dark Saison with of soured ale The delicate malt notes from the Saison manage to break through the striking green apple sourness upfront and than give way to finishing jolt of lactic sourness At an approachable Alc by Vol this chestnut colored brew adds new page in the history of Saison brewing
Brewed and bottled on the Deca Brewery in Woesten Vleteren Oud Vlaams Bruin Blend Old NewEBC IBU OG FG ABV Hops Bramling Cross Hallertau MF

James and Julie is our take on Flemish sour brown and offers an aroma of raisins figs cherries and caramelized sugar Mahogany in color this medium bodied ale finishes with clean acidity and hint of spice We brew this sour brown ale with Pilsner Special Maize and Chocolate Malt and ferment it with our house yeast strain It then ages for two years on stainless steel with our own blend of Lactobacillus and Pediococcus cultures

Balaton is our Wild Missouri Brown Ale that was fermented in and aged in local Chambourcin Barrels with Missouri microflora for over year with Michigan Balaton Cherries We wanted Balaton to be soft yet complex so it is only abv with higher level of Brett influence and more impactful oak presence to balance out the signature Side Project acidity and the tart cinnamon notes of the cherries

This old brown is brewer flagship and typical beer style for the region in which it is produced blend of old brown beer already maturated for months in oak barrels and some young brown beer Each vessel is sampled separately and blended to taste so as to obtain the perfect combination Each year the taste slightly different though the main characteristics remain always the same the aroma is dominated by green apple red fruits and oak The taste is refreshingly acidic and very thirst quenching
Oak amber ale Fermented and maturated only in oak vats The name Madamin is piedmontese word meaning young lady Available in ml or ml bottles

A sour brown ale brewed in the Flemish tradition that rivals even the best Oud Bruins coming out of Belgium Elegant and rustic and full of complex flavors berries spice and hint of nuttiness this is great beer to share with friends on special occasion Born of the fortuitous encounter between strong stout and fermented apricots from the Valais which never reached the distillers Our Oud Bruin Flemish for Old Brown is rather unorthodox take on the style It nevertheless boasts the typical sweet and sour balance between solid malty toffee like chocolaty roasted and fruity backbone Into this the fermented apricots merge seamlessly with their lactic sourness leathery and horse blanket notes from wild yeasts and discrete touch of apricot deep down It finally evolves harmoniously into slightly bitter finish Altogether pretty unique yet very drinkable beer
Flanders style brown aged in wine barrels with tart cherries
Flemish inspired Brown Ale aged in French oak barrels
Almost unhopped brown ale the base beer for Morpheus Wild and Kerasus undressed for the fans of the true oud bruin style

Brewed to the Oud Bruin style with orange and lemon zest then aged in Makers Mark barrels where the brewers added classic holiday fruits such as cranberries figs dates and raisins Paying homage to the fruitcakes granny used to make with the only difference being you won want to re gift this one

Our Oud Bruin is firmly in the East Flanders tradition We used American row barley and German melanoidin malt for red color as well as maize to lighten the body The wort was simmered in the kettle for hours and then hopped lightly with English Kent Goldings for balance We fermented with Flemish blend of yeast and bacteria cultures including lactobacillus pediococcus and brettanomyces It took six months at cellar temperature for the culture to achieve the style characteristic quenching sourness Finally we bottle conditioned the beer according to the methode champenoise so it too can be laid down to be brought out when it can be truly enjoyed

Brasserie de Silly has taken their signature Silly Sour and taken it to whole new level Completely unblended Sour ale this beer lacks the saison normally blended into Silly Sour The result is deep garnet colored beer with aromas of tart cherries and raspberries The intial taste is puckeringly sour with soft sweet undertone and thick lactic acid heavy mouthfeel While the finish is not cloying it lingers more than its original version

A Flanders style brown ale We took Chomo lung ma our organic honey nut brown and aged it in second generation Woodford Reserve barrel subtle bourbon flavor notes of American oak for four months with lbs of tart cherries and specially blended culture of wild yeast and beer souring bacteria Chunga Old Bruin exhibits and aroma of sweet cherries and faint chocolate roasted malt complemented by faint oak bouquet The flavor has pronounced sour character with the caramel chocolate and roasted malt finish

Brunneis is our blended Oud Bruin Blend was matured in different barrels that used to hold whiskies as well as zinfandel fortified wines It is deep brown in color with touch of carbonation Reminiscent of dark fruits raisins it has balance between acidity maltiness that are enhanced by slight smokiness on the nose Blend
Belgian style Flanders Oud Bruin aged for over years in old oak Heaven Hill bourbon barrel Spontaneous second fermentation and aging with Lacto Pedio and Brett

Darken is take on an old ale or Flanders Brown Ale We added spices to the mix to create pleasurable and more heavily nuanced flavor profile Aged for long time periods always in oak creates harmonious brown sour ale

This traditional Flemish style sour was produced from blend of beers aged for range of up to two years in variety of oak barrels Long and slow fermentation with blend of Brettanomyces Lactobacillus and other sour cultures contribute to the characteristically tart flavor Notes of black cherry raisin and hint of dark chocolate
This Belgian inspired brown ale is aged in oak barrels with flora of acidifying bacterias then blended with fresh beer

In beer drinking adventure throughout Belgium inspired us to create Flanders Style Oud Bruin The quest to share the beauty and deliciousness of Flemish brown sours started off by filling our oak barrels with ale in July of After days of barrel aging with lactobacillius pedioccacus and wild yeast we then kept with tradition by blending aged sour beer with the malty sweetness of younger beer is re fermented in the bottle with champagne yeast so please pour slowly and enjoy
Collaboration with Oxbow Brewery
oak aged sour ale brewed with Pinot Noir grapes
A foudre and barrel aged sour brown ale that is blended from up to year old vintages Dark fruit notes of plum and red currant with malty caramel undertones and pleasantly sour finish

Cory endeavor into the realm of Flanders style sour ale Extremely rare inoculated with multiple souring organisms and laid down in French oak barrels for over one year Le Serpent is an example of Belgian sour brown at it finest On draft in the pub for short time and also hand bottled and bottle conditioned There is very limited quantity of ml bottles available for take away Act quickly to experience this exotic beer style
Belgian top fermented reddish brown ale blend of and months old beers following the careful maturation in oak casks
Flanders Red Ale blend of young beer and aged beer matured for years in oak foeders The original sour ale

Cuvée des Jacobins Rouge is Flemish Sour Ale red in color with beguiling balance of malty sweetness and acidic sharpness It is made from spontaneously fermented and barrel aged beer of at least months in age The beer is cooled overnight in large shallow metal vessel called coolship and then fermented and aged in large oak foudres which are made in France and assembled on site at Bockor

Oude Tart is Flemish Style Red Ale aged in red wine barrels for months It pleasantly sour with hints of leather dark fruit and toasty oak While this is one of the more classic beer styles that we make it not style that you can find too often in the United States Originating in style from the Flanders region of Belgium near the French border this dark sour ale has roots deep in brewing history and predates most of the ales that have become popular in contemporary culture We re doing our best to keep the tradition alive by brewing and aging this beer here on the west coast

Perhaps no country embraces the use of fruit in beers more so than Belgium Numerous traditional as well as regional specialty ales are infused with every sort of fruit imaginable In this way the flavor of the fruit becomes especially prominent Red Poppy Ale is veritable celebration of Sour Cherries in an explosion of aromas and tastes Brewed from brown ale base and aged in our oak barrels for over months this beer is not for the faint of heart The Golden Poppy is the state flower of California and the Red Poppy is found in Flanders Fields where our inspiration for this beer comes from

An artisan amber ale brewed in the Flanders tradition Deep amber with earthy caramel spice and sour fruit notes developed through natural barrel aging Unfiltered unpasteurized and blended from barrels ranging in age from two to ten months
ABV varies ABV

Flanders Red Ale two year ale matured in oak foeders that is aged for an additional six months with cherries raspberries and cranberries Vinous and very complex with notes of wood and caramel The brewer allow the beer to macerate with fresh cherries raspberries and cranberries After this maceration in oak the beer re ferments in the bottle The result is RODENBACH Caractère Rouge an exceptional RODENBACH with fruit maceration and alcohol volume The brew is more than unique and extremely exclusive as only cl bottles were produced first batch Geunes serves this wilful beer as part of his other unique range of beer varieties in his restaurant Zilte at the Antwerp MAS museum

Oude Tart is Flemish Style Red Ale aged in red wine barrels for up to months This version has had cherries added for the final stages of barrel aging It pleasantly sour with hints of leather tangy dark fruit plump cherries and toasty oak While the base beer is one of the more classic styles that we make it not style that you can find too often in the United States Originating in style from the Flanders region of Belgium near the French border this dark sour ale has roots deep in brewing history and predates most of the ales that have become popular in contemporary culture We re doing our best to keep the tradition alive by brewing and aging this beer here on the West Coast

This NW style sour red ale is blend of red ales aged in oak barrels for up to eight months then aged on fresh Bing and sour pie cherries for an additional eight months Aromas of rich dark cherries oak and slight hints of cinnamon are noticed up front Dark tart cherries and light spice notes dance on the palate and lead to rich dark tart sparkling finish of dark cherries and oak Note Kriek ABVKriek ABVKriek ABVKriek ABVKriek ABVKriek ABVKriek ABVKriek ABVPlease note which version is being reviewed if known
Flanders Red Ale blend of young and two year old ale matured in oak foeders that is macerated with sour cherries
Red ale aged in oak barrels with wild yeast and souring bacteria Unfiltered unpasteurized and bottle conditioned This beer is tribute to our good friend Russ Beattie Thanks Russ Thuss

Flanders Red is an acidic sour ale with an initial impression of tart cherries and sour candy that dissipates into complex palate displaying both sharp lactic sourness with backbone of caramel and biscuit malt profiles and minimal hop character The dry wine like finish accentuates the complex malt profile and bright fruit notes showcased in this brilliant red colored hybrid of modern Flanders and German style sour
Also known as Panil Barriquée RiservaThis is the version imported to the US

The Vichtenaar is beer that is brewed on the basis of deeply burned malt spicy and fruity hops yeast and soft water pumped from well with depth of which is guarantee of the quality and the purity of the water After the main fermentation and the second lagering the Vichtenaar undergoes third fermentation in oak casks for several months The oak casks are large vats with capacity ranging between and liters The Vichtenaar is traditional and typical beer for West Flanders in the Northwest of Belgium The taste of the Vichtenaar can be described as slightly acidic and complex and this through the long fermentation in oak casks The fresh taste of the Vichtenaar makes it particularly thirst quenching beer especially during the summer months The Vichtenaar is also one of the last old Flemish red brown beers which are matured in oak casks and is especially appreciated for its authenticity by the beer connoisseur In Brewery Verhaeghe obtained for its beer Vichtenaar the first prize in the international contest for beers in Ghent

Echt Kriekenbier real cherry beer is as the name suggests cherry beer that is manufactured with only the real fruit of cherries instead of with flavor enhancers or extracts of cherries The fruit is sourced from the region around Sint Truiden in Limburg Belgium Unlike the most famous fruit beers the basic beer of the real cherry beer is not Lambic but West Flemish red brown ale aged in oak wood About mid July at the picking the Northern cherries are brought in at the brewery and laid in on the base beer Because the taste of the cherry fruit varies from year to year and this according to the number of hours of sunshine or rain the kriekenbier at its final composition is blended with cherry beer from the year before and two year old cherry beer This with the intention of becoming more constant taste of the real cherry beer over the years
A stronger version of Flanders Red Ale aged in previously beer stored bourbon barrels for some light oak bourbon character Previously known as Malefactor and Gilgamesh
A Flanders style Red Ale oak aged with pounds of local cherries per barrel
Flanders Style Red Ale that was fermented in Missouri oak Chambourcin barrels and then aged on Missouri grown blueberries

Michael is Flanders Red made in memory of Michael Jackson The Beer was Brewed in January of and aged in American oak and Sherry barrels since then It is just over alcohol made with Organic Pilsner Vienna and Munich malts and fermented with variety of yeast and bacteria Released November Fall

Our organic red ale is brewed in traditional West Flanders style combination of light crystal and dark barley malt wheat and oats are brewed with local whole cone hops and variety of select yeast and lactic bacteria We age our red ale in oak barrels for period of time to develop complex richness soft tannins and fruity tart character The aged beer is then blended with young beer to create the desired balance of malt sweetness with dry finish

THE RED SOUR AMBER ALEAged in large oak casks then bottle fermented La Roja is Franco Belgian style ale crafted on the Flander tradition of aged and blended beers La Roja is rich and lush with undertones of caramel fruit and spice Truly an ale of grace and distinction Cheers and Mahalo plenty IBU TIME IN OAK Months MonthsHOPS Strisselspalt TettnangGRAINS Pilsner Malt Pale Malt Munich Wheat Malt Crystal Black MaltADDITIONAL INGREDIENTS Dextrose

La Roja du Kriek Sour Amber Ale with Michigan Cherry Juice This is what happens when gallons of La Roja meets gallons of Michigan tart cherry juice aged in oak barrels and bottle conditioned perfect blend of sour and tart joie de vivre
Flemish style red brown fermented in wood
Traditional Flanders style red ale aged for years in red wine barrels

Flanders Drive is the result of intense Brewmaster contemplation Built on canvas of structured malts the sourness develops during extended aging in wood barrels lending to the beer depth and complexity Heady top notes of tart cherry and dark fruit mingle with rich subtle malt in the background for truly satisfying sour ale
This version is not exported to the US

The basic ingredient of our Jacobins Kriek is wort made of wheat and malted barley This wort is first boiled and then transported to the brewery open cooling vessel to cool down Afterwards it spontaneously ferments in big oak barrels giving the beer its refined flavour and aroma To obtain its true kriek or cherry flavour natural cherry juices are also added The fruitiness of the aroma clearly reveals itself in the mouth Our Jacobins Kriek has well balanced pleasant and slightly sweet flavour which is best enjoyed when drunk out of its own bowl shaped glass An excellent thirst quencher and perfect for drinking in an outdoor café

A Flanders style Scarlet sour ale rich malty raisiny character with sharp tartness defines this beer This beer uses two strains of yeasts lactic acid and Trappist Ale strain are used on the finish fermentation

I think that in the life of every brewer exists particular moment that makes him proud and satisfied with his work for me this time comes during the blend of La Luna Rossa Maybe because it is the beer that it takes more time before leaving the brewery or maybe for certain analogy with the trade of enologist it is always very emotional when myself and Luca solid presence at the brewery find ourselves between sour splashes and leftover pieces of fruit that remind me the visciole morello cherry my grandfather used to eat while playng cards It starts with an acidic base that has made at least years of mixed fermentations conducted mainly by lactic acetic bacteria and brettanomyces which have at least months macerated cherries and sour cherries blend with small part of chimera and some young beer the blend is put in numbered bottles indicating the year of the cuvée which refined further months before selling La Luna Rossa is like kriek on the basis flemish red has an extraordinary complexity associated with wonderful elegance for lovers of the genre is definitely one of those beers that you find it difficult to forget GiovanniIn the glass to the nose and in the mouth Born from the blend about different beers some of them aged in barrels until years with the addition morello and marasca cherries Intense amber colour with ruby reflections extraordinary aromatic complexity fruity aromas marasca and morello cherries in the first place accompanied by subtle ethereal notes and sublime acetic hints and lactic acid as well as shades of oxidized malts In the mouth it is tasty large persistent and ends with magnificent and uplifting acidity

Oude Tart is Flemish Style Red Ale aged in red wine barrels for up to months This version has had boysenberries added for the final stages of barrel aging In fact there are over two gallons of boysenberry purée per barrel The final compilation is pleasantly sour with hints of leather dark fruit tart boysenberries and toasty oak While the Flemish style red ale is one of the more classic beer styles that we make it not style that you can find too often in the United States Originating in style from the Flanders region of Belgium near the French border this dark sour ale has roots deep in brewing history and predates most of the ales that have become popular in contemporary culture We re doing our best to keep the tradition alive by brewing and aging this beer here on the west coast
Flanders Red Ale blend of young beer and aged beer matured for years in oak foeders with added juice of cherries and elderberries
A marriage of two reds we present our flanders red dark ruby ale fermented with wild yeasts and souring bacteria evolving for over year in freshly emptied merlot barrels

First an English Old Ale is brewed and aged in oak barrels Burgundy red wine and US Bourbon hardy wild yeast strain called Brettanomyces slowly matures the beer with the help of the yeasts bacteria and microbes harbored by the barrels These add complexity and acidity to the beer making every barrel an individual unique character Sold as Modus Vivendi in the USA

Duchesse Cherry is blend of and year old Duchesse de Bourgogne with local sour cherries added to the maturing beer The malt beverage is aged in oak casks and utilizing whole cherries from the Limburg region of Belgium as opposed to cherry syrup that is sometimes used in cherry beer production Duchesse Cherry truly lives up to its name

Traditional Duchesse de Bourgogne with Belgian cherries and chocolate essence added during the maturation process in oak casks foeders kg of whole Belgian cherries are used in the production of each liters of Chocolate Duchesse Cherry
This Flemish style soured mash medium bodied red ale is lactic tart and delicious It is traditionally blended with at least year old gueuze and fruits

Flanders Reds may be called the Burgundies of Belgium but we age our take on this complex slightly tart style in Oregon pinot noir barrels for more than months fresh batch will batch will present spicier notes while older versions pick up more oak and yield cherry flavors So we blended old and new figuring we re better off presenting this exotic mélange simultaneously

A Flemish Style Vermont Sour Red Ale fermented with brettanomyces yeast providing slight tartness with barnyard aromas and flavors This recipe was the result of the collaborative efforts of VPB brewers both past and present in honor of their mentor and Master Brewer Greg Noonan The name Toolah Leez comes from county Cork in Ireland where the Noonan clan originated ABV Hits the style
This is our interpretation of Gose pronounced Gose uh traditional German style sour wheat beer brewed with coriander and salt Once nearly extinct this very refreshing style is making comeback IBU

With bright golden color and tight creamy head the earthy wood undertones in our Gose develop into light mineral aroma with hint of lemon zest and tropical fruit Before boiling the wort is kettle soured with lactobacillus imparting an initial refreshing tartness that gives way to subtle fullness Flavors of guava and peach are followed by slight sea salt dryness and lemon sourness that is enhanced by coriander and post fermentation additions of salt The finish is dry effervescent and lemon tangy reminiscent of fresh sea breeze

Our Blood Orange Gose is tart refreshing wheat ale that is kettle soured with lactobacillus and brewed with sea salt and coriander However unlike traditional versions of the style ours features liberal additions of blood oranges during fermentation This imparts tangy citrus notes that complement the champagne like flavors creating complex and sessionable ale perfect for any occasion

A bold and bright step outside the norm the flavors of unique old world German brewing process excite your senses with the sharp and sweet burst of fresh cherries Effervescent and sublime this session ale has an enticing cherry fruit character European tradition and American ingenuity come together in the truest sense as you Taste Victory in Kirsch Gose Pours ruby to light red with white foam Aroma of fresh sour cherries with flavors of tartness intense rounded cherry character and refreshing salty character Crisp carbonation and light body are both combined into thirst quencher

SeaQuench Ale is our session sour quencher made with lime peel black lime and sea salt It a citrusy tart union of three German styles of beer blissfully brewed into one We begin by brewing straightforward Kolsch with lots of wheat and Munich Malt then we brew salty Gose with black limes coriander and our sea salt We follow it all up with citrusy tart Berlinerweiss made with lime juice and lime peel All three beers are then blended together in the fermentation tank to create this German hybrid

Most brewers spend lot of time and effort keeping lactobacillus out of their breweries it was the first thing we brought in it still has to stay in the corner though We blend together two different beers to make Troublesome The first is somewhat uninteresting wheat beer and the second is an overly acidic funky beer fermented solely with lactobacillus We blend the two beers together with coriander and salt at the tail end of fermentation to create mild lemony tartness and fuller sensation of mouthfeel And yes it hard to make IBU

This original Leipzig beer specialty lends us the name for our brewery Gose is regional beer specialty that was brought to Saxony Anhalt in the year Originally Gose comes from Goslar small town in Lower Saxony and the river Gose in this town This beer specialty has refreshing slightly sour taste and is ideal for quenching your thirst Gose is brewed with the additional ingredients lactic acid cilantro and salt Gose is top fermented beer with ABV and wort You can enjoy it in different variations

Our Leipzig Style Gose undergoes spontaneous fermentation similar to Belgian style Gueuze Lambic beers and exhibits complexity of acidic flavor and aroma contributed by wild yeast lactic fermentation Lemon lime and other citrus like qualities are present in aroma and on the palate which is balanced by the spicy character of added coriander and mineral mouthfeel from added sea salt IBUs

The Mad Scientists kept tweakin that Jammer till it rocked so hard Bygone brewers repping the Sixpoint star provided the concept and our friends at Jacobsen Salt hooked us up with the key ingredient It salty it sour and it slammin It Mad Science

A traditional German beer style that was all but extinct years ago An amazingly refreshing beer brewed with coriander and sea salt The tart dry finish combined with the hint of salt and citrus leaves your palate craving another sip

Born from our passion for experimentation our Briney Melon Gose boasts thirst quenching tartness that is perfectly balanced by subtle watermelon flavors and aromas Gentle additions of sea salt create refreshing harmony between the acidity and fruity sweetness leading to clean dry finish

Our Golden Gate Gose is inspired by the classic wheat beer hailing from Leipzig Germany Traditionally brewed with salt and coriander our tart California inspried version is brewed with San Francisco Bay sea salt lemon verbena from Eatwell Farm in Dixon and coriander grown and dried especially for us by Dirty Girl Produce in Santa Cruz California Fermented with our house saison yeast this delicate and tart beer is perfect summer refresher Pair with fresh seafood and sunshine

Subtly sour and little sweet this ale is refreshing take on nearly extinct German style gose Watermelon is the highlight of this lightly hopped treat and gives it hint of satisfying juiciness The soft mouthfeel and dry finish comes courtesy of the addition of sea salt traditional gose ingredient Green Zebra was initially released as our Artist Series beer in

Ritterguts Gose is the oldest existing most authentic Gose in the world We still brew this unique beer in the old fashioned original way using genuine Gose yeast coriander and salt Ritterguts Gose refreshing characteristics are developed through secondary lactic fermentation which produces round and harmonious acidity Its rare classic open fermentation and long cold maturation make it exceptionally well balanced the way real Gose was meant to be Enjoy taste of the finest Leipzig tradition
Gose brewed with salt and coriander and infused with the delicious flavors of key lime pie

Collaboration with Evil Twin BrewingOur first ever collaboration brewed with Jeppe from Evil Twin Two Evil twist on gose with ingredients sourced from Iceland including Icelandic moss rye herbs sea kelp skyr and birch smoked sea salt The result of this adventure is Two Evil Geyser Gose classic sour tart beer with hint of smoke light lemon color dry finish and thirst quenching appeal

We love cocktails Like really love them If you ask us few are more refreshing than the tart and tangy margarita and our latest barrel aged beer pays tribute to that perennial classic We took an imperial gose brewed with agave lime and sea salt and then aged it in tequila barrels for just the right amount of kick Consider it party in bottle Más Agave
A timeless traditional tart gose goes uh with its zesty and salty disposition is brightened by tangy citrus twist bier for every día
Dry hopped Gose style ale aged in oak barrels with coriander and citrus peel Batch best by Batch best by

Effortlessly cool popping up in cultish fashion and constantly on tasty mission This is Mission Gose our take on an old fashioned and slightly odd German beer style that is with good reason trending as the tastiest right now It tart salty low in alcohol and probably the most refreshing beer you ll ever have Perhaps enjoy this beer in restaurant with mission near you Wherever you are we made it stylishly good and exclusively well balanced just for you

Formerly Fruitlands Passion Fruit And GuavaFruitlands is tart fruity and frighteningly delicious The sour salty base beer lays down the funky refreshment while heavy dose of passion fruit and guava turns the whole thing into wall to wall tropical fruit fiesta It a marvelous mix of elements that collides with your mouth like fruit filled asteroid of flavor traveling at the supersonic speed of party
dry hopped gose spruce tips
Gose Ale Brewed with Orange and Coriander

A dash of salt touch of tart That what makes this unique German style wheat beer seasoned professional at serious summer thirst quenching With its glowing golden color peach citrus nose followed by prickly mouthfeel that leaves gentle tartness and dash of salt on the palate the Old Pro never fails to bring you back for another sip BITTERNESS IBU COLOR Straw pale GoldMALT Wheat Pils AcidulatedADJUNCTS Salt Coriander SeedYEAST Lactobacillus German Ale

Suburban Beverage is Gose style ale brewed with salt orange peel lemon peel and key lime juice The ideal drink after long summer day working in the yard picking the kids up from soccer practice or taking the dog for walk Tart and refreshing it will certainly make you feel alright Pairs well with Mexican food

Collaboration with Bayerischer Bahnhof Gasthaus GosebrauereiBased on recipe dating back at least six hundred years this is Freigeist quirky version of the nearly extinct traditional sour beer of Leipzig Geisterzug Ghost Train spruced gose is unusually complex funky and full bodied the perfect modern day medieval German ale

Introducing our latest bottled beer The Wind The Wind is our classic Gose dry hopped with Citra hops and grapefruit Some of you may have had this beer in the past as cask beer Well we liked it so much that we figured out how to bottle it

Schell Goosetown is our interpretation of traditional German style Gose The beer pours clear golden orange in color with thick white foam head It has bright lemon zest and coriander aroma with slight saltiness reminiscent of cool ocean breeze refreshingly light and citrusy tartness greets your palate backed by bready wheat malt character and touch of coriander spice Lighter bodied yet full flavored with lively carbonation that gives the beer crisp dry finish uniquely refreshing session beer perfectly suited for warm summer day from the August Schell Brewing Company IBU

Reminiscent of classic cocktail our GT Gose showcases botanical flavors and aromas of lemon peel juniper lemongrass and grains of paradise With juicy lemon lime tartness and slightly peppery finish we ve given the gose style unique spin that we re sure you ll enjoy

Aggressively dry hopped with new German aroma hops Mandarina Bavaria and Huell Melon orange zest to boost Lightly toasted white oak provides tannin and mouthfeel Assertively tart with light sea salt appearing on the finish

For us this Old World inspired beer is mile zero the point at which we faithfully spin the needle on the compass and follow at will From the warmer climates of equatorial lands this Gose takes its tropic inspiration Brewed with tart passion fruit and flavor brightening sea salt Tropicmost Gose is roadmap of the Southern Americas Cheer to moving until direction is found
Gose style sour ale brewed with coriander and oysters from Island Creek Oysters We recommend that those with shellfish or oyster allergies don sample Harborside
Super Fruit Gose brewed with Hawaiian red sea salt prickly pear mango boysenberry blackberry raspberry elderberry and kiwi juices toasted quinoa

Brew is new take on beloved beer originally brewed in for the Boston Marathon Brewed with Himalayan sea salt and coriander Brew is crisp light ale developed for runners by runners Shelley Smith brewer and marathon runner developed Brew out of her passion to help runners celebrate with the most refreshing beer possible

Based on an obscure centuries old German style that incorporates salt and coriander into distinctly tart wheat beer with dry champagne like finish World Beer Cup Bronze medal winner Malts pilsener wheat organic caramelHops hallertauer mittelfrühAlso coriander saltYeast French saisonst Release January nd Release April

Anbai literally means Salty Plum and the word is also used to describe the stat of taste and flavor Ii Anbai means just right Hitachino Nest Anbai Ale is brewed based on the high alcohol version of the siganture beer Hitachino Nest White Ale infused with locally grown green sour plum ume and finished up with pinch of Japanese sea salt moshio The balance of sourness bitterness comes from the plum and subtle saltiness great umami taste of the sea salt is Ii Anbai just right
Tart and refreshing our gose is sure to blow any picnic out of the water melon
Sour Wheat Ale with mango lemon grass thai peppers and sea salt
A dry hopped spontaneous wild ale aged in oak barrels with coriander orange peel and sea salt

Throw on your Hawaiian shirt and your lederhosen and meet Cigar City Brewing at the intersection of traditional German brewing and tropical relaxation We ve taken our German style Gose an ancient style of moderate alcohol beer brewed with salt and given it the coastal treatment by adding orange peel and lime essence to create the perfect warm weather ale

The finished beer is striking lustful shade of red with persistent white head and durable lacing thanks to the large portion of wheat in the grist The nose is defined by equal parts bright lactic acidity and cherry notes with hint of coriander On the palate the strong lactic acidity is accentuated by the natural tartness of the cherry juice Quantitatively this beer is quite sweet but we find that this level of residual sweetness is just enough to balance the acidity and that the overall perception of the beer is actually quite dry The beer finishes very clean and in conjunction with the salt in the finish it definitely makes you want to come back for more pH Total Acidity ml g

What we ve got here is an imperial stout brewed with massive amount of coffee and chocolates then cave aged in oak bourbon barrels for an entire year to make sure wonderful bourbon undertones come through in the finish Makes your taste buds squeal with delight Now labeled as KBS ABV varies by batch

This titanic immensely viscous stout is loaded with inimitable flavors of chocolate covered caramel and coffee and hide hefty IBUs underneath the smooth blanket of malt It is made with enormous amounts of two row malt chocolate malt roasted barley flaked oats and hops

A deep dark Imperial Stout The Abyss has almost immeasurable depth and complexity Hints of molasses licorice and other alluring flavors make it something not just to quaff but contemplate As for the great drink it now or let it age debate we stand clearly on the fence Distinct and delicious on release the flavors meld and fuse into an entirely different pleasure after year or more in the cellar

Jet Black with an off white head Starts with strong coffee and dark chocolate sensation then fades to multitude of toasty roasty and caramel malt flavors Clean and crisp full bodied Warmth from the high alcohol content lightens up the feel You won fool your taste buds this beer is HUGE

Canadian Breakfast Stout CBS is the epitome of why we launched the Backstage Series to bring some of our most sought after beers which have been available primarily at the taproom or at few select events to much larger audience Canadian Breakfast Stout is an Imperial Stout brewed with blend of coffees and imported chocolates then aged in spent bourbon barrels that have most recently been aging pure Michigan maple syrup
A barrel aged Imperial Stout with roasty malt character intermingled with deep vanilla tones all dancing in an oak bath Bottles are ABV Bottles are ABV
Imperial stout aged on coffee cacao nibs vanilla beans and ancho chili peppers ABV varies by batch

Emerging from the deepest shades of darkness rolling crescendo of flavors burst forth from this robust stout The thundering hoppy appeal of Storm King subsides into the mellow subtleties of roasted malt exhibiting an espresso like depth of character in its finish An exquisite blend of imported malts and whole flower American hops merge harmoniously in this complex ale Discover the dark intrigue of Storm King as it reveals the rich substantial flavors that it holds within

Yeti Imperial Stout is an onslaught of the senses It starts with big roasty malt flavor that gives way to rich caramel and toffee notes Yeti gets its bold hop character from an enormous quantity of American hops It weighs in at hefty IBUs Great American Beer Festival Silver Medal Imperial Stout Great American Beer Festival Bronze Medal Imperial Stout Great American Beer Festival Silver Medal Imperial Stout BeerAdvocate Top Beers On Planet Earth

Choklat is every bit dessert beer encompassing the complexity of the darkest bittersweet candy together with that of the original frothy beverage We combine the finest ingredients to tempt your senses renew the power interrelation of history in every bottle Cacao is mystical bean We re not surprises that ancient hieroglyphs depict chocolate being poured for rulers gods

Péché Mortel French for Mortal Sin is an intensely black and dense beer with very pronounced roasted flavours Fair trade coffee is infused during the brewing process intensifying the bitterness of the beer and giving it powerful coffee taste Péché mortel is brewed to be savored we invite you to drink it in moderation This stout style high in alcohol and bitterness in order to favour preservation was historically brewed to support the long and arduous voyage necessary to export the beer from England to Russia The word Imperial comes from the fact that the beer was specially brewed for the Russian tsar court

Brewed with ridiculous amount of barley World Wide Stout is dark rich roasty and complex This ageable ale clocks in at ABV and has depth more in line with fine port than with can of cheap mass marketed beer IBU

One of the most sought after stouts in Bell history Black Note Stout blends the complex aromatics of Expedition Stout with the velvety smooth texture of Double Cream Stout and ages the combination in freshly retired oak bourbon barrels for months The resulting harmony of flavors captures the finest features of all three components malty notes of dark chocolate espresso dried fruits all buoyed by the warmth and fragrance of the bourbon barrel Aimed squarely at the stout and bourbon aficionados Black Note makes grand statement about the art of the dark
Imperial stout aged on new French and American oak chips

For That Extra KrunkCoffee is my shepherd shall not doze It maketh me to wake in green pastures It leadeth me beyond the sleeping masses It restoreth my brain It leadeth me in the paths of consciousness for it name sake Yea though walk through the valley of the shadow of sleep will fear no artificial sweetener for thou art with me Thy cream and thy sugar they comfort me Thou preparest carafe before me in the presence of my zzz Thou anointest my day with sunlight My cup runneth over Surely richness and flavor shall follow me all the days of my life and will dwell in the house of Cappuccino forever Let us sip or whatever

The Roman Empire had certain je ne sais quoi festive food culture extravagant architecture and spectacular live entertainment Some might argue the Emperors were brutal mad and hungry for power and the people vain when taking baths and working out all day Listen that still all part of the secret Imperial ingredient keep it cool clean confident arrogant and flamboyant Forza Imperiale

In Mayan mythology Hun Hunahpu was the father of the Mayan hero twins Hunahpu and Xbalanque Hun Hunahpu along with his brother Vucub Hunahpu was tricked by the Dark Lords of the underworld and slain Hun Hunahpu corpse morphed into cacao tree his head becoming cacao pod which in typically awesome mythology fashion spit upon the hand of young maiden named Xiquic who promptly became pregnant with the hero twins The twins would ultimately grow up to avenge their father and uncle and defeat the Dark Lords and ascend the heavens to become the moon and sun We brew Hunahpu Imperial Stout once year and release it only at the brewery on the second weekend in March We will continue to do so until the end of the cycle IBU

This is beloved stout When first introduced as limited special collaboration release with San Diego homebrewer Chris Banker after his recipe won our annual homebrew competition and Cerveceria Insurgente it was an instant hit and fans began clamoring for its return Seeing as how its amazing flavor profile is evocative of Mexican hot chocolate featuring coffee pasilla peppers vanilla cinnamon nutmeg and generous amount of chocolate we concluded it was the perfect stout to re release in celebration of the Holidays and the entire winter season This is now highly anticipated yearly tradition that we are pleased to present from us to you and makes perfect wintry gift from you to your friends loved ones or simply to yourself Cheers

Our infamous Black Tuesday is an imperial stout aged in bourbon barrels for over year Rich caramel toasted malt vanilla burnt wood and anise are just few of the many flavors in this rich decadent imperial stout ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV
It Big it Bad Whiskey or Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Stout with Coffee and Cocoa Nibs http www epicbrewing com the beers exponential series item big bad baptist imperial stoutABV varies by batch

In honor of the th anniversary of the original release of Bitches Brew Miles Davis paradigm shifting landmark fusion breakthrough we ve created our own Bitches Brew bold dark beer that a fusion of three threads of imperial stout and one thread of honey beer with gesho root It a gustatory analog to Miles masterpiece IBU

A generous infusion of Denver own Pablo espresso adds yet another layer of complexity to this beer combining with the vanilla oak character intense roasty maltiness and bold hop profile to create whole new breed of mythical creature It official You can now have Yeti with breakfast

Imperial stout brewed with pumpkins Warlock is brewed to enchant your palate on its own and also to counterpoint our Imperial Ale Pumking Make your own black magic by carefully pouring this Imperial Stout into goblet Dark and mysterious the Blackwater Series is serious about high gravity Reanimate your senses with Warlock huge roasted malt character moderate carbonation and spicy pumpkin pie aroma

Chocolate Oak Aged Yeti Imperial Stout is another revered incarnation of our legendary imperial stout We toned down the hops bit to allow cocoa nibs to contribute some pleasing bitterness while vanilla notes from the oak combine with the cocoa to create an aroma and flavor akin to gourmet chocolate bar dash of cayenne keeps things lively adding just bit of heat to the finish Another great Yeti Hell yes

We explored th Century British Stout recipes then charted fresh course to land on modern American version of the old world classic Our Double Stout encompasses the very best of both worlds Golden naked oats dark crystal and roasted malt offer luscious balance of bittersweet chocolate and hints of coffee Fair winds and following seas Smooth sailing all the way home

Happy birthday to us To celebrate our first year as brewery we brewed serious imperial stout and aged it on cocoa nibs vanilla beans cinnamon sticks and fresh habanero peppers This is the first offering in our annual Anniversary series Here to many more IBU

ABV varies by year An Imperial Stout brewed with ancho chili peppers cacao nibs vanilla beans and cinnamon sticks Pouring deep brown with thick head this beer has complex body with delicious lingering roastiness Abraxas is brewed with unique ingredients intended to challenge and excite the palate It may be enjoyed right away or allowed to age in the bottle Vertical tastings are encouraged

Jacob Spears our th Great Grand Uncle is credited as the first distiller to label his whiskey Bourbon He built his distillery in Bourbon County Kentucky in years before we began brewing While obviously bit too late to produce Uncle Jacob wash we ve instead created something far more complex In his honor we present this robust silky smooth full bodied and altogether extremely American rendition of an Imperial Stout aged for months in the very finest Bourbon barrels This explains lot about our penchant for big brews It in our blood
Brewed at Nøgne Ø Imperial oatmeal stout brewed with coffee Ingredients Water malts hops yeast and Vietnamese ca phe chon coffee
Black Tuesday with Vanilla Bean Cocoa Nibs ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV ABV

American style stout aged for year in used year bourbon barrels The brewery most highly sought after beer this imperial stout is aged to perfection in oak bourbon barrels Look for this tasty teat to contain hints of bourbon and vanilla with roasted overtones that is sic sure to please any connoisseur palate Serve at cellar temperature from snifter glass and enjoy this expression of out passion for brewing

Throughout the ages man has been fascinated by the quest for hidden knowledge the search for the secret to transforming the elemental into the extraordinary the simple into the sublime Ladies and gentlemen we present for your consideration this exotic inky concoction the almost magical creation of our modern day alchemists who have turned humble grains barley wheat rye and oats into black liquid gold Layers of complex flavors slowly emerge from the glass espresso roasted fig crème brulée Belgian yeast provides plum like fruitiness noble German hops reveal spicy herbal notes while the rich velvety mouthfeel mellows to dry smoky finish IBU

A bourbon barrel aged version of our Imperial Stout Old ViscosityEnormously rich but satisfying beer Older Viscosity is straight Bourbon barrel aged for minimum of months taking full advantage of our Oak Aging program adding levels of complexity and depth The beer starts off with coating of rich malts and dark chocolate and finishes in dry bittersweet ending balanced by firm bitter tone and warming notes from the alcohol Available in ml cork finished bottlesHops German MagnumOriginal Gravity Availability June

Formerly known as Meph Addict and Coffeestopholes Tweak is Avery Mephistopheles Imperial Stout with chunk of coffee thrown in If you haven geeked out enough the brewery aged in four months in bourbon barrels

Big Bear is big black stout you can really sink your teeth into The bold roasty caramel malt flavor is balanced by Centennial and Cascade hops California State Fair nd GOLD LA International Beer Competition GOLD Great American Beer Festival American Style Stout SILVER World Beer Cup GOLD

Pirate bomb is our beer Prairie Bomb aged in rum casks The flavor from the casks helps impart more vanilla and coconut flavors to the beer while helping to add more body and smoothness to the already explosive and expressive flavors of Bomb
Ale brewed with pecans wheat rye with one quarter aged in bourbon barrels Brewed at Stone Brewing Company with Greg Koch Drew Curtis Fark and Wil Wheaton ABV varies by batch

As scientists our brewers utilize their materials to exacting standards As artists they couldn resist the temptation to combine two of our highly acclaimed Blackwater Series Imperial Stouts Jahva and Choklat Alone each is perfect but together as Mokah they are an inimitable expression of two of the world most sought after flavors Enjoy Mokah stout with or as your favorite dessert

Sunday Morning Stout is an American Imperial Stout aged in bourbon barrels The result beautiful ebony pour with large creamy off white head that lasts and lasts The aromas of roasted coffee and bourbon awaken your senses while their flavors blend with hints of chocolate roasted malt vanilla and caramel

A few times in the history of craft beer it has happened that highly praised beer rises beyond mortal stardom into the higher godly league Usually the recipe to make such heavenly drops is thick fudge like body pitch black color amazingly overwhelming aromas of chocolate coffee dark fruits and muscovado sugar obviously only made in limited amounts and most crucial of all it must taste rare

Aged through four seasons and from blend of the top Bourbons around this Ten Fidy has morphed into monster of cranked up flavor Espresso burnt sugar rich chocolate caramel notes are now driving alongside the vanilla oak bourbon from the barrel and been smoothed out during maturation Even at IBUs it is cool and drinkable letting each sip add more and more complexity ABV varies year to year

This is definitely not your Dad weight An enormously rich and satisfying beer Old Viscosity begins with malty nose with caramel and chocolate overtones An incredibly rich beer with substantial malty notes Old Viscosity finishes with dry sweet Dark Chocolate bitterness HopsGerman MagnumOriginal Gravity AvailabilityYear Round

This Vietnamese coffee version of Speedway Stout is and continues to be AleSmith most popular variation of the ever growing Speedway Stout collection Since we have been adding this blend of four Vietnamese coffees known in Vietnam as cà phê sa đá to our popular imperial stout The coffee beans were slowly roasted at low temperatures and then brewed by AleSmith with traditional phin style filter that gently percolates water through the ground coffee The result is an intensely aromatic and bold tasting coffee that complements the notes of chocolate and roast in this massive stout
Bourbon County Brand Stout spiced with fresh vanilla beans

Named after the city where it all began Kalamazoo Stout is one of our most classic recipes This smooth full bodied stout offers blend of aromas and flavors of dark chocolate and freshly roasted coffee balanced with significant hop presence

Deep robust and richly rewarding this is beer to linger over Obsidian has distinct notes of espresso chocolate roasted malt and black barley with just enough hop bite to cut the sweetness IBUs calories per oz serving

Sierra Nevada Stout a full bodied American version of the traditional black ale It is perfectly balanced with big roasted malt flavors and earthy whole cone hops In when we were building our fledging brewery we needed beer with bold flavors to test the new hand built brewhouse That first brew was stout rich with roasted malts and earthy whole cone American hops We liked that original stout so much that we ve kept it as we ve grown Decades later it still reminds us of that early pioneering spirit

Chicory was one of the first beers we started brewing at our pub back when it opened in It a dark beer made with bunch of roasted chicory organic Mexican coffee St John Wort and licorice root We use whole leaf Cascade and Fuggle hops as well as pale roasted and oatmeal grains IBU

Java Stout uses custom blend of coffee beans roasted locally for us by Water Street Coffee Joint to generate its intense flavor Possessing an unmistakable aromatic punch Java Stout has long been one of our most popular stouts
mysterious dance of tart Michigan cherries with the dark roasted malts of big and bold stout and Stout brewed with cherry juice
Our American style stout aged on organic vanilla beans Intense notes of coffee and dark chocolate lead way to subtle notes of natural vanilla Flaked oats generate silky mouthfeel
A full bodied stout made with all malted barley and blueberry Flavors of chocolate roast malt and light blueberry make up the palate with lots of fruity blueberry aroma

Also known as Aphrodite Black ale with aromas and flavours of vanilla dark chocolate bourbon and roasted malt The vanilla and cocoa marry nicely without out competing each other to produce surprisingly well balanced beer This beer is mildly hoppy but the cocoa introduces touch of bitterness Its colour may be intimidating but it is very smooth beer within reach of most beer drinkers This highly appreciated dessert beer is brewed with organic fair trade cocoa and first rate vanilla beans

Aged for three months in Wild Turkey Bourbon barrels this luxurious stout has deep ebony hue and beautiful mahogany head The woody vanilla like notes imparted by the barrels mingle with aromas of fresh baked bread toffee and espresso and envelop the rich chocolate and roasted barley flavors with fine bourbon character
We use smoked and peated malts to create an intricate malt foundation Our method of dry hopping with vanilla beans and oak chips pushes the depth of this stout flavor spectrum even further

A cup of joe and bold beer can thwart the winter cold so we blended them for the ultimate warmer Our Coffee Stout is fusion of dark roasted malts and rich cold brewed coffee for layers of bittersweet fruity dark chocolate and caramel like flavors

Our rich decadent coffee stout This one soft cocoa flavors open up to reveal richly complex treat We taste flavors of chocolate cake coffee candy milk chocolate with heaps of vanilla pungent distinct coffee stout for sure rich sweet and less roasty base beer contributes the ideal backdrop to this bold and vibrant treat for the coffee and beer lover alike

Highland most robust beer having very malty body with large roasted chocolate flavor all achieved solely through the use of special roasted barley grains It is black in color with very clean finish and moderate hop flavor While the porter style was developing some brewers produced stout porter and over time generated new style known simply as stout These beers traditionally contain distinct roasted malt flavor and can run the gamut from dry stout such as Guinness to sweet stout such as Watney Cream Stout Our Black Mocha falls in the sweet stout range and derives its chocolate and coffee tones from the use of appropriate roasted malt grains and is very often used as an after dinner libation or an accompaniment to dessert

This unique stout combines the flavor of roasted malts and Milwaukee renowned Fuel Cafe coffee Pours deep dark color with beautiful creamy tan head Coffee aromas dominate the nose with background of roasted grain The fine balance of mild hops the gentle acidity of choice coffee and the full mouth feel from roasted malt barley make this an unforgettable brew
A coffee lover delight wonderful stout infused with coffee that is specially roasted for us by Emy s in Stevens Point WI
Harpoon Chocolate Stout is brewed with an abundance of chocolate malt and touch of chocolate IBU

The Commodore came out of our search for medium bodied American Stout The recipe began at our D pilot brewery but quickly became favorite of our crew Strong flavors of roast coffee and bittersweet chocolate balance with light citrusy hop aromas highlighted by crisp bitter finish One sip of this gold medal winning stout will have you ready to take command of your own fleet

Stout brewed with graham crackers molasses with natural flavor added Campfire Stout evokes fond memories of wilderness and camping adventures Notes of chocolate and graham cracker topped with hint of marshmallow will leave you wanting more Like any campfire experience this beer is best shared with warm circle of family and friends Leaves You Wanting More
Vanilla Bean Stout

This triple chocolate stout is unique interpretation of the style combining three different chocolate malts cacao nibs and percent semi sweet chocolate creating sinfully delicious brew The addition of blackstrap molasses produces an earthy caramelized tone in an already complex flavor profile It creamy milkshake like mouthfeel earns this beer the reputation of being dessert in glass

A caribbean style stout infused with coffee Ours is rich and dark with toasted brown head well balanced roasty and full flavored Cold steeping Read Morewith organic coffee from local shop Rise Up Coffee imparts generous but balanced coffee nose and flavor

The Captain is leader of fire crew This beer takes charge of your taste buds with its rich flavor Roasty malt character that has hints of chocolate and coffee which balances the smooth velvety finish The thick creamy head lasts and lasts leaving lace in your glass as your beer disappears This beer pairs well with food Great with dinner or as breakfast or even with rich vanilla bean ice cream OG IBU

Brewed with maple syrup and cold brew coffee this wonderfully complex stout starts with rich smooth coffee flavor then eludes to dark chocolate character and finishes hit of sweetness

DARKLY ENTICING smooth velvety cream cascades into jet black brew revealing rich robust character The dark roasted malts create notes of bittersweet chocolate with hints of dark fruit while the Sumatran Indian Monsoon Malabar coffees develop deep roasty dimension

This robust Coffee Stout is mouthful of flavor dark roasty grain bill stands as the backdrop for galaxy of coffee aroma and flavor made possible by local organic bean roasters Dynamite Roastery Pisgah fan favorite Valdez is brewed bi annually and never lasts as long as the flavor

This is an American style stout that has sweet malt flavors of caramel and chocolate complimented by crisp bitterness produced by roasted barley and American Hops The complex malt bill of pale and roasted malts result in this well balanced stout that is smooth rich dark and delicious And watch out ABV

The seven grains Barley Egyptian Wheat Mesopotamian Oats Egyptian Amaranth Aztec Quinoa Incan Spelt Mesopotamian and Kamut Egyptian Finished with pounds of cold pressed Stumptown Hairbender espresso Finished with pounds of cold pressed Stumptown Organic Holler Mountain Coffee Finished with pounds of cold pressed Stumptown Organic Holler Mountain coffee IBU
