Probably our single most requested beer in the tasting room The chocolate coffee of Black House makes an awesome base for intemperate quantities of coconut cocoa nibs which make the whole thing taste like ridiculously decadent chocolate bar but drier and more like beer

Planet Bean Coffee Stout is smooth dark full bodied and satisfyingly rich Coffee beans expertly roasted at Cumberland County Coffee Company give this stout its powerful aroma and pronounced fresh brewed coffee flavor Your only problem with this tempting brew will be resisting the urge to pour it in your coffee mug before work

First brewed in Naked Fish like most traditional Stouts is medium bodied and nearly black in color with light tan head But where Naked Fish turns the stout style upside down is in its flavor profile Gourmet Chocolate Raspberry Coffee is added to the grain bill to produce taste experience you ll never forget Naked Fish hooks you with flavors and aromas of roast coffee raspberry and dark chocolate before releasing you to dry chocolatey finish These enticing flavors combined with moderate abv are guaranteed to make you get naked Fish Or whatever

Brewed with well water the original well sunk in is still in use with the hard water is drawn from feet underground the gently roasted organic chocolate malt and real organic cocoa used in this ale impart delicious smooth and creamy character with inviting deep flavours and delightful finish this is the perfect marriage of satisfying stout and luxurious chocolate that will lead to smiles and refills Samuel Smith brews in traditional coppers uses stone Yorkshire Squares for fermentation and ships every bottle from the brewery with great pride

Our inky black stout had smooth round palate with dreamlike undercurrent of bittersweet chocolate This dense liquid silk summoned hope from hibernation and balanced winter endless white snows with rich swirl of creamy black rapture IBU

Formerly Pearl Necklace Oyster StoutEveryone favorite bivalve contributes to more than your grandmother pearls They are vital part of the Chesapeake Bay ecosystem but the population is mere of its historical peak Since its inception proceeds from Pearl Necklace have helped the Oyster Recovery Partnership plant millions of baby oysters in the Bay Brewed with Rappahannock River oysters Hops PerleMalts Roasted barley midnight wheat carapils black Yeast English Ale IBU

Secret Stairs is our signature Boston Stout Bold and balanced satisfying with substantial body but not syrupy or sweet Roasted malt provides nutty earthy backdrop to bitter cocoa and little hints of caramel Smooth mouthfeel with drying sensation on the finish We brew Secret Stairs to highlight the unique physical connection between Summer Street and Street We raise pint of Secret Stairs to The Fort Pointer the neighborhood favorite protagonist MALT American row Barley Cara Pils Roasted Barley Black Patent Caramunich Chocolate Pale Chocolate Special HOPS Columbus

Dragonhead is legendary stout dark intense and fully flavoured it is our tribute to the Vikings and their cultural legacy in Orkney On the nose this black stout has smooth roasted malt aroma giving bitter chocolate dark roasted coffee and smoky notes balanced by hints of spicy Goldings Hops On the palate the dark roasted malts combine to give rich rounded palate of chocolate toast and nut with satisfying spicy hop finish

Passionately brewed with over pounds of pure cacao Belgian dark chocolate this irresistibly smooth stout explodes with the taste and aroma of rich dark chocolate goodness Chocolate Love Stout will please you with its roasty maltiness and hints of vanilla and caramel
A blend of malts gives Double Stout character all of its own Black malt enriches the colour and teases the palate with an unmistakable toast flavour Brown malt gives it the dryness

Our smooth Scottish stout meets Tullamore E triple distilled Irish whiskey barrel staves in our unique ageing process to create flavour packed beer with notes of dark chocolate and coffee alongside hints of vanilla and oak We ve spent more than decade perfecting our craft find out how we put the barrels into the beer at innisandgunn com

Chocolate Chipotle Stout Designed to challenge the senses as well as perceptions this is an easy drinking strong flavoured and spiced stout This beer has captured the imagination and the fans across the UK and in America even gaining an honourable mention in the Brussels Beer Challenge Taking you on journey to South America via Yorkshire drinking this Chipotle Chocolate Stout is journey in itself Rich heady chocolate on the nose it all about deep luscious stouty goodness throughout with soft mouthfeel Just as coffee bitterness develops and you re thinking that the party over subtle dry heat arrives that not only leaves your mouth tingling but also thirsty and gasping for another taste The Mayans smoked their chillis and rather than brew with smoked malt which can add to the bitterness we used freshly smoked dried chipotle chillis to add an extra layer of flavour
A perfect beer for the cooler weather Full bodied and accessible Notes of dark chocolate coffee and caramel with roasty finish

The legendary skipjack Rosie Parks once dredged for oysters on the Chesapeake Bay Formerly the fasted of the fleet and beauty to behold she underwent construction and was relaunched on November This stout contains Chesapeake Bay Oyster shells
IBU

Raised from the dead for this beer is an over the top Irish Dry Stout Large amounts of roasted barley and chocolate malt are balanced by big addition of flaked barley and the world finest British pale ale malt Extremely roasty but still highly drinkable
The addition of natural maple brings this premium Stout softer smoother mouth feel and adds touch of sweetness to balance the dark rich malts It is truly Canadian version of an old British classic

Dark Arts blends four malts and bags of whole hops to deliver decadently deep and indulgent experience luxuriously smooth mouthfeel is followed by spicy hop notes and full flavours of chocolate liquorice blackberries and figs The finish is rich and satisfying with lingering roasted bitterness Our stout will convert you to the dark side
Formerly Samuel Smith Old Brewery Extra Stout
Heavily roasted malts characterize this darkest of traditional brews Martello Stout is uncompromisingly bold like the unique towers which once defended our maritime shores IBU

Stout aged in Bourbon Barrels from Bowman Distillery Roasted malts and herbal hops provide an aroma of coffee and spicy chocolate which blends with caramel and vanilla notes that are products of the aging in the Bourbon soaked oak barrels
Chocolate oyster stout

Candi Stout is our fusion of Belgian dark ale and classic stout rich blend of roasted malts is blended with cocoa nibs and candi syrup traditionally used in Belgian abbey ales during brewing resulting in wonderfully drinkable stout with notes of roasted malt chocolate and hint of sweetness surprisingly light mouthfeel and effervescent carbonation deliver sessionable drinkability not often found in stouts today
Brewed every year for the Pemaquid Oyster Festival in Damariscotta this riich chocolatey brew benefits from having ten dozen live oysters involved in the beer mmmm oysters
McCallum is traditional Scottish stout rich and dark in colour hint of fruit and touch of sweetness makes it happiness in bottle More hops than kangaroo if you re stout fan you ll love McCallums

Granted this beer doesn fit exactly in the definition of Stout any Stout But an mail from the brewmaster of this facility clearly states that their intention is to make lighter version of an English Stout Why tone it down Weather issues They want beer that can be enjoyed in our mostly hot climate so it can appeal Mexican beer drinkers

Stout is Porter gone mad In fact the style was known as Stout Porter well into the th century Using extra darkly roasted grains means chocolate and coffee flavours are more intense and the sweetness that one finds in Porter is lacking

When you call something old school it usually because it original or classic That is exactly why we ve named this beer Old School Stout because it our interpretation of classic dry stout The word stout originally meant proud or brave but after the th century it took on the connotation of strong While our Old School Stout isn exactly strong in alcohol ABV it is very much rich full bodied Ale dominated by chocolate and roasted malt flavours and very well balanced Dry stouts achieve dry roasted character through the use of roasted barley just one of the six malts in our Old School Stout recipe subtle bitterness leads to long creamy finish on this aphotic beauty

A traditional Irish Dry Stout Stay Dry is pun In St Petersburg it is difficult to stay dry Our weather is either too hot and humid to avoid constant sweat or our tropical storms maintain torrential downpour rolling in off the Gulf of Mexico This beer is light in body black in color and packed with malt forward flavors reminiscent of chocolate dark caramel and coffee

Foreign Extra Stout is brewed with generous hops and roasted barley for bittersweet balance and full flavored natural bite Developed for global export from Ireland the addition of extra hops ensured this Stout would arrive in perfect condition Today it is enjoyed by millions around the world

The dark caramel large dense headed brew with its alcoholic content is unique due to its sweet notes of chocolate and coffee interspersed into foundation of dark roasted barley Symbolic black to denote leadership power focus and strength is dominant in the labeling as the lion journeys in the twilight unafraid unbowed and unchallenged

Indra Kunindra is burst of madras curry cumin cayenne coconut and kaffir lime leaf Enjoy Our India style Export Stout is unique collaboration with award winning home brewer Alex Tweet Released in limited quantities this explosion of South Asian flavors is reason enough to kneel down and thank the heavens And further proof of San Diego status as brewer playground and beer lover utopia

Volume Foreign Stout Pours black with licorice espresso bean molasses and black cardamom notes that give way to feeling of self loathing burnt opportunities and smoked relationships Gold Medal Winner at the Great American Beer Festival in the Foreign Stout category

Now here a beer with punch Coopers Best Extra Stout is beacon for lovers of hearty brew With its robust blend of fruit and chocolate flavours and bitter hop notes it everything stout should be An all malt brew that naturally conditioned in the bottle Coopers Best Extra Stout unique rich dark texture comes from our liberal use of specially roasted black malt No additives No preservatives

This abv stout has long been secret pleasure among beer connoisseurs and indeed our Brewers who value the mouth watering intensity of its roasted malt smoked wood and dark chocolate notes not to mention it excellent and seemingly endless finish Since we have been exclusively exporting this same special stout from Ireland into Belgium through the vibrant port of Antwerp This is the first time we re making it available for general release in America
Brewed with house roasted bourbon barrel aged coffee

A rich well balanced foreign style stout with huge amount of roasted barley as well as chocolate black and caramel malts The intense roast character is the main attribute of this black colored beer The alcohol content is Zonker has been recognized time and again as one of the top foregin style stouts

Our Irish Style Extra Stout amplifies the traditional drier versions from Ireland for bolder black brew The addition of both roasted barley and Dark Crystal malted barley give Extra Stout undertones of chocolate molasses and dried fruit The beer is generously hopped with East Kent Goldings to balance the sweetness from the malted barley Extra Stout is descendent of the British and Irish porters of the th Century These strong porters eventually became known as strong stout then Foreign Stout or Extra Stout depending on origin Extra Stouts were exported world wide gaining popularity in the West Indies Africa and parts of Asia IBU

Guinness history changed forever in In that year Benjamin Guinness Arthur son brewed our first beer with new roasted grain called black patent malt His stout recipe laid the foundation for how we would brew for the next years The same year Benjamin brewed his lovely dark beer we shipped the first barrels of Guinness to America To this day America favorite stouts are still brewed at St James Gate Based on the Guinness brewing logs of Guinness th Anniversary Export Stout seeks to bring to life the same dark ruby red color and complex flavor of Benjamin beer from years ago Rich and full bodied with notes of caramel toffee and sweet chocolate Smooth drinking with just the right amount of bitterness Guinness th Anniversary Export Stout carries on the legacy of and looks forward to our next years in America

Troubadour Obscura is mild dark red brown beer with balanced Belgian twist Immediately after the first sip of this beer the difference with other Belgian dark beers becomes apparent The solid taste of malt originates from the combination of four different malts used in the brewing of this beer Discover all the different notes chocolate coffee vanilla

Like the force of nature it is named for Tsunami Stout will bowl you over with its jet black color and dark seductive aroma Roasted malts and unmalted barley give this full bodied brew its dense creamy head and distinct dark chocolate and cappuccino flavors that swell to clean rounded malty finish Grab Tsunami and head for high ground degrees PlatoBitterness IBUColor lovibond

The flagship of the Hara brand this uniquely Irish stout brings one back to how Irish stouts used to taste First brewed in it has since been awarded prestigious honours for its quality and authenticity Hara Irish Stout has robust roast flavour complemented by full bodied and smooth mouth feel The generous addition of Fuggle hops lends tart bitterness to the dry espresso like finish This sessionable stout beer is filled with rich complex coffee aroma mingled with light liquorice notes The combination of traditional stout hops with an extra pinch of roast barley allows us to stay true to Irish tradition recreating taste so often yearned for by stout drinkers

Our Coffee Stout is classic combination of traditional stout and premium French roast coffee from St Louis roaster Kaldi Coffee Roasted barley and coffee dominate the aroma with the sweetness from the stout balancing the acidity of the coffee We use unique cold toddy extraction process to brew less acidic coffee for the beer In the Kaldi staff started visiting the Schlafly Tap Room asking for pint of stout and shot of espresso Both Schlafly and Kaldi realized this was match made in beer heaven and soon started working together to find the perfect coffee blend to mix with our Oatmeal Stout This collaboration continues today with regular tastings to perfect the Coffee Stout IBU

Earl was our grandfather brother Hill Farmstead Brewery rests upon the land that was once home to him and his siblings In his honor this Stout is crafted from American malted barley Flaked Oats English roasted malts American hops Organic Guatemalan Coffee our ale yeast and water from our well It is unfiltered and naturally carbonated silhouette of coffee and malt an embodiment of complexity and drinkability this is the ale that dream to have shared with Earl Pale Caramel and Chocolate Malt Roasted Barley Columbus hops Ale Yeast and our Well Water

Like your favorite breakfast treat and great cup of coffee Cinnamon Rolled Wake Bake hits on all cylinders Starting with delicious coffee aroma touch of Cinnamon gives way to sugary sweet icing flavor as buttery nuttiness fills out the last drop of this breakfast in glass

Our Oatmeal Stout is classic British style stout brewed with flaked oatmeal and roasted barley Freshly roasted coffee beans cocoa and touches of raisin and dried fruit dominate the aroma of this super dark ale The richness of the grain blend is balanced by the nutty character of the roasted malt the creaminess from the oatmeal flakes and dose of hops Before the th century all barley was malted over wood fired kilns and the resulting dark roasted malt defined the browns porters and stouts of England Near the end of the th century brewers had introduced oats for their purported restorative and nourishing characteristics producing beers such as oatmeal stout and milk stout By the Oatmeal Stout had nearly trickled out of existence Following the beer literary rebirth in the articles of English beer writer Michael Jackson in the British and American craft brewers are once again promoting the style IBU

The Rusty Nail begins life as The First Nail an oatmeal stout of epic proportions with brewer licorice smoked barley and pale malt and is then aged on cinnamon bark She becomes The Rusty Nail after spending months in year old bourbon barrels

A delicious oatmeal stout with just enough hops to balance the copious quantities of dark roasted malts oatmeal for creamy smooth drinkability and whole vanilla beans for rich complexity To achieve this higher level of decadence we added in whole vanilla beans to the final stage of fermentation the same process we use to dry hop beer
Big Wig No Wig or Comb Over Wigsplitter is an oatmeal stout brewed with freshly ground espresso It for those of us who like little beer with their coffee or little bit of coffee with their beer

Produced in the tradition of th Century English brewers who supplied the court of Russia Catherine the Great Old Rasputin seems to develop cult following wherever it goes It a rich intense brew with big complex flavors and warming finish

Brewed with an abundance of malts this stout is smooth as silk yet complex and rich in body Best enjoyed at cellar temperature to allow the notes of chocolate dark fruit and caramel to soar Put another log on the fire sit back and enjoy the moment with this full bodied and utterly delicious cold weather companion IBU
This Russian imperial oatmeal stout is aged for full year in blend of bourbon barrels from Elijah Craig Four Roses Pappy Van Winkle Woodford Reserve and Buﬀalo Trace

This is the famous Brooklyn Black Chocolate Stout In the th century Catherine the Great Empress of Russia ordered stout to be sent to her from England This beer was brewed strong and hoppy to survive the sea voyage and it arrived in perfect condition Soon Russian Imperial Stout became the toast of the Russian aristocracy Brewed since our Black Chocolate Stout has itself become modern classic heralded the world over It achieves its dark chocolate aroma and flavor through the artful blending of six malts and three distinct mashes Properly kept it will improve in the bottle for many years This stout is the toast of the winter season in many countries and there is nothing better to enjoy with chocolate desserts cheesecake ice cream fine cheeses and roaring fireplaces Given this beer higher ABV and sturdy character we think it a prime candidate for cellaring Find cool dry spot away from light sources and see how it changes in the years to come You never quite know what will happen when you age beer perhaps the body will smooth out notes of vanilla oak and tannins will come to the front or hints of leather and soy sauce will make themselves known No matter what remember that beer is meant for drinking so don keep it to yourself for too long

Expedition Stout offers immensely complex flavors crafted specifically with vintage aging in mind as its profile will continue to mature and develop over the years huge malt body is matched to heady blend of chocolate dark fruits and other aromas Intensely bitter in its early months the flavors will slowly meld and grow in depth as the beer ages

A malt forward monster highlighting the depths of malt flavor Narwhal Imperial Stout is inspired by the mysterious creature that thrives in the deepest fathoms of the frigid Arctic Ocean Featuring incredible depth of malt flavor rich with notes of espresso baker cocoa roasted grain and light hint of smoke Narwhal is massive malt forward monster Aggressive but refined with velvety smooth body and decadent finish Narwhal will age in the bottle for years to come

Turn off the lights and turn on the flavor because Blackout Stout is back and as dark as ever Inspired by the infamous blackout that briefly left some million people without power the bold flavors of our Imperial Stout will light up even the darkest nights Black malt and roasted barley cast notes of chocolate dark fruit and coffee while earthy hops put the lights out on this shadowy brew with pleasantly bitter finish

This beer is big and full bodied Imperial Stout aged in bourbon barrels with lots of roasted malts but very balanced with heavy hops Brewed with top secret root this beer has an amazingly complex flavor that you must wait for

This Russian Imperial Stout is dedicated to Georgy Zhukov arguably one of the finest generals of World War II Opaque black in color with notes of espresso chocolate dark toffee and hints of backstrap molasses The English hop varietals provide subtle herbal dryness and finishes with hearty slap of roasty espresso Pair Marshal Zhukov with Mushroom Solyanka dark chocolate cherries and ground wars in Russia We brew and release Zhukov in the summer knowing that beer of this heft reaches its full potential few months after release So save bottle for the cold winter IBU

Brooklyn Black Ops commercially available version was aged for four months in bourbon barrels bottled flat and re fermented in the bottle with Champagne yeast cases produced

Having downed his fourth Imperial Stout of the day the wild eyed charlatan from Voldvrostronglaky belched and hollered for the Czarina to enter his chamber and bend herself to his will The economy was wreck and revolt was just around the corner Nicky the Czar dude was off playing soldier like any pale nobleman with hemorrhagic skin condition would Such were the final days of the old empire Reactionary decadent sputnik stroganoff weird and drunk But even as the proletariat countryside labored under inhuman conditions and the threat of being sent to futile war in the east they wisely took the time to slam back an Imperial Stout or two After all life can be real suka as they said in the old country Big black bourgeois Bolshoi belligerent buxom and scary This is our version of the end of an era in bottle abv

This deliciously dark treat is our bold Narwhal Imperial Stout aged in oak Kentucky bourbon barrels Black as midnight this intense stout is incredibly complex with notes of dark chocolate rich roasted grains and espresso seamlessly blended with hints of vanilla and toasted coconut with slight touch of honey from aging in the oak spirit casks Nearly as rare as its nautical namesake try it out while you can because like the creature itself it will disappear into the blackness soon and leave nary trace behind Additional Info Narwhal was aged for months in fresh bourbon barrels combination of Willett single barrel Heaven Hill and various Beam brands ABV IBU Bittering Hops Challenger Malts Two row Pale Caramel Chocolate Honey Carafa III Roasted Barley

Brewed with monstrous amount of malt and combined with aggressive American hops this beer is powerful and complex and designed to age Smokiness is subtle but present and blends nicely with the rich dark flavors

Imperial in stature and bigger than your average stout This colossal stout was inspired by those created by th century English brewers for the Russian Imperial Court of Catherine II The special malts in this intense and massive brew delivers rich flavors of dark chocolate coffee and anise
Deep mahogany in color with aromas of roasted coffee molasses and dark chocolate Subtly hopped making it astonishingly smooth and easy drinking for such big beer

Formerly Fyodor ClassicStone Imperial Russian Stout is thick rich and sinful beer that heavy on the palate and massively aromatic with notes of anise black currants cof fee and roastiness This profoundly complexed beer will overwhelm all but the most stalwart beer fanatics with its level of intensity Rich coffee bitter and milk chocolate characteristics abound while dark charred oak rich vanilla and caramel from the bourbon barrels synergistically elevate and further enhance the ultra intense taste of the original beer The name we chose for this heady creation Fyodor is tip of the hat to Fyodor Dostoyevsky one of the greatest most influential novelists of Russia Golden Age IBU

We took our award winning Siberian Night Russian Imperial Stout and aged it for months in fresh bourbon barrels The result blew us away The dark chocolate malt yields milk chocolate flavor that blends perfectly with the vanilla flavor from the barrel The bourbon aroma adds the finishing touch

This Is our Imperial Stout that we age in conditioning tanks with oak staves This adds classic character of old world aging with out the Bourbon tones This black ale is about alc and very rich in roasted and chocolate malt tones Velvety smooth and able to be aged for years all Beers to be bottle conditioned

An imperial stout aged in bourbon barrels and named after our exalted leader Emperor Deth This one is definitely on the dark side play on Josh name this Russian imperial stout is aged in two different types of bourbon barrels Heaven Hill Old Forester then blended for the resulting thick and dark brew Deth Tar is barrel aged Russian Imperial Oatmeal Stout It is brewed with host of wonderful specialty malts flaked oats and oat malt to impart rich silky mouthfeel and deep complex malt flavors and aromas reminiscent of dark baker chocolate fresh brewed coffee and caramel candy We also utilized Warrior as the main bittering hop and English Fuggle in the whirlpool to impart clean balanced bitterness and hints earthiness and spiciness dancing around the intense malt backbone The brew then spent seven months resting between Heaven Hill and Old Forester bourbon barrels The resulting blend is Deth Tar that we bring to you once again on draft and in ounce bombers in commemorative packaging IBU

Russian Imperial Stouts are one of brewmaster Brad Clark favorite styles of beer and Dark Apparition is without doubt his favorite beer to brew We stuff pounds of malt into our bbl mash tun and by the end of the mash dark malts are spilling onto the brew house floor Brad includes great flavors he admires in his favorite Russian Imperial Stouts like chocolate coffee roast dark fruit caramel and some nice earthy spicy hop character With midnight black color and chewy dextrinous body Dark Apparition is huge beer with tons of character

Formerly Schlafly Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial StoutOur Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Stout is brewed with big malt flavor plenty of hop bitterness for balance and roasted barley that imparts notes of dark chocolate As finishing touch the beer is transferred to freshly emptied Kentucky bourbon barrels and aged before being carbonated and bottled The barrel aging gives the beer spicy vanilla character and pleasant warming finish In the th Century Imperial Stout was first brewed in London for export to the court of Catherine II of Russia The beer had to be robust enough to maintain during transport This beer will continue to age well in cool dark place for several years but it is ready to enjoy now IBU

Originally an Against the Grain Brewery and Brouwerij De Molen collaboration beer For the first incarnation De Molen head brewer Menno Oliver hopped in muscle car and drove straight through from the Netherlands to Louisville KY that USA folks to brew this bourbon inspired ale and we liked it so much we decided to do it again We took the ingredients in bourbon whiskey Barley Rye Corn and then smoked them with cherry wood and brewed huge imperial stout with them Then to top it off we aged it in Pappy Van Winkle Bourbon Barrels The resulting beer is rich smokey and complex with bourbon character of caramel vanilla and spice

Dark delights like this were once shipped to the imperial court of Russia With firm roasty maltiness balanced against generous helping of hops Northwind can stand up to the worst its namesake can dish out Enjoy it by roaring fire
Dark Lord aged in bourbon barrels for one year Recently has used blend of barrels from Heaven Hill but has also been Woodford Reserve and others in the pastFormerly known as Oak Aged Dark Lord

First batch of Black Metal fermented with our house mixed culture Naturally because of its unique fermentation with native microorganisms the beer is different than previous versions We re quite happy with how it turned out and we re excited to release it However for fans of the original Black Metal or G Black Metal as its known we feel as though we need to borrow the famous line from Stone Brewing Co Arrogant Bastard Ale You probably won like it Like all our beer the flavors and aromas of the current batch of Black Metal are very much fermentation derived and rely far less on copious amounts of malt and hops This is what we like to drink We like dry balanced drinkable tart beers with some interesting yeast complexity We feel we ve achieved this with Black Metal and hope others enjoy it as well There will be those that don however and wish we return to the days of fermenting this beer with English ale yeast and that OK

Parabajava ia an ongoing series exploring the infusion of coffee into our Parabola Barrel Aged Imperial Series This first offering is collaboration with the famed Intelligentsia Coffee Company utilizing their El Diablo espresso blend This beer was crated for our June th Father Day brunch at Lot in A The coffee brings intense coffee house espress aroma roasty carmel toffee molasses and fresh ground coffee notes The flavor melds well with the big rich character of the stout complementary roasty flavors dark baker chocolate and more caramel which pairs well with Parabola rich malt and smokey oak bourbon notes The finish is amazingly smooth and integrated
IBU Ingredients Maris Otter Munich roasted barley oat black and chocolate malt Columbus and Crystal hops English ale yeast and our local Grimstad water

The Duck Rabbit Imperial Stout is extremely big and robust This special beer is thick jet black and oily in texture Complex flavors of roast malts dominate bitter chocolate and espresso coffee especially There is also very big hop presence both for bittering and for aroma At alcohol by volume this brew is made to be sipped and savored

ROASTED MALT AND COFFEE FLAVORS BUILD THE FOUNDATION OF THIS CREAMY SWEET STOUT Milk sugar in your stout is like cream in your coffee Dark and delicious America great milk stout will change your perception about what stout can be Preconceived notions are the blinders on the road to enlightenment Udderly delightful Collection PerennialStyle Sweet StoutColor Black SRMBody fullABV IBU PLATO PKG Pack KegMalt Pale row Crystal Munich Roasted Barley Flaked Oats Flaked Barley and ChocolateHops Magnum and US GoldingsOther Lactose
The brewer suggests serving temperature of for this beer

Double Cream Stout derives its name from its smooth creamy texture not the ingredients Completely dairy free this stout blends ten different specialty malts to yield remarkable depth of flavor With only touch of burnt notes Double Cream Stout focuses on the softer cocoa espresso like aspects of roasted malt

Taking America Back Dark delicious America great milk stout will change your perception about what stout can be Pouring hard out of the bottle Milk Stout Nitro cascades beautifully building tight thick head like hard whipped cream The aroma is of brown sugar and vanilla cream with hints of roasted coffee The pillowy head coats your upper lip and its creaminess entices your palate Initial roasty mocha flavors rise up with slight hop roast bitterness in the finish The rest is pure bliss of milk chocolate fullness

A bittersweet creamy coffee laced stoutFirst Release August From imperial stouts to IPAs we ve discovered the tantalizingly roasty lift that comes from adding coffee beans to just about any kind of beer This English style milk stout originally limited edition offering at Stone Brewing World Bistro Gardens Liberty Station proved the perfect foil for beans from San Diego based Ryan Bros Coffee The bitterness of the coffee is balanced out brilliantly by the milk sugar we used to add touch of sweetness and creaminess to the stout smooth easy drinking texture Cheers to the coalescence of two highly artisanal and delectable mediums

The Duck Rabbit Milk Stout is traditional full bodied stout brewed with lactose milk sugar Because lactose is unfermentable by brewer yeast it remains in the beer The subtle sweetness and fullness of flavor imparted by this sugar balances the sharpness of the highly roasted grains that give this delicious beer its black color All year long Milk Stout is our number one selling beer
ABV IBUs This Milk Stout is brewed with portion of golden naked oats and lactose milk sugar to give it rounded and full bodied mouth feel With deep roasted and slightly sweet maltiness August release

Brewed with baby ginger from Casselmonte Farm and wildflower honey from Bearer Farms Hardywood Gingerbread Stout captures the terroir of central Virginia in rich creamy libation with velvety mouthfeel and an intriguing evolution of flavors from milk chocolate and vanilla to honeycomb and cinnamon to snap of ginger in the finish Deep dark chocolate in color with mahogany tint and frothy caramel colored head Hardywood Gingerbread Stout offers aromatics of holiday spice originating from the ginger and balanced with generous dose of whole Madagascar bourbon vanilla beans and Vietnamese cinnamon Milk sugar lactose contributes to the full body of this stout and tames its roasty character while oats lend silky quality Enjoy fresh or cellar for special occasion We hope Hardywood Gingerbread Stout contributes to your merriment this season IBU

We love this beer here at the brewery and think you will have one of those ve never tasted beer like that kind of moments when you try it What we really like about this beer is the smoothness that brewing with cream sugar brings to the palate This smoothness balances out the copious quantities of roasted barley used in the brewing process to create rich complex and delicious beer If you have not been stout drinker in the past give this beer try It might just change your mind about how dark beers should taste It tastes so rich but is surprisingly easy to drink IBU
Formerly known as Merry Mischief

Brewed in Lancaster since we re proud to present America original craft Milk Stout Notes of milk chocolate coffee and roasted malt goodness play counterpoint to mild sweetness from the addition of milk sugar You can go wrong with award winning Lancaster Milk Stout

America Favorite Peanut Butter Milk Stout this silky smooth beer put us on the map Troy came up with the idea of combining Peanut Butter with our Beaver Milk Stout and he nailed it Don let the dark color fool you this beer is delightfully easy to drink with cascading aromas of roasted peanuts dark chocolate and coffee
This beer is made with milk sugar lactose which gives this beer nice creamy mouth feel which mingles with hints of chocolate and roasty flavors

Fuggles and Challenger hops plus blend of local barley malts create an aromatic robust dark chocolate cream stout with satisfying bittersweet aftertaste Brewed with skill and patience in one of Britain finest small breweries St Peter Brewery is located in medieval hall in remote and beautiful corner of Suffolk There our beers begin their lives deep below the brewery with water drawn from pure source as it has been for over years essential for the full flavour and pure character of all St Peter beers Our beautiful flask shaped oval bottle is faithful copy of one produced for Thomas Gerrard of Gibbstown just across the Delaware River from Philadelphia The original is now kept at St Peters Hall and is rare example of an oval Eighteenth Century beer bottle
A creamy Milk Stout with all the brilliant flavors of Neapolitan Ice Cream in one glass Taste the rich flavors of chocolate vanilla and strawberry in this unique beer
Imperial Milk Stout aged in bourbon barrels with whole Madagascar vanilla beans Madagascar is full bodied with strong notes of vanilla marshmallow chocolate and coffee

We are excited that you are holding Tree House Brewing Company carefully craft milk stout That What She Said TWSS has distinctive notes of milk chocolate fresh roasted coffee caramel and even hint of smoke We call it the adult chocolate milk shake It is the result of our uncompromising dedication to fresh progressive delightful beer We hope you enjoy it with laughter good cheer and in the company of those you love

Va va voom Our Temptress is seduction in glass Curvy in all the right places this Imperial Milk Stout pours with thick milk chocolate head Chocolate and caramel malt give it rich and complex body while the lower carbonation gives the beer silky mouth feel She voluptuous with soft alcohol warmth that grows deeper with every sip Take your time with her and she ll reward you

years ago when Sam was first cooking up ideas for brews literally for his soon to be brewpub one of the first concoctions tested and implemented was Chicory Stout breakfast themed beer with Mexican Coffee Chicory and Licorice root years later we ve brewed supped up mac daddy version of this OG Dogfish brew to commemorate the anniversary of Chicory aptly named Beer for Breakfast We took the original Chicory recipe doubled the grain bill to hit ABV and tricked it out with all other sorts of delicious Breakfast minded ingredients including lactose sugar the sugar that lends Milk Stouts their character barley malt smoked over local Fifer Orchards wood maple syrup harvested from trees at Northfield Mount Hermon the Western Massachusetts school where Sam and wife Mariah met Steve Smokey Double Dark roast coffee from S Bean Factory in St Paul Minnesota special nod to one of Sam favorite bands The Replacements who hail from Minnesota and wrote one of Sam most beloved songs Beer for Breakfast and for the quintessential Delaware breakfast touch pounds of Rapa Scrapple which was added to the mash Huge notes of coffee in the nose give way to sweet smokey and savory layers in the flavor which overlap bittersweet chocolate roasty espresso and malty undertones We don have much of this one so come and get it while it lasts

Imperial Coffee Milk StoutBrewed with locally roasted coffee and aged in VA KY Bourbon barrels anywhere from three to twelve months Each barrel is tasted individually to determine the vintage unique blend the sought profile is palatable booziness softened by dense creamy sweetness with loud notes of coffee chocolate and vanilla

Hardywood Gingerbread Stout described by BeerAdvocate as freagin Christmas in bottle is an imperial milk stout brewed with vanilla beans cinnamon fresh Casselmonte Farm baby ginger and Bearer Farms wildflower honey Gingerbread Stout is then matured in Virginia bourbon barrels where it adapts an incredibly mellow character with oak caramel and bourbon undertones and emerges weeks later as Bourbon GBS festive blend of spice character laces this rich chocolatey stout which warms the palate and the soul IBU

Cup Joe Coffee Creme Stout uses Higher Grounds roasted fair trade espresso beans in every facet of the brewing process Prominent aromatics of malt espresso and cocoa are abundant and there are robust flavors of cream and coffee This is the perfect morning night capper IBU

Just sit back and enjoy the ride Like its namesake automobile this small batch beer is meticulously engineered for luxury and enjoyment We start with great hearty stout recipe and add loads of dark chocolate pounds per barrel brew This Imperial Chocolate Cream Stout is the color of molasses and is full of rich toasted cocoa notes with hints of dark fruit Imperial will delight the taste buds IBU
Split Shot combines the local talents of Elysian Brewing and Stumptown Coffee in deliciously smooth very Northwest beer

Our chocolate milk stout pours black as the night sky with aromas of dark chocolate chocolate malt more chocolate With firm tan head rich velvety mouthfeel our Chocolate Milk Stout is perfect addition to the change of seasons Brewed with two pounds of cacoa nibs per barrel this beer is chocolate lovers dream

Not your typical Jelly of the Month Club beer Dark roasted malt and bittersweet cocoa and coffee flavor and aroma burst from this pitch black milk stout The full body and sweetness are derived from the addition of lactose aka milk sugar which is not fermentable by beer yeast healthy dose of English Kent Goldings hops provides counterpoint to this ale rich and complex maltiness
As the name implies Mother Milk is dark and creamy milk stout Hints of oatmeal chocolate and of course milk make this brew have remarkably smooth and silky finish classic example of the style
XXX version is for the export market

Since the Narragansett Beer and Autocrat Coffee have been home grown Rhode Island favorites This beer is unique collaboration that brings together Narragansett bittersweet Milk Stout with dark delicious Autocrat Coffee smooth stout with robust roasted coffee aroma and bittersweet coffee flavor Notes of toffee dark chocolate and roasted barley

Sweet Potato Stout our original Sweet Potato Cream Stout is the ideal Southern style Stout Brewed with roasted Southern grown sweet potatoes the background has an impressive taste with added notes of roasted chocolate coffee and caramel flavors with sweetening enhanced with lactose milk sugar
Double Milk Stout brewed with espresso coffee beans and lemon peels

Like your favorite cup of Café Mocha Moo HooChiato Chocolate Espresso Imperial Milk Stout puts you in the right state of mind Take in the aroma of expertly roasted espresso from Jittery Joe and let your taste buds melt into the flavor of Olive and Sinclair award winning chocolate Brewed with lactose sugar for creamy mouth feel and touch of sweetness this is Barista wish come true ABV varies by year

Hold On To Sunshine is rich and delicious stout intended to be savored and enjoyed as we enter the cool Autumn months here in New England Brewed with Pale and Chocolate malts Lactose Coffee Cacao and Peanut Butter it exhibits notes of rich milk chocolate dark brown sugar creamy espresso and chocolate covered peanut butter cups luxurious mouthfeel and creamy body contribute to beer that feels much bigger than it is decadent treat and one that won overwhelm you with heaviness yet is loaded with delicious bold flavors that express themselves as it warms Life can come at us fast and hit us with unexpected hardship inducing stress fear anger confusion sadness and uncertainty But together we must find solace and comfort in each other and in something wonderful equal and free for everyone to hold on to Sunshine For Lauren
This Milk Stout is brewed with generous amount of Guatemala Antigua coffee There a noticeably sweet character but we don shy away from the coffee bitter nature It the coffee drinker coffee stout
Apple Brandy Barrel Aged Imperial Milk Stout
A velvety smooth Stout brewed with oats and milk sugar that create creamy finish over dark malt base
Oatmeal Milk Stout

We are extremely excited to introduce Single Shot beautifully balanced coffee stout made with special blend of our favorite coffees It pours super dark in the glass unleashing fluffy mocha like head We experience flavors and aromas of rich chocolate cold brewed coffee and coffee ice cream Single Shot is exceptionally creamy on the palate while maintaining lightness that leaves you wanting more Perfect for can

Moment of Clarity is an American Milk Stout carefully brewed and conditioned with coffee chocolate and dark amber maple syrup It pours beautifully in the glass with rich mousse like head and dense complexion It exhibits strong maple and chocolate aromas on the nose and recalls chocolate covered maple cream candies in the flavor Though dense and flavor filled it still maintains certain fluffiness that makes it easy and pleasant to drink big glass of It is wonderful and decadent treat that for us evokes yearning for relaxed Sunday mornings with pile of chocolate chip pancakes

Impermanence is an imperial milk stout brewed with coffee chocolate and maple syrup Below these additions lies complex base of chocolate caramel and dark crystal malts kettle addition of lactose serves to amplify the decadence of this uniquely Tree House offering Impermanence coats the tongue with flavors of sweet milk chocolate dark amber maple syrup and coffee ice cream It an incredible treat bona fide breakfast confections bonanza It is an example of what is possible with careful selection of ingredients paired with focused brewing execution Please enjoy it fresh and use it as an opportunity to reflect give thanks and enjoy in the company of others

For those seeking decadence and transcendence in craft beer we bring you The Chocolate Manifesto Triple Chocolate Milk Stout luxurious beer that demands to be shared among friends With three kinds of chocolate this beer is euphoric detour from the mundane Life is too short to brew beer that doesn matter to you

Our Velvet Merlin oatmeal stout has been transformed into mindblowing mouthful known as Nitro Merlin Milk Stout The new ingredient is lactose k milk sugar When Velvet Merlin is brewed with milk sugar to create Nitro Merlin Milk Stout the effect is similar to adding cream to your dark roasted coffee The wizardry comes via nitro the brewing nickname for nitrogen gas

This beer was designed and brewed for Lauren to celebrate and reflect upon our second wedding anniversary rich milk stout base is amplified by large addition of cocoa nibs and blend of our favorite coffee The flavor profile punches well above its alcohol content with heavy milk chocolate and chocolate syrup notes balances by gentle and rounded coffee character Despite its heft it retains wonderful and fluffy drinkability sincerely hope it can be enjoyed and shared with someone you love The gift of chocolate for Lauren

The second in our Hunter Vertical Series Vanilla Hunter Vanilla Hunter starts with our base of Hunter Milk Stout with which we then added whole Vanilla beans to compliment Hunter roastiness with an elegant rounded out flavor

At Arrogant Bastard Brewing Co we believe that pandering to the lowest common denominator represents the height of tyranny virtual form of keeping the consumer barefoot and stupid Brought forth upon an unsuspecting public in Arrogant Bastard Ale openly challenged the tyrannical overlords who were brazenly attempting to keep Americans chained in the shackles of poor taste As the progenitor of its style Arrogant Bastard Ale has reveled in its unprecedented and uncompromising celebration of intensity There have been many nods to Arrogant Bastard Ale even outright attempts to copy it but only one can ever embody the true nature of Liquid Arrogance

First release November Originally brewed to celebrate the one year anniversary of Arrogant Bastard Ale Double Bastard Ale debuted in November as an amped up version of that already aggressive beer huge malt bill and an unreasonable amount of hops make this ale one that will be appreciated by only few and that just fine with us We didn brew this dark amber monster to please anyone other than ourselves
IBU

Too many strive towards complacency as goal We grow up thinking that the ability to become complacent is the equivalence of success in life True Arrogant Bastards know that this could not be further from the truth The real beauty richness and depth in life can only be found if the journey through life itself is looked upon as constant chance to learn live and find life passion Passion threatens the complacent and fills them with fear We on the other hand seek it out To this end we bring you OAKED Arrogant Bastard Ale Another reward for those seeking new sources of passion and another point of dissension for those who are not

Our malty and rich beer with snappy hop finish truly defies style Imperial Mild Uber ESB We do know for sure that it is Unforgiven and Unrepentant In remembrance of the St Patrick Day massacre and in commemoration of the day suspension that followed Lagunitas brewed this especially bitter ale See the ABC conducted an undercover investigation of our brewery finding us guilty of operating Disorderly House We did the crime We did the time We got the bragging rights

Truly the epitome of brewing two thousand year evolution Samuel Adams Utopias offers flavor not just unlike any other beer but unlike any other beverage in the world Each release is blend of batches some having been aged up to years in the barrel room of our Boston Brewery in variety of woods We aged portion of the beer in hand selected single use bourbon casks from the award winning Buffalo Trace Distillery Some of the latest batches also spent time in Portuguese muscatel finishing casks as well as sherry brandy and Cognac casks This flavorful slightly fruity brew has sweet malty flavor that is reminiscent of deep rich vintage port fine cognac or aged sherry Vintage aged in Buffalo Trace barrels and finished in Aquavit Caracavelos Ruby Port Cognac and Medeira Barrels

First release November Lukcy Basartd Ale was first released in November in celebration of the lucky th anniversary of Arrogant Bastard Ale This powerfully complex beer is an amalgamation of three Bastards Arrogant Bastard Ale Double Bastard Ale and OAKED Arrogant Bastard Ale unceremoniously thrown together and then dry hopped to excess Those Worthy souls who possess the nerve to try it will be rewarded with delicious assault on their taste buds
A blend of Black Tuesday anniversary ale and White Oak Sap
Cue the banjos blend of Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Stout and Brandy Barrel Aged Barleywine One of our highest and most sought after non sour aged releases

Down in Kentucky and across the pond in Scotland distillers who age their whiskeys for many years refer to the evaporation of the spirits from their barrels as The Angel Share We couldn agree more Each time barrel is filled measure of liquid seeps into the oak and is lost for good This striking Strong Ale is brewed with copious amounts of Caramel malt to emphasize the vanilla and oak flavors found in freshly emptied bourbon or brandy barrels The beer spends year in oak before it is packaged for release
Fred was created to honor beer writer and historian Fred Eckhardt It is made with aromatic and rye malts and includes different hop varieties alcohol by volume IBUs

Brewed in collaboration with Dogfish Head Craft Brewery Eight years after it was last seen blast from Sierra Nevada Brewing Co past is set to return That creation is Life and Limb percent ABV strong ale brewed with birch and maple syrup that is collaboration between Sierra Nevada founder Ken Grossman and brewer Brian Grossman and Dogfish Head Brewery founder and president Sam Calagione and vice president Mariah Calagione This will be the third time that the ale has been released after it debuted in and it was rereleased in

I awake from slumber that been anything but peaceful feel stronger yet somehow more nimble and refined have been born anew and in the process anointed with vibrant inspiring previously unexperienced character all while maintaining everything am and have always been bold bullish unadulterated and yes Arrogant Are you Worthy of quaffing beverage of this intensity irreverence and quality craftsmanship Not likely but for those who get it know my time in this bourbon barrel has not been wasted Cheers to you enlightened imbiber On second thought cheers to me

Lovingly referred to by Fremonters as the BOMB this bourbon barrel aged edition of our winter ale has warming spicy aroma and rich carmelly notes of bourbon wood and vanilla added to dark roasty chocolatey malt flavors and subtle hopping Down Dirty Row Crystal Munich Roast Barley Carafa Chocolate malts with Columbus Willamette US Goldings hops Aged in year old American oak whiskey barrels Blend of and month old bourbon aged Abominable Ale
Ingredients Malts Row Munich and C Hops Cascade Yeast Water Rogue Pacman Yeast and Free Range Coastal Water º PLATO IBU AAº Lovibond

Formerly Bourbon Barrel Aged Abominable Coffee And CinnamonStyle Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Winter Ale with Coffee CinnamonABV IBU This year release of Bomb is aged in year old American Oak bourbon barrels and is blend of and month old barrel strength Winter Ale This special edition adds cold brew coffee and cinnamon bark to complement the bourbon oak cacao and leather notes achieved from Bomb extended barrel aging and barrel blending

One of the brightest stars in city filled with culinary treasures Christopher Elbow has been handcrafting masterpieces in chocolate for more than ten years In that time the reputation of his artistic delicacies has spread around the globe Elbow sweets are distinguished by their use of unusual and sometimes surprising flavors and ingredients in that adventurous spirit we joined forces to bring you very special Chocolate Ale In developing this beer Elbow and Boulevard brewmaster Steven Pauwels sought to harmonize the interplay of chocolate and malt with each supporting and enhancing but not overwhelming the other Just the right chocolate was essential Elbow recommended rare variety from the Dominican Republic prized for its robust flavor and aroma and personal favorite More than mere flavoring the chocolate in the form of nibs or crushed roasted beans was incorporated into the brewing process itself IBU

Brewed using two Munich malts two Smoked malts and two types of Belgian candy sugar It was aged in year old Bourbon barrels and Apple Eau de Vie barrels for about one year First release February k Bottleworks Second release November Third release October

Down in Kentucky and across the pond in Scotland distillers who age their whiskeys for many years refer to the evaporation of the spirits from their barrels as The Angel Share We couldn agree more Each time barrel is filled measure of liquid seeps into the oak and is lost for good This striking Strong Ale is brewed with copious amounts of Caramel malt to emphasize the vanilla and oak flavors found in freshly emptied bourbon or brandy barrels The beer spends year in oak before it is packaged for release

Originally brewed to celebrate Inauguration Day January we elected to give Ale to the Chief second term to commemorate the election Not an Imperial pale ale this is democracy It Presidential Take the all American pale ale bipartisan blend of malt and hops increase both to Avery Brewing standards and then of ourse dry hop the result with that most quintessential of American hops Cascades and you get this brew worthy of the Oval Office

Using blend of Anejo and Reposado barrels and aged for minimum of ten months Agave Maria has hints of black pepper sweet sugar oatmeal and oak with an earthy bitter smoked chocolate on the finish The base beer new Agave strong ale was created specifically to pair with the spiciness of the Tequila adding sweet honey like quality to the beer
Aged in new medium toast American oak barrels for at least months
Our high gravity offering weighs in at ABV and is delightfully loaded with malt and hops This is an ale worthy of your sturdiest goblet or most treasured stein Ring it
Bottles oz released November Batch bottles oz released July

Enticing rich and complex this creation defies easy description Our once year beer is brewed only during sugaring season with maple sap from our friend Paul Marble in Fayston VT No water added Just barley hops and ale yeast

Triple Bag is brewed in small batch from single infusion that uses only the first runnings of the mash The result is brew made from only the purest part of the grains providing uniquely rich and dense flavor with an aroma reminiscent of the finest dessert wines This brew is naturally carbonated and is an example of brewing purity that is rarely experienced by those other than brewers themselves IBU

Celebrating our second decade of brewing ShmaltzBrewing presents ORIGIN Pomegranate Ale Arenewal of our original HE BREW Beer covenant brewed once again after years with the juiceof over luscious Pomegranates ORIGIN is acomplex rich and balanced Imperial Amber Alewith truly unique character The onlyPomegranate Strong Ale in the country

Three Lick Spiker Ale is brewed with three different roasted malts creating chocolate flavors and full body taste After fermentation has been completed with our top fermenting ale yeast we infuse our brew with bourbon oak aged chips and let the extended aging process take over Hints of bourbon and vanilla from the oak come through the aroma and flavor
Made with row malt Galena hops house yeast apricots and carmelized honey On old sailing ships barm was the foam on top of fermenting fruit and Barmy was the adjective used to describe it

A tribute to our favorite Brewmaster Greg Matthews the Velvet Hammer appears as dark ruby reddish brown ale beneath sheath of protective off white foam It is malt forward with elements of caramel and the sweetness of light brown sugar balanced nicely by combination of floral hops and noticeable alcohol bite It a sturdy brew with smooth character which belies both an inner strength and slightly full body along with moderate bitterness to round out the taste

This year release of Bomb is aged in year old American Oak bourbon barrels and is blend of and month old barrel strength Winter Ale This special edition adds toasted coconut to complement the bourbon oak cacao and leather notes achieved from Bomb extended barrel aging and barrel blending Each barrel contributes different note and combining each barrel to create coherent tone is distinct art and true pleasure Please do enjoy this unique barrel aged ale today but know that Coconut Edition Bomb will age gracefully for years to come Don Be Afraid To Be Abominable

A limited edition collaboration between New Belgium and Knob Creek Oakspire is unique bourbon barrel ale aged with bourbon steeped oak spirals and char from inside the barrel Smooth notes of toffee vanilla and caramel wrap up with pleasantly warm finish Oakspire Where innovation meets tradition

Otto is soothing and deep with flavors of red and black fruits vanilla and oak Otto blends peaches and cherries with our distinguished beer Fred It is then aged in oak barrels for at least months Brewed with love and respect for my brewery strongest influence Fred Eckhardt and bears his name at birth

The Connecticut Yankees of Two Roads have CONNjured up this moonshine inspired bourbon like ale Using good ol USA corn grits and aged in real bourbon barrels from famous Kentucky distillery this unique CONNcoction includes notes of whiskey oak and vanilla It should make your taste buds happier than pig in

Brewed to push the limits of our own skills and imagination Colossus is dark amber in color and full bodied with perceptively sweet flavor profile accented by notes of apple and surprisingly tame alcohol presence This astounding alcohol content is achieved through fermentation alone no alcohol is introduced at packaging nor it distilled Multiple grains are used in conjunction with three different yeast strains to produce beer that simply defies classification and most laws of nature One sip of this behemoth brew and you ll agree Sometimes size does matter Batch ABV Batch ABV Batch ABV Batch ABV Batch ABV

Ale brewed with honey Barrel Aged Really Tasty it pretty simple actually delicious blend of our Imperial Honey Stout and Barleywine Ale aged to perfection in oak bourbon barrels Delightful aromas of caramel vanilla and dark fruits followed by brown sugar dark molasses espresso and chocolate on the palette The complexity evolves as BART warms up and it the perfect beer to sip with friend and celebrate all that is good in the world
Brewed using the excess from their Hurricane Kitty recipe this beer is combined with pounds of local Hudson Valley honey oak chips and several additions of hops during the month conditioning period

Born double mashed imperial brown ale then matured for months in freshly emptied year Canadian rye whisky barrels this sturdy ale features checkered notes of rich vanilla charred oak warming whisky and spicy rye With lingering boozy sweetness and round resonant flavor Plaid Habit clearly earns its name ABV varies by year
A brand new offering from our barrel project spiced Rum barrel aged strong ale with Ginger Orange Peel and Vanilla
Bourbon Barrel Aged American Strong Ale finished on Coconut and Cold Bot Coffee Coffee Beans
Originally brewed as Christmas beer in this dark ale has rich flavors of mulling spices and caramel with smooth palate and warming finish

Drawing on Quebec folklore Unibroue chose the name Trois Pistoles to honour the city historic importance and pay homage to the legend of the Black Horse Conjured up by priest to help build new church this incarnation of the devil ran off when its bridle was removed Because construction was still underway when the horse vanished stone remains missing from the church to this day

A deep mahogany Belgian style brown ale brewed with beet sugar raisins and Belgian style yeast We began brewing this one at our pub in we began packaging and selling it sometime in as the answer to the question What beer should enjoy with wood grilled steak Raison Etre fits the bill It as tasty and complex as fine red wine In the Quick Sip Clip video Sam talks about Raison Etre inside the new cellars for our bbl fermentation tanks The cellars were designed specifically to allow sterile yeast management The system also allows us to automatically dose the yeast into the fermentation tanks At Dogfish we use multiple strains of yeast for our different beers so we are acutely aware of all that can go wrong when you don love and protect the yeast IBU
Dark Triple Ale brewed with caramel malt and re fermented with Bordeaux wine yeast
