Bourbon barrel aged wheatwine

Our full bodied abv Ryewine Brimstone is mahogany in color and built on equal measures of smoky roasted malt and sizzling hop bitterness accentuated by glowing embers of warm bread dark fruit esters and dry spicy rye character that smolders from your first sip to its long lingering finish Drink up and get stoned

The name Devil Heart of Gold comes from what they call the Devil Cut When bourbon ages in barrel portion of the bourbon evaporates this is called the Angel share Another portion of the bourbon gets absorbed into the new oak barrel this is called the Devil cut Therefore the Heart of Gold beer aging in the barrel starts to absorb back some of the Devil Cut and hence the name Devil Heart of Gold We took our Heart of Gold and aged it in Knob Creek year old barrel from our friends at The Wine and Cheese Place in October The beer rested in these barrels for months bottles will be released exclusively at The Wine and Cheese Place

If you closed your eyes in our barrel house you might think our brewers have become chocolatiers They dipped cherries into this limited edition of our bourbon barrel aged wheatwine style ale Already rich and creamy with white chocolate flavors thanks to fresh vanilla beans cacao nibs and extensive oak aging this treat for the senses has been enhanced with the addition of tart sweet juicy cherries
Honey Wheat Wine Style Ale aged in bourbon barrels conditioned on toasted nuts
Dunkel Wheatwine
Congressional Approval imperial wheat ale aged for nearly seven months in mix of Old Forester and Woodford Reserve bourbon barrels
A hybrid kolsch wheat beer brewed with organic blue agave nectar Light in color and finish
Rye Barrel Aged Ob liv ous

Our head brewer James Taylor was given the club challenge brew high gravity Hefeweizen while tempering the typical clove and banana notes He began with healthy amount of Bohemian Saaz hops and grain bill of equal parts malted barley wheat berries Then he swapped the German Wizen yeast in favor of an English Ale yeast better suited for barley wine The result is complex yet delicate beer with soft mouthfeel which warms yet doesn overpower We like to think of this beer as sort of cross trainer between the classic unfiltered wheat style and barley wine ale Yes he does play acoustic guitar

The Wild Wheat Wine Honey Ale has floral and rustic flavors that began with generous foundation of pilsner and wheat malts Local clover honey two wild yeast strains and months in red wine and bourbon barrels give this distinctive honey ale an earthy backdrop notes of sweet tropical fruit and rich tartness Savor accordingly

We all know that guy the one who says he gonna shoot you an email the one networking at beer events the one who lives five blocks from work but drives the one who winks and throws you the finger gun so next time this guy tries to hand you business card grab our very sophisticated Wheat Wine insteadand have something that actually matters in your hand

Brewer Wheat Wine is beer style born on the S West Coast in the s legend has it that the style was conceived and first crafted at small brewery pub in Sacramento California It has as its progenitor the English Barley Wine beer style Wheat Wine as beer style is characterized by massively rich complexity imbued with tenaciously strong willed sense of balance It is style indicative of the irreverent creativity and unrelenting passion for beer that form the hallmarks of craft brewing in the West Coast of the United States Baird West Coast Wheat Wine is crafted in homage to the skilled brewing artisans and fearless beer entrepreneurs that have pioneered craft brewing on America great West Coast Baird West Coast Wheat Wine is heavyweight this year tipping the scales at approximately alcohol by volume percent of the fermentable extract is derived from malted wheat and this lends quenching drinkability rare to beers of this strength This drinkability is buttressed further by percent addition of Japanese candy sugar which lends to the beer character reminiscent of Belgian style Tripel The hops once again are American West Coast types this year though large additions of Vanguard and Sterling render the hop character softer and spicier than last year boldly citrus performance

When we finally opened our production facility in Maplewood in the very first guest we had visit us to brew collaboration was Brad Clark In we brewed beautiful little sunset colored beer to age in French oak to be later finished on Pluots and in March of we released our first collaboration with Brad Pitter Patter Brad came back to town for that release and while here we brewed this release Maple In The Wood maple bourbon and bourbon barrel aged wheatwine We used the flavor profiles and took inspiration from our respective barleywines but infused the recipes with copious amounts of malted white wheat In the kettle we added large percentage of Vermont maple syrup We then aged this wheatwine in BLiS maple bourbon and H Taylor bourbon barrels for months before selecting blend that showcased the barrels and the individual threads in harmonious cohesive way The result is luxurious round rich beer that lays the groundwork and structure for the barrels to rest The maple leaves nuanced hint of sweetness that melds with the notes of bourbon caramel toffee and dark fruits from the blend of yeasts we used to ferment before allowing it to age and mature in oak to softness and balance Although it a big beer like most of our barrel aged beers the wheat lightens the experience and allows it to fall somewhere between our Längst and Anabasis on the palate
Aged in first use Woodford bourbon barrels for year

Great White Buffalo is wheat wine with vanilla and coffee This beer has notes of white chocolate dark fruits honey and hint of coffee Richard took great pride in creating this recipe and it is now known as his favorite Aslin beer

Few brewers will take wheat beer to the level of wheat wine but we did Strawberry puree added during and after fermentation provides natural strawberry flavor and aroma without adding additional sweetness The alcohol by volume is well hidden making for an incredibly drinkable fruit wheat wine

This limited edition of our bourbon barrel aged wheatwine featuring cacao nibs and vanilla beans to recreate the flavors of white chocolate has cinnamon and maple added to it to warm you up during the cooler months of the year

Reposado Tequila is known for its oak aged smooth complexity This is our interpretation of the fine Mexican spirit Reposado Negro is Black Wheat Wine aged in Tequila Barrels marriage of sweet alcohol warmth smooth bready texture and roasted malt charred flavors this jet black brew will have you swearing you are sipping top shelf tequila

We took fresh juicy boysenberries and drizzled them over creamy and smooth vanilla bean Combined with our bourbon barrel aged wheatwine style ale this boysenberry treat is bound to delight your taste buds with its myriad charms
Also know as Belgian Moon in Alberta British Columbia

Our interpretation of traditional Belgian wheat beer Brewed with generous portion of wheat and spiced with coriander and Curacao orange peel this beer is fruity refreshing and slightly cloudy in appearance

The Original Belgian Wheat Beer Almost years ago in the Belgian village of Hoegaarden band of monks experimented by adding oddball botanicals from halfway around the world to their traditional wheat beer Our recipe inspired by their creation is beer with refreshing flavor and captivating aroma unlike any in the world Let the refreshing citrus and earthy coriander alleviate the stresses of modern living and whisk you to another place entirely You might call it divine inspiration we call it Hoegaarden

Originally known as Spring Heat Spiced WheatWe ve shaken up traditional tastes by brewing spiced Belgian style wheat ale with real orange lemon and lime peels and then added little coriander spice to the mix This uniquely crafted and award winning ale is unfiltered to create brew that is naturally cloudy with light golden color and smooth refreshing finish
A witbier bursting with good karma Made with dried organic orange slices fresh cut lemongrass and bit of coriander this Belgian style white beer is great thirst quencher IBU
IBU

The Blanche de Chambly label features the icon of the city where it is brewed Fort Chambly It was converted from wooden barricade used for fighting against the Iroquois in the middle of the XVII century into stone fortress to combat the British army at the beginning of the XVIII century With notes of dried orange peel and coriander seeds this brew is worthy representative of classic Belgian style white wheat beers To date it has won more than international medals including being named The World Best White Beer on numerous occasions Unibroue is proud to brew the most popular white beer in Quebec

Formerly Winter White AleAn alternative to dark and heavy winter warmers and stouts Winter White is stylish and refreshing Wheat Ale Fermented with Belgian ale yeast this blend of barley and wheat malts yields mixture of clove and fruity aromas all without the use of any spices Deliberately brewed to retain cloudy appearance Winter White is beer for embracing winter

Stirring from the haze of winter this refreshing unfiltered White Ale awakens its smooth wheat with the bright snap of spring spices From the subtle sweetness of orange peel and plum to the peppery bite of fresh ground coriander the blend of spices creates just the right refreshing kick to signal that spring is on its way

Witte is our version of the classic Belgian wit or white ale Witte which is actually Flemish for white is brewed with malted and unmalted wheat orange peel and coriander offering refreshing style that showcases the Belgian talent for brewing full flavored ales that are also light and balanced It is pale straw in color slightly hazy from the yeast and topped with huge white fluffy head Witte is pleasantly light on the tongue balanced between malt and wheat sweetness Hops and spice with subtle clove note backed by flavors of lemon and sweet orange give way to dry crisp refreshing finish
A big Belgian style witbier brewed with coriander and orange peel and fermented with pinot noir juice After fermentation fraction of the batch is aged in one of our gallon oak tanks IBU

As crisp as the first snowfall of the year this unfiltered white ale is blended with holiday spices including cinnamon nutmeg orange peel The familiar citrus and wheat characters of the ale are complemented by the warmth of the spices for festive brew that perfect for the season

The Cracker Cowboys of Florida were colonial era settlers often of Scots Irish descent who arrived in Florida when Spain traded their territory of La Florida to the English The term Cracker in Florida usage relates to the whip these cow hunters used to herd cattle in Florida Palmetto Prairies Called Quaqueros by the Spanish these hardy and hard working Cracker Cowboys helped to shape the history of Florida the nation oldest cattle raising state We brew Florida Cracker White Ale with unmalted wheat orange peel and coriander and then ferment it with Belgian yeast strain to give it spicy and dry finish Perfect for warm day on the Palmetto Prairie IBU

Light crisp refreshing UFO White follows in the tradition of spiced wheat beers that have been brewed in Belgium for well over years Brewed with orange peel and unique blend of spices UFO White is the perfect choice for summer barbecue night out with friends or any time you¹re thirsting for something little different Like UFO Hefeweizen and UFO Raspberry Hefeweizen we leave UFO White Unfiltered for more natural taste and appearance IBU
Was Spring seasonal now Fall Winter seasonal
Belgian Wit brewed with Passion Fruit

Positive Contact is the second batch of the Imperial Belgian Style Wheat beer that Sam and Ben brewed couple months back For this batch we stepped up the spice and cider additions Instead of lbs of apples Ben pressed lbs of organic Fuji apples for total addition of gallons of fresh pressed cider which was added to the whirlpool in order to really bring out the cider character The amount of cilantro was nearly quadrupled with lbs total which was pureed with portion of the cider and then added after the boil was done The cayenne was doubled but added directly before the beer was transferred from the kettle to the fermenter in an effort to minimize the burn while increasing the flavor and aroma contributed different type of wit yeast was used and then fermented slightly cooler to keep the yeast character minimal and act as supporting role to the main players the cider and spices Lastly this batch was boiled for less time than the original batch leaving the beer with lighter straw color than the amberish hue of batch Overall Positive Contact is characterized by its bright spritzy cider character and autumnal herbal quality derived from the cilantro cayenne and yeast IBU

This beer inspired by the flavors of Southeast Asian cuisine is twist on the classic Belgian witbier style Instead of the traditional coriander and orange peel spicing regimen we add fresh lemongrass ginger root and dash of Sorachi Ace hops The result is wonderfully refreshing ale with notes of lemon candy citrus fruit and slight spiciness from the ginger Best served at in tulip or wine glass IBU
Organic wheat beer IBU

Wittekerke Wit is easy to recognize by the elegant glass it is served in its sunny colour and creamy foam head The taste is nicely rounded with well defined herbal bitterness The late famous beer expert Michael Jackson described Wittekerke Wit as creamy aromatic with clean teasing perfumed fruitiness and faintly herbal tartness

Alaskan White Ale has soft slightly sweet base with the unique spice aroma of coriander and crisp citrus finish of orange peel light and effervescent body combined with the smooth palate creates complex and delicate beer that is deliciously refreshing in any season IBU
The name Grey Lady comes from the nickname for the often foggy island on which it is brewed This hazy Belgian style Wit emits complex nose with sophisticated notes

Our quest was to make the best white ale we ever tasted with the complex flavors of classic witbier all brewed with pure Icelandic water for cool smoothness that is deliciously refreshing Wheat malt pilsner malt oats bavarian noble hops spiced with coriander and orange peel

Previously known as Wahoo Wheat AleA fresh unfiltered brew perfect for lazy summer days Our Wahoo White is brewed with unfiltered un malted wheat and oats that give it distinctive cloudy complexity True to the Belgian tradition this Witbier boasts refreshing citrusy flavor thanks to the orange peel and coriander we add to the boil This makes Wahoo an ideal beer for year round beach weather

Boulevard summer seasonal is our interpretation of classic Belgian witbier ZŌN Flemish for sun combines the subtle flavors of coriander and orange peel with other traditional ingredients to create delightful refreshing summertime brew IBU

Our interpretation of this classic and refreshing Belgian style ale is brewed with pilsner and wheat malts Freshly ground coriander and Curacao orange peel along with special Wit yeast strain contribute wonderful orange and citrus aromas and crisp yet silky mouthfeel IBU

This So Cal take on traditional witbier honors Coronado main street which is home to our brewpub and was once lined with orange trees Bolstered by orange zest coriander and orange blossom honey it Belgium by way of Coronado Expect refreshing light bodied brew rife with citrus zing and hint of earthy spice
Formerly White Sun Wit

They say there are two sides to every story and that certainly true of Two Jokers Double Wit On the one hand it a revival of the classic Belgian wit or white ale with lactic fermentation providing refreshing tartness On the other hand it a modern uniquely American brew big flavorful and spiced with cardamom coriander orange peel lavender and grains of paradise IBU

Also know as Mom Hefeweizen Ingredients Malts Great Western Harrington Klages and Wheat Hops Saaz Specialty Coriander and Ginger Yeast Water Rogue Pacman Yeast Free Range Coastal Water º PLATO IBU AAº Lovibond
This UNFILTERED Belgian ish Wit ly esque ish ness brew features dry twang of hoppy bitterness and is perfect for the summertime drinking

When it comes to our beers and the ingredients we use we give wit So rather than spinning just the same fruit wheel of the classic Curaçao orange peel we punched up our wit with the dynamic duo of tangerine and kaffir lime leaf The fruit forward aromatics and flavors are perfectly balanced so you don have to bother adding slice or leaf to the rim of your glass Even with this lack of unnecessary garnish you won find an absence of intense fruit

Upland Wheat Ale is classic rendition of the Belgian Witbier white beer style We brew it with organic coriander and orange zest to be light on the tongue and refreshingly tart In the tradition of the Belgian Wit style Upland Wheat Ale is unfiltered allowing suspended yeast to create cloudy golden appearance This is an everyday every meal type of beer It comforting on cold winter day and refreshing on hot summer evening That why it one of our most popular brews and flagship beer of our brewery

Brown Ale aged in used Pinot Noir barrels from local Sonoma County wineries It is aged for about months with sour cherries brettanomyces lactobacillus and pediococcus added to each barrel Flavors from the cherries Pinot Noir and oak balance each other nicely with little funk from the brett
Dark ale aged in Cabernet Sauvignon barrels with Brett Lacto Pedio and currants

A blonde ale fermented with special strain of yeast then aged in French oak chardonnay barrels Flavors of wine and oak absorb into the brew throughout twelve months of aging During this aging process secondary fermentation occurs using yeast strain disliked by most brewers and winemakers called Brettanomyces

This beer is very unique and inspired by breweries in the Lambic region of Belgium and especially our friends at Cantillon It is spontaneously fermented meaning yeast is not added Once the beer is brewed it is transferred to cool ship or horny tank located in our barrel room at the pub There it sits overnight and collects whatever funky wild yeast and bacteria may be living in the room The next day it is transferred to oak wine barrels where it ferments wildly and ages for few months The end result is wild spontaneously fermented sour and tasty hand crafted beer

Petrus Aged Pale is beer from our foeders Michael Jackson the beer hunter chose the name in the late s and he was the first to sell this beer in his beer clubs Today it is still the reference for sour beers in the US Petrus Aged Pale has won multiple gold medals in beer competitions worldwide Moreover ever since the start of the brewery the beer has been used as blending beer with other beers to give them fresh slightly sour flavors and aromas Aged in Oak foeders for over months

We brewed this ale with around rye as base malt and let our sour yeast and bacteria eat away at it in oak barrels for over year creating sour ale with complex character of rye spice oak and subtle funk

Tart of Darkness is traditional stout that we aged in used oak barrels from The Bruery that had previously housed beers such as Cuivre or Black Tuesday We then brought them over to Bruery Terreux added our special blend of souring bacterias and wild yeasts and watched nature take its course The result is perfectly tart yet awesomely dark and roasty sour stout Not style you will see very often and in our opinion not style seen often enough This unique stout has notes of tart plums roasted coffee vanilla and oak
A sour beer barrel aged for two years and then dry hopped with Amarillo and Cascade hops for days

Atrial Rubicite is made from well water barley wheat hops farmhouse yeast native yeast from the Texas hill country souring bacteria and raspberries It alcohol by volume has finishing gravity of and is pH It is unfiltered unpasteurized and bottle conditioned Atrial Rubicite is our first beer to be packaged exclusively in ml bottles

Sang Noir is blend of imperial spiced red ales aged in bourbon and wine barrels with Bing cherries for up to two years Pouring deep mahogany brown this Northwest sour ale features rich flavors of dark roast malts bourbon black cherries and port wine

This NW style sour blond ale was barrel aged for up to nine months then aged on fresh apricot for an additional six months Aromas of sweet apricot blossoms and tart fruit are present as you draw the glass near Deep rich apricot flesh then tart apricot notes dance on the palate and lead to sweet apricot flesh finish with lingering fruit tartness
A rye beer aged in French oak Robert Craig Cabernet Sauvignon with blackberries and Brettanomyces

Blended dark strong ale with sour cherries aged in American oak and French oak red wine barrels Once upon time it was the most award winning Pizza Port beer of all time Now it has found new home at The Lost Abbey massive brown ale base that is made from four fermentable sugars including malted barley raisins candi sugar and sour cherries this beer is fully fermented before being placed in bourbon barrels where the beer ages for one year with the sour cherries and the wild Brettanomyces yeast that we inoculate the barrels

Framboise de Amorosa is our first foray into the world of raspberry beers It begins as Lost and Found ale and is sent into freshly emptied red wine barrels The beer spends over year in the wood during which time it is spiked with three additions of raspberries The first sip produces sweet start with long drawn out sour finish Some of the sweetness from the raspberries comes out before acidic notes join the mix On the back end of the beer is smoothing oak character which keeps the beer from becoming dull

Orange lactic and bursting with apricot aroma West Ashley is built for consideration and conversation While Ashley starts as simple Saison careful aging in French Oak Pinot Noir barrels with apricots our house microbes and warm encouragement transform her into tart complex and delectable beer

This barrel aged wild ale is named for our San Francisco neighborhood and pays tribute to the Flanders Red style of beer Aged in wine barrels this lightly tart ale is brewed with California Rainier cherries using house blend of wild yeasts bacteria and SF sourdough yeast Pair this complex ale with ripe figs blue cheese or seafood bouillabaisse
HOPS Tettnang MALTS PilsnerFruity notes from imported Belgian yeast swirl through precise souring Pucker up to bite of citrus laden tang ending with delectable experience

Naturally soured by farm valley winds blowing wild yeast into our oak casks Finally after year and half of patient coaxing Wisconsin dark malts whirl in kaleidoscope of cedar caramel and tart green plum exuberance Available to the exclusive few who travel off the beaten paths this is authentic Wisconsin sour brown ale Truly unique this Sour Ale is brewed for those who live on the wild side and is suitable for laying down or consuming immediately serve at

This Arcane Seal guards an enigmatic brew that is FUNKY DARK and SOUR If you choose to break the seal YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED Brettanomyces Dark beer fermented in stainless and aged in red wine barrels Brett is unique yeast strain that produces flavors that would be considered offensive if they were not intentional Flavors of sour cherry tobacco oak and classic Brett barnyard funk balanced by dark Munich malt chewiness Enjoy immediately or age at cellar temperature for couple years

Blonde Ale aged in Chardonnay barrels with brett lacto and pedio base beer is Temptation This sour barrel aged blonde ale has pounds per barrel of fresh raspberries to make beautiful reddish pink beer Nicely balanced with sweet raspberry and tartness This beer is made only once year in conjunction with our month long fundraiser for the Sutter Breast Care Services of Santa Rosa during Breast Cancer Awareness Month of the proceeds of this beer will be used to help men and women in our community in their fight against breast cancer Batch Sonambic base Batch present Temptation base
Ale with raspberry purée added and aged in oak barrels

Imperial Witbier ABV sour mashed days and fermented with blend of Berliner Weisse culture and Belgian Witbier yeast Beer is barrel fermented in large red wine barrels gal barrels Raspberries are added to the beer towards the end of fermentation directly to the barrel and aged on the raspberries for minimum of month The Berliner culture contains souring bacteria and the raspberries will add acidity to the beer Brewed to commemorate Bottleworks th Anniversary

We ve all come to know and love our barrel aged sour rye ale Sour in the Rye Now it time to enjoy bright variation of it that has kumquats added to the mix Not only is kumquat one of the most fun fruit names to roll off the tongue it also treats the entire palate to unique display of fruity characteristics The tart sweet citrus and tropical notes of both the kumquats and tangerine zest strike balance with the honey vanilla and woody character imparted from barrel aging At the same time the unique bitterness of the citrus fruit locks step with the clove and pepper notes imparted from the rye

Cherry pie Cherry pie Cherry pie This light and fruity ale is black in color though your palate would never know it Black Angel is fermented on the Wicked Wild yeast and then moved into stripped down Four Roses bourbon barrels and aged on tart cherries sweet cherries and Italian plums The white oak and roast malt add notes of vanilla and graham cracker that when blended with the tart sweetness of the fruit bring out robust cherry pie flavor
Funky Gold Mosaic is dry hopped sour ale We took Prairie Gold and dry hopped it with huge amount of Mosaic hops

This one of kind NW sour is blend of Belgian strong blondes aged in white port barrels with raspberries then blended with select barrels of strong blondes that were aged on the toasted meat from the apricot nut or Noyeaux IBU

Blonde American Wild Ale that was fermented and aged in Chardonnay barrels with Missouri grown White Peaches The Batch cocktail for fermentation includes both spontaneously captured yeast and bacteria from our family farm and our house wild blend

The Wanderer is special blend of oak aged ales that we made with Craig and Beth from San Francisco City Beer Store Blending mix of sour ales and our anniversary ale the base of this beer has delightfully sour tinge on top of hearty malt backbone To add to the flavor Craig and Beth selected blackberries and bing cherries to be added to the ale adding to it already fruity complexity This ale went on to win the silver medal for wood barrel aged sour fruited ales at the Great American Beer Festival

A Unique Dry Hopped Sweet Tart Sour Mash Ale We soured the wort on the Hot Side with Lactobacillus for few days and then brewed up this smooth and hoppy sour It tastes like big bowl of fruity candy or some chewable flavored vitamins but what the difference It sweet tart and sassy just like the tasty cherry pie that your favorite aunt makes For all the Aunt Sally out there You know who you are

Malt Beverage with Cherries Added and Aged in Oak BarrelsA blend of double red ales aged in oak barrels and foudres for up to months with Pinot Noir grapes from Oregon famed Willamette Valley wine region The most regal in our series of Sang projects Sang Royal captures complex notes of summer berry fruit plum oak and spice with vibrant acidity and soft tannic structure

This NW style sour ale blends wheat and blond ales that were oak aged in barrels for six months then additionally aged four months on fresh blueberries Huge herbal notes of dense blueberries in the nose give way to hints of oak and dusty floral note Rich earthy notes of dark fruit on the palate lead to tart finish that dries out to base note of blueberry skins

Montmorency and Balaton cherries from Michigan were added to mature sour barrel aged beer and allowed to referment to dryness Unfiltered unpasteurized and naturally conditioned Balaton is registered trademark of Michigan State University
The Vine is blend of sour wheat and blond ales aged in white wine barrels for up to months with Gewurztraminer grapes ABV seems to vary between

This sour ale is inspired by the agricultural history of the Santa Clara Valley Long before it became Silicon Valley it was known as the Valley of The Heart Delight fertile basin overflowing with fruit orchards Brewed with foraged apricots handpicked by the Garden To Table non profit this collaborative beer celebrates and supports their mission to promote urban farming in San Jose
Luscious ripe red raspberries are elegantly intertwined with bountiful amount of lactic acidity and delicate barrel nuances to cultivate this stunning sour ale
Full flavored dry champagne like farmhouse ale matured in oak whiskey and wine barrels with multiple strains of wild yeast and bacteria Look for lots of tropical fruit and funk with sour earthy edge
Golden sour blended with lychee fruit and Saigon cinnamon

Ale Refermented in Oak Barrels With Blackberries Nocturn Chrysalis Kiowa Blackberries from Oglesby Texas were added to oak barrels containing mature sour beer The beer was then allowed to referment to dryness Unfiltered unpasteurized and naturally conditioned

A sour brown ale inspired by the enigmatic monastic brews of Belgium and the mysterious mist shrouded jungles of the tropics Brewed with real cacao and spiced with cinnamon and sweet orange peel for sensual delight brew to be sipped savored and enjoyed
Kriek Lambic blended from three different aged beers up to years old aged in Woodcut barrels

FARM TO FACE was brewed as pale ale and fermented in stainless with our house yeast After primary fermentation pediococcus and lactobacillus were added along with lbs of peaches per gallon Ten months later the finshed beer is bright amber in color with peach graham cracker and green apple in the aroma Drinking this medium bodied beer is like biting into juicy peach with tartness throughout The finish has long lasting peachyness

Sans Pagaie translates to without paddle and is our take on the Belgian style kriek sour blonde ale aged in barrels with cherries The base beer has subtle funk that melds gently with the fruit giving this beer flavors reminiscent of coconut vanilla yogurt and of course fresh cherries complex beer perfect for warm California day in the park with slice of home made chocolate cake

FV marks our first venture into the world of foudre beers Foudres are giant oak tanks used for aging this one holds gallons FV is blend of wild yeast and bacteria base beer with lots of malt character and about four years of patience
Aged in oak barrels hand bottled corked caged bottled conditioned greater percentage of Cosmic Mother Funk was blended into this beer

Ale Refermented in Oak Barrels With Apricots Aurelian Lure California Apricots were added to oak barrels containing mature sour beer The beer was then allowed to referment to dryness Unfiltered unpasteurized and naturally conditioned
Shut up and listen Unfiltered unpasteurized and naturally conditioned Previously known as Barrel Aged Sour Black Metal Imperial Stout

This Northwest style sour is blend of spiced Quads Triples and Blondes aged in Bourbon and wine barrels for over months with orange peel and coriander Vlad offers fresh acidity and mild sweetness with flavors of citrus spice and rich oak Winner of the Silver Medal at the GABF ABV First Release ABVSecond Release Sept ABVThird Release

Pluots are some of our favorite fruits Created by cross breeding apricots and plums there are dozens of varieties with an amazing range of color and flavor All through the summer Blossom Bluff Orchards picks each variety at its peak Dapple Dandy Honey Punch Flavor Queen Black Kat Dapple Jack were all added to sour blonde ale and aged in wine barrels to create this funky oak aged brew

Old Fezziwig Rich Sweet Like the character that inspired it This beer is festive and worthy of celebration all its own Bursting with spices of the season its full body accompanies deep malt character with notes of sweet toffee and rich dark caramel

Do not open til Christmas Whoever coined that phrase obviously hasn tasted Christmas Ale fresh honey cinnamon and ginger flavors Yuletide worth of holiday spices and sweet honey to keep you wassailing all season long World Beer Championships Time Medal Winner Since Gold Silver

Available October to DecemberAlc by Vol IBUs Cocoa dried fruit and toffee notes robust ale with warming spice Bottle conditioned for quality Live yeast added to the bottle allows this beer to age gracefully and stay fresher longer Keep bottles upright and away from light heat calories per oz servingLabel artwork changes annually

This seasonal beer is limited edition brewed for the short days and long nights of winter The full body resulting from fermentation in stone Yorkshire squares and the luxurious malt character which will appeal to broad range of drinkers is balanced against whole dried Fuggle and Golding hops with nuances and complexities that should be contemplated before an open fire

Winter Solstice is our take on the classic style of winter warmer Boasting deep amber hue and rich mouthfeel its creamy finish will lift your spirits Hints of toffee spice and caramel tease the senses making this the perfect ale to share with friends and family during the cold days and long nights of winter

Our winter offering is here to quell your shivers and get you through the coldest of nights rich marriage of hops and barley to cast light upon the evening and melt your mind out of the snowdrifts Old Man Winter earthy hue and thickness lace around the glass inviting you to linger in its warmth and share the spirits of the season with your friends and family deceptively strong brew it best to sit and ponder with this old man sip by sip ABV Fermentation Ale yeast three varieties of hops two varieties of maltsColor Brown with ruby hues Roasted malts touch of smoke pepper some floral hopsFlavor Hints of bittersweet cocoa nutty defined malts and balancing hopsBitterness Moderate IBU Availability Nov Dec

When you bring glass of this dark copper ale to your lips to take your first sip you will notice the aroma of cinnamon There is no aromatic hop added that might overpower the distinct spice scent The medium body of this beer is formed from caramel and pale malts These create enough body to support the spices without making the beer excessively rich Bittering hops are added to counter the sweetness of the malt and spice The finish of the beer is blend of cinnamon and nutmeg The combination of these two spices results in balanced pumpkin pie flavor IBU

Like FDR Depression era radio addresses which were like kick in the butt and hug at the same time our Fireside Chat is subtle twist on the traditional seasonal brew We begin with rich dark English style ale and then we improvise with spices until we know we have beer worth sharing with the nation Fireside Chat is our early winter seasonal brew available from October through December in six pack cans and on draft Brewed like classic warming Strong Ale but with subtle blend of hand selected spices for just the right festive flair

The chill of Colorado high country winter calls for beer with extra flavor and strength Here it is At over alcohol with sturdy texture and rich flavors of caramel and chocolate our holiday seasonal is the fermented equivalent of good fire
availability Late Oct Early Jan bitterness IBUalcohol by volume original gravity PLATOmalts Pale Caramel L L Munich L Carapils Dark Chocolatehops Bittering AlchemyAroma Simcoe Cascade

Regardless of whether you spend your winter months on the slopes shoveling your driveway or just hiding out Redhook Winterhook is great way to chase off the winter chill This year will be our th consecutive release of Winterhook The recipe changes slightly every winter because nobody likes getting the exact same Holiday present year after year Redhook th brew of Winterhook has roasted chocolate notes that smooth out the quick spicy hop finish The rich body and nutty malty backbone make this winter ale slighty naughty and very nice IBU

Nutcracker Ale is Boulevard holiday gift for real beer lovers This hearty warming brew is classic winter ale deep amber in color with hints of molasses balanced by the spiciness of freshly harvested Chinook hops IBU

Deep mahogany in color our full bodied winter warmer is brewed in the spirit of British winter ales Crafted with flurry of roasted chocolate and caramel malts and generously hopped it delivers smooth finish that makes this beer the perfect cold weather companion

deep mahogany color Wassail is brewed with four different malts and blend of Pacific Northwest hops giving it malty full body and pleasantly hoppy finish that appeals to both hop and malt lovers alike In other words Christmas miracle ABV IBU
Formerly Cruiser Winter Ale

Elf is holiday cheer in liquid form Spicy aromas like cinnamon and clove give this dark brown winter warmer proper holiday welcome Balanced between malt hops and spice at ABV this beer goes great with all holiday foods from sweet snacks to the roast beast
A strong ale brewed with generous amounts of rich malt coupled with taint of cinnamon and mace

This beer name sums up the idea of bringing the best together to celebrate It is filled with seasonal flavors from generous amounts of toasted and caramel malts mixed with equally generous amounts of honey cinnamon ginger and nutmeg We feel it is the perfect libation filled with flavors of the season

Our Christmas Ale is warming winter ale that blends the spices of the season with sweet caramel malt Orange peel juniper berries ginger root cardamom and cloves are added for spiciness We use honey in the fermentation process which raises the ABV without producing too much heat from the alcohol content Many breweries produce richer higher alcohol beers for the winter holiday season bolder than their year round offerings The inspiration for this beer came from spiced holiday beverages such as wassail and mulled wines Around the holidays the sweet and spicy aromas not to mention the booze in such libations tend to smooth the rougher edges of enjoying each other company and spreading goodwill IBU

Two words describe winter in our neck of the woods cold dark and snowy Just the way we like it At ABV Powder Hound Winter Ale gives just the right amount of warmth balanced by its rich taste and generous dose of Hallertau Palisade and Amarillo hops After cold day of getting it done or just relaxing the avalanche of flavor will have you saying these four words ll have another Powder Hound
November Release English dark ale aged in bourbon barrels fresh American oak dark malts English hops sweet smooth vanilla oak finish

This malty full bodied red ale is made with traditional mulling spices Ginger Clove All Spice Cinnamon Nutmeg If this one doesn get you into the Christmas spirit you truly are Scrooge Bottled OG IBUs ABVCanned OG IBUs ABV

The essence of Christmas is captured in this very bottle Perfectly blended spices compliment Frosted Frog rich malt flavors creating the ultimate Christmas experience Celebrate the holidays as you savor this very special seasonal offering

Once upon frozen evening way up north sweet local honey named Holly inspired our Jolly Fat Man as only Holly can to create this festive spiced holiday ale We think you will enjoy this holiday creation with it aromas and flavors of Christmas day Sweet malt ginger honey and cinnamon spice Sip this by the fire with your significant other Who knows maybe it will lead to little inspiration of your own From our Jolly Fat Man to yours Happy Holidays Chill out man have beer Matt Chris Glenn

In the US this is called Winter Ale dark ale brewed specially for the Christmas season with rich complex taste of caramel This is strong dark and rather sweet Christmas Beer just the way we think Christmas beer should be IBU Ingredients Lager Munich caramel black and chocolate malt Chinook Columbus and Centennial hops English ale yeast and our local Grimstad water

Our Lions Winter Ale combines premium malt with aromatic specialty hops The vanilla like finish of this robust ale is great excuse to get out of the cold and enjoy BC favourite winter beer made from the finest natural ingredients

Collaboration with Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales Stone BrewingIngredients Malted Barley malted Rye malted oats hops white sage caraway Juniper berries chestnuts yeast First brewed July Batch Brewed with Stone and Jolly Pumpkin Brewed at Nøgne Ø Also brewed at Stone Escondido California USA and Jolly Pumpkin Dexter Michigan USA

This deep mahogany red strong ale is classic example of winter warmer that high in alcohol and rich in taste An excellent balance of malty sweetness and hoppy bitterness gives aromas of Christmas cake with hints of black treacle and vine fruits

A new season means new adventures We created Stir Crazy Porter to warm you from within during the coldest time of year Bundle up and enjoy Our sturdy porter is brewed with layers of malty goodness giving it adark brown hue and satisfying notes of roasted malt chocolate and caramel

This hearty American pale ale contains rich blend of spices that warms the soul on cold winter night Chill the mug stoke the fire and savor this quality seasonal brew Available only during the Winter season

This is the forty fifth annual Our Special Ale from the brewers at Anchor This ale made with natural flavors is sold only from early November to mid January Its recipe and hand drawn tree change every year but the intent with which we offer it remains the same joy and celebration of the newness of life Since ancient times trees have symbolized the winter solstice when the earth with its seasons appears born anew This year tree is western arborvitae tree of life an evergreen conifer native to Northern California

Chanukah Beer pours rich crystal clear chestnut to ruby color with light creamy head The aroma and flavors lean toward robust winter warmer though brewed without any spices Just all malt and hop goodness Light caramel and toasty nuttiness as well as hint of sweeter chocolate are rounded out by healthy dose of European Noble and classic American new school hops With malts hops and alcohol this beer is real wonder with so many elements blending to create balanced and yet still distinct flavors Hanukkah Beer is brewed as celebration offering and sure to light up your holiday season Chaim

The essence of Christmas is captured in this very bottle Perfectly blended spices compliment Frosted Frog rich malt flavors creating the ultimate Christmas experience Celebrate the holidays as you savor this very special seasonal offering
